Description: Tackling health inequalities for children and young people has never been more important with NHS England Core20plus5 approach giving a steer and direction from the top The rising cost of living and the COVID-19 pandemic have also exacerbated existing inequalities for children and young people against the backdrop of 4.2 million children already living in poverty in the UK in 2021-22.  As the health and care system continues to grapple with a host of operational and strategic issues during deeply challenging times and with increasing competing pressures on the Integrated Care System (ICS) budgets, this conference will explore how to ensure that the voice and needs of children and young people and equitable resource allocation are central in the strategic decision-making process. Due to be held in person early next year, this in-person event will attract a wide-ranging audience from central and local government, the NHS, local government, private and third sector organisations, and people with lived experience. This event is being held in partnership with Barnardo‚Äôs Yes. Please select your tickets and once you're through to the registration form, you can amend the 'payment method' from credit card to 'pay by invoice' . Please note, there is a ¬£20+VAT surcharge to cover the cost of processing invoices. This is an addition to the ticket price and will be added to your invoice. There is one invoice fee per order, not per ticket. There is no charge for paying by debit or credit card. Cancellations confirmed in writing more than 14 days before the first live session will be refunded in full via the same payment method. We regret that no refund can be made after that date, however, if you contact us before the event start, we can offer a transfer of your ticket to another event taking place in the following six months. Please email us at events@kingsfund.org.uk with confirmation of your original booking to cancel or transfer your ticket. On completion of the confirmed booking the delegate and their supporting organisation are liable for the fees for the event (regardless of whether payment has been made). If you have any questions about this event, please contact The King's Fund events team at events@kingsfund.org.uk. The King‚Äôs Fund privacy policy
Title: Time for action: addressing health inequalities for children & young people
Subtitle: Time for action: addressing health inequalities for children and young people  (in-person conference)

Description: Join our next ElevateHer event - an exciting in person event celebrating International Women's Day and supporting gender parity! This is an event for men and women - after all it isn't just a social issue that impacts women, its an economic one that impacts all of us: ‚ÄúIt's so important to bring gender parity to our countries and to our lives ‚Äì for more productivity and a better economy for everybody.‚Äù - was the quote that came out of The World Economic Forum this year. The Forum‚Äôs Global Gender Gap Report 2023, which measures four key gender gaps, found that the Economic Participation and Opportunity gap has only closed by just over 60%. But the longer it takes to close, the more the global economy is missing out. In 2020, the World Bank found that potential gains from closing economic gender gaps could unlock a ‚Äúgender dividend‚Äù of $172 trillion for the global economy. Join us at Rise London on Luke Street for a day filled with empowering talks from a panel that will inspire and uplift each other as we strive for equality as an industry. We will be joined by Lucy Heavens, Women of FinTech Ambassador who will moderate the panel below to talk about how women can inspire one another at each stage of their career: Hannah Pring CCO Lockton Laura Coote Business Execution Consultant Wells Fargo Nombuso Matsape Head of Global Markets IT Operations ICBC Standard Bank Tiffany Appiah FinTech Student   Your registration details will be shared with both organisers for the event - Women of FinTech and Rise
Title: ElevateHer - International Women's Day Event - Inspire inclusion in FinTech
Subtitle: Join us for our next ElevateHer event for International Women's Day Event to inspire inclusion in FinTech

Description: From Palaces of Art to the Studios of Bohemia: Artists‚Äô houses in Victorian Kensington and Chelsea The second half of the 19th century was a great time to be a painter. More people bought art than ever before and the most successful artists, like Leighton and Luke Fildes, were showered with public honours and earned incomes that by today‚Äôs standards made them millionaires. They commissioned magnificent, purpose-built studio houses in the leafy suburbs of Holland Park and Kensington. The less wealthy and more unconventional, like Rossetti and Whistler, gravitated towards Chelsea, occupying picturesque old buildings that lined the riverside or innovative new studio‚Äôs in Tite Street. This lecture reviews the two most famous artists‚Äô colonies - Melbury Road, Kensington and Cheyne Walk and Tite Street, Chelsea - and explores the lives and interiors of the painters who lived there. Jo Banham is a freelance curator, lecturer and writer. Previously she worked at the V&A, National Portrait Gallery, and Tate Britain as Head of Public Programmes. She is currently writing a book on the History of Wallpaper. FAQs How do I get to St Mary Abbots, Kensington? On foot...St Mary Abbots church is on the corner of Kensington Church Street, and Kensington High Street - opposite Wholefoods / the Barkers building. By bus...Buses stopping close to the church : Bus Routes: 9, 10, 27, 28, 49, 52, 70, 328, 452, C1 By underground...The nearest Underground station is High Street Kensington on the District and Circle Lines (4 minutes walk). Notting Hill Gate on the Central Line is also within walking distance. None all of these stations can be accessed by people in wheelchairs. How can I contact the organiser with any questions? Please contact Ruth Miller by email at events@victoriansociety.org.uk before the day of the event. This event helps raise funds for The Victorian Society - the only charity dedicated to fighting for our Victorian and Edwardian heritage. Funds raised from events and memberships allow us to employ expert caseworkers to reply to thousands of planning applications a year in our role as a statutory consultee in the planning system. We help tackle the climate emergency by campaigning for the sensitive reuse of historic buildings to generate much lower carbon emissions than demolition and rebuild. Join us today and safeguard our unique cultural heritage for future generations! For further information, click here. Image: H. Teffry-Dunn, Rossetti at 16 Cheyne Walk
Title: Artists‚Äô Houses in Victorian Kensington and Chelsea, by Jo Banham
Subtitle: This lecture reviews the two most famous artists‚Äô colonies in Kensington and Chelsea.

Description: Join us for a discussion exploring solidarity networks established during and in the time since 1984/85 Miners‚Äô Strike.¬† Building on the annual Friends of Durham Miners‚Äô Gala fundraising dinner, Redhills and Left Book Club present an event marking the 40th anniversary of the 1984/85 Miners‚Äô strike. During the strike, mining communities established national and international solidarity networks, finding common cause with other organising movements. The most famous being the relationship with Lesbians and Gay Support the Miners, the story of which is celebrated in the film Pride.¬† Solidarity Through the Decades is a panel event featuring voices from the strike - and those who have come since and been inspired by the experience of the conflict.¬† With an introduction from Durham Miners‚Äô Association the event will feature National Union of Miners General Secretary Chris Kitchen, an exploration of the connection between LGSMiners and LGSMigrants, Women Against Pit Closures and Redhills Durham Miners Hall. Chaired by Left Book Club the event will draw on the strike as a historic moment with much to reflect the challenges facing the UK in 2024.¬† Left Book Club x Redhills Tuesday 12th March 2024, 6PM Ev Restaurant (The Arches, 98 Isabella St, London, SE1 8DD)London
Title: Solidarity Through the Decades: 40 Years of the 1984/85 Miners' Strike
Subtitle: This event is co-organised by Redhills Durham and Left Book Club

Description: In partnership with Kea New Zealand and hosted by Killik & Co. we‚Äôre proud to announce our International Women‚Äôs Day 2024 event. When we inspire others to understand and value women's inclusion, we create a better world. The aim for IWD 2024 #InspireInclusion is to collectively forge a more inclusive world for women. Our panel will tackle the theme of Inpiring Inclusion and discuss what this means to them. Join us for a glass of wine, nibbles and an opportunity to connect and be inspired. About our hosts Killik & Co is an independently-owned wealth management firm that specialises in helping families achieve their financial goals, from getting started with investing, to planning for retirement. To find out more about their services and how they can help you visit their website. About our panel Chantelle Nicholson Chantelle moved to London in 2004 to pursue a career as a chef. Starting at the Savoy Grill then moved to P√©trus, Gilbert Scott, Tredwells, a pop up, 'All's Well'.In 2021 Chantelle closed Treadwells to open a space that aligned with her ethos of running a business with purpose.In April 2022 Chantelle opened Apricity, in Mayfair, London. Apricity focuses on the circular economy, and is a business based on the pillars of people, planet, purpose, and profit. In 2023, Apricity was awarded a coveted Michelin Green Star.Chantell has a strong passion for sustainability & consciousness - what we eat, where we source it from, & how we eat. Kiri Haggart Kiri is the Managing Director for Feed Me Light and plume.tv. Feed Me Light Ltd is an award winning London based creative studio. Kiri manages a team of talented, like-minded people who specialise in animation. From storyboarding, illustrations, 2D & 3D animation, filming, post production, print, video games and VR her team have worked with comanies like Sainsburys, Netflix and Adobe to name a few.Lisa Miles-Heal Lisa Miles-Heal is the CEO of cloud accounting software Silverfin. Following a period of strong growth, she oversaw its acquisition by the leading tech company in Europe, Visma, in 2023. As a female leader in the technology industry, she is entrepreneurial, growth focussed and keen to see her teams and customers thrive. She has held a number of technical, operational and business leadership posts, alongside starting a consultancy business in the past. Alongside her full time role she makes time to advise and support founders and executives in several scaling software businesses in NZ, AU and Europe. A special thanks to Lowrise Brewery for providing us with their delicious beer and the award winning Forrest Wines for with their outstanding wine. We would also like to thank Sarah Smart at The Collective for providing us with treats and very talented Mae Cermaics by Lilly Maetzig you can look at her beautiful collection here. About NZBWN The New Zealand Business Women‚Äôs Network (NZBWN) is built on a network of over 2,500 members and volunteers who are committed to learning, connecting and inspiring. Whether that be through small or large events, mentoring, workshops or training, the magic of our network is that we bring together like-minded Kiwi women giving them a taste of home, while on the opposite side of the world. While the majority of our members are in the UK, we have a growing New Zealand group. About Kea New Zealand Kea New Zealand nurtures a vibrant and diverse community who share a strong passion for New Zealand and the success of its people and businesses. Join Kea to have full access to Kea tools and services, including the Kea Connect service, job portal and event portal. Find out more and register for free on the Kea website keanewzealand.com or contact Kea directly at info@keanewzealand.com. About International Women‚Äôs Day International Women's Day is a global day celebrating the social, economic, cultural and political achievements of women. Proudly celebrating it‚Äôs 110 year anniversary - with the first IWD event held exactly 110 years ago in 1911 in Austria, Denmark, Germany and Switzerland. More than one million women and men attended IWD rallies campaigning for women's rights to work, vote, be trained, to hold public office and end discrimination.
Organizer: The New Zealand Business Women's Network
Title: International Women's Day #InspireInclusion
Subtitle: This year the theme for International Women's Day is #InspireInclusion. Our panel will discuss their thoughts on this important theme.

Description: The UK‚Äôs leading green industrialist Dale Vince OBE will be in conversation with Ava Santina Evans about his Sunday Times best-selling book Manifesto. The book is a blend of personal memoir and mission statement, charting Dale‚Äôs unique journey from a new age traveller and environmental visionary, to becoming a leading light in green energy and global politics. The new edition is a true call to action, with new chapters encouraging young people to vote, with the inclusion of a QR code at the back with a link to register to vote. Dale will be discussing the new edition of his book in conversation with Ava Santina Evans, a political correspondent at PoliticsJOE, a digital-first news publisher aimed at 18-35s. Based in Westminster, she covers UK politics and trade unions. Before this, she was the lead producer of the James O‚ÄôBrien programme on LBC Radio and a broadcast journalist with the BBC. She is a regular contributor on the BBC, Sky News, ITV‚Äôs Good Morning Britain and TalkTV. Following the in conversation talk and Q&A, Dale will be signing books which will be available to buy at the event sold by local independent bookshop Ink@84. Tickets ¬£5 to include refreshments on arrival. All proceeds to be donated to Islington Climate Centre. There will be 50 seats first come first serve, with 20 standing places available.
Title: Dale Vince In Conversation With Ava Santina Evans
Subtitle: The UK‚Äôs leading green industrialist Dale Vince will be in conversation about his Sunday Times best-selling book Manifesto.

Description: Join us to celebrate the bicentenary of Bed≈ôich Smetana, the Czech composer whose melodies have echoed through generations and whose music includes the enchanting cycle of symphonic poems My Country and the popular opera The Bartered Bride. Delve into Smetana's fascinating journey with us as we explore his tumultuous life, his unwavering nationalist spirit, and his enduring impact on the Czech musical heritage. From the heartrending strains of his orchestral works to the poignant tales woven into his operas, Smetana's oeuvre captures the essence of Czech identity and resilience. Our distinguished panel of experts, including Jan Smaczny, emeritus professor at Queen's University Belfast, Dr. Thomas Jaermann, composer and musicologist, and Sandra Bergmannov√°, Director of the Bed≈ôich Smetana Museum, will reveal the mysteries behind Smetana's life and work. Tom√°≈° Hanus, Music Director of Welsh National Opera will discuss (via ZOOM from Brno) the latest production of Smetana's opera Dalibor, directed by Sir David Pountney in Brno which he conducted. Chaired by John Allison, Editor of Opera magazine. Part of the Year of Czech Music and Smetana 2024. In collaboration with the Czech Tourism. Sandra Bergmannov√° is the Head of the Bed≈ôich Smetana Museum ‚Äì National Museum in Prague. She is one of the main authors of the exhibition Famous Czech Composers (2020-2022) and the books of the same name in Czech and English. In the research on the life and work of Bed≈ôich Smetana she specializes on creating of the online catalogue of works and is head of the project of the critical edition of the 3rd volume of Smetana‚Äôs correspondence (1875-1879). Previously she worked as a musicologist at the Bohuslav Martin≈Ø Institute in Prague, where she stood at the beginning of the crucial projects, such as: digitisation of Bohuslav Martin≈Ø‚Äôs works, Martin≈Ø database online, and Bohuslav Martin≈Ø Complete Critical Edition. Tom√°≈° Hanus, Music Director of the Welsh National Opera, is recognised as one of the Czech Republic‚Äôs most exciting and important conductors. He has conducted at major European opera houses including the Wiener Staatsoper, Bayerische Staatsoper Munich, Royal Danish Opera, Oslo Opera House, Teatro Real Madrid and the Teatro alla Scala. In demand as a conductor of symphonic music, he has conducted many prestigious orchestras including the LSO, SWR Symphonieorchester Baden-Baden, Czech Philharmonic, and the BBC Symphony Orchestra. He opened the 2023 Prague Spring Festival with WNO Orchestra with Smetana‚Äôs Ma Vlast. In February 2024 Tom√°≈° returned to the Brno Theatre with a new production of Dalibor. Originally from Zurich, Switzerland, Dr Thomas Jaermann obtained a PhD in musicology from the University of Zurich for his research on music and national identity. His postdoctoral research resulted in the award of the inaugural Recognition Prize from the G. A. Derungs Foundation for his compilation of a catalogue of the complete works by Swiss composer Gion A. Derungs. Since moving to the UK, Thomas has taught music and German at independent schools in the London and South East areas. His current research involves the life and work of composer Bed≈ôich Smetana and his most recent invited paper on Smetana was presented as part of the 2023 international conference on Bed≈ôich Smetana and European Opera in Litomy≈°l, and is due to be published in 2024. Thomas also composes music including piano, chamber music and orchestral film scores. Jan Smaczny is well known as an authority on many aspects of Czech music. His publications include books on Dvorak‚Äôs B-minor Cello Concerto, the repertoire of the Prague Provisional Theatre, many articles, chapters and major encyclopaedia entries on Czech music and culture as well as edited volumes on Irish Music and Bach‚Äôs B-minor Mass. Jan is a graduate of Oxford University and studied for two years at the Music Faculty of the Charles University, Prague. He is the Sir Hamilton Harty Professor of Music Emeritus at Queen‚Äôs University, Belfast. Chair: John Allison is Editor of Opera magazine and a music critic with a special interest in the culture of Central and Eastern Europe. He was born in South Africa and completed his PhD while playing the piano and working as assistant organist at Cape Town cathedral. Since moving to London in 1989 he has written for publications around the world, authored books and served on the juries of many international competitions. He co-founded the International Opera Awards in 2013.
Title: Smetana Unveiled: Exploring the Man, the Music and the Myths
Subtitle: Join us to celebrate the bicentenary of Bed≈ôich Smetana, the Czech composer whose melodies have echoed through generations

Description: Women in Construction Join us for an exciting event celebrating the incredible women in the construction industry! This in-person event will take place in Mayfair London, UK, bringing together female professionals, industry leaders, and aspiring builders. We are fast approaching sell out of tickets so please act fast and purchase now. Embark on a transformative experience on March 12th 2024 as we celebrate the resilience and achievements of women in the construction industry at our exclusive luncheon event, "Breaking Barriers." Join us for an afternoon filled with inspiration, networking, and a captivating presentation by our distinguished speaker, Faye Allen. Keynote Speaker: Faye Allen30 years of ExperienceDirector at J.S. HeldChartered Quantity SurveyorGlobal Leader in Construction Expert Witnesses Highlights:Faye's Inspiring Journey: From Trainee Quantity Surveyor to Industry LeaderAdvocate for Gender Equality: Initiatives, Achievements, and the Equal Representation for Experts PledgePhilanthropy in Action: Faye's Latest Project ‚Äì A Book on Transforming the Construction Industry Event Experience:3-Course Meal Luncheon:Indulge in an exquisite culinary experience with a carefully curated 3-course meal. Enjoy the ambiance of The Mural Bar while savoring each delectable course, specially crafted to enhance your networking experience. Handpicked Sponsors:Our event is made possible by the support of handpicked sponsors who share our commitment to diversity and innovation in the construction industry. Explore their contributions during the event and connect with industry leaders. Date & Time:March 12th, 202412:00 PM - 3:30pm Venue: The Mural Bar, Langans Brasserie, Mayfair, LondonFlooded with natural daylightOpulent space featuring the artwork of France-Lise McGurn Stratton StreetMayfairLondonW1J 8LB Opposite Green Park Tube Station. Why Attend?Gain insights from Faye Allen's 30 years in the industryNetwork with high-net worth individuals, also like-minded professionalsEnjoy a gourmet 3-course mealConnect with handpicked sponsors Registration:Limited seats available - SOLD OUT!  Connect with Us:Follow us on social media: https://www.linkedin.com/company/affinity-construction-collaboration/ For enquiries, please email us at: Sponsorship: The Honourable Richard Evans richard@octaviusgb.com General Enquiries: Juna Margariti info@octaviusgb.com Don't miss this opportunity to indulge in an exceptional luncheon, connect with industry leaders, and be part of the conversation that is reshaping the future of construction. Let's build a more equitable future together! A few words about our guest speaker Faye Allen: 30 Years of Shaping the Future in Construction For three decades, Faye Allen has been a trailblazer in the construction industry. Starting as a trainee quantity surveyor at 18, she ascended the ranks, showcasing unparalleled dedication and expertise. Today, Faye is a Director at J.S. Held, a highly experienced Chartered Quantity Surveyor with a remarkable track record. Her journey has evolved into a testament to breaking glass ceilings in construction. Faye's role extends beyond traditional boundaries. She navigates complex disputes, offering support to construction and engineering clients globally. Her prowess in expert witness roles, high-value disputes, and international dispute resolution has solidified her reputation. In addition to her impactful career, Faye has committed herself to advancing gender equality in construction. Recognised by Whose Who Legal and elevated to a Director at Arcadis in 2021, Faye's influence is felt worldwide. As a United Nations UK Delegate for CSW67, she addresses critical themes like innovation, technological change, and education for gender equality. Faye's concerns, shared on LinkedIn, echo the urgency for change, with the UN projecting gender equality 300 years away. Faye's dedication extends to her company's commitment to the Equal Representation for Experts Pledge. A member of the Global Steering Committee, she champions equity for female experts in Quantum, Delay, Engineering, and more. Her advocacy doesn't stop there. Faye actively speaks against injustice in the workplace, sharing insights at events like London Build and The Inspiring Women in Construction Awards. Her passion transcends borders, reaching schools and tertiary institutions, where she serves as a STEM Ambassador, inspiring the next generation. In her latest endeavor, Faye is penning a book on her 30 years in the industry. Through extensive research, she delves into the experiences of women in construction, identifying challenges and proposing solutions. Her ultimate goal is to reshape the industry into a fair and equitable space for everyone, regardless of gender, race, or background. Faye Allen is not just a professional; she is a catalyst for positive change in the construction landscape. #WomenInConstruction #BreakingBarriers #FayeAllenEvent See our impressive launch October 2023 at the House of Lords, Parliament in London.  Founded by The Honourable Richard Evans.. AFFINITY facilitates seamless information exchange among key stakeholders in the construction sector, fostering collaboration and enabling the sharing of crucial insights on topics ranging from ESG (Environmental, Social, & Governance) to modular construction. This platform serves as a dynamic hub, connecting professionals and allowing them to discuss vital aspects such as health and safety, sustainability, project management, and more. It presents a unique opportunity for networking and engagement at the highest level.
Title: Women in Construction Luncheon
Subtitle: Breaking Barriers: Women in Construction Luncheon with guest speaker Faye Allen

Description: In today's fiercely competitive job market, securing a coveted product management role requires more than just talent; you‚Äôll need insider knowledge and strategic preparation. Join us over drinks and pizza as we provide expert insights, practical advice, and networking opportunities to help you land your dream product job. Lina Kandinova With over 6 years of experience in various industries, Lina is a Senior Product Manager known for her enthusiasm, strategic thinking, and hands-on approach. She excels in creating a positive product culture that values teamwork, trust, and openness. Lorik Ibrahimi Healthcare, property, motoring and, now, fintech‚Ä¶ Lorik has built products in all of these industries. His product journey started with side projects and hackathon ideas that led to him meeting the UN President, all before he knew product management was a real job. He landed his first product role after he pitched for such a position to be created where he was working. They agreed and created the job ‚Äì and he got it. Florence Jumpp It was whilst studying experimental psychology at Oxford University that Florence developed a deep interest in the intersection between art and science ‚Äì a significant asset for anyone working in product. Combining this with a continuous learning mindset and experience in identifying, defining, and effectively solving problems, Florence is a product leader who has continuously delivered results. Florence began her product career reimagining how the world learns at Encyclopedia Britannica. From there, she moved on to advance scientific discovery at Springer Nature, before her entrepreneurial spirit led to her disrupting the used car industry at Cazoo. More recently, she embarked on the challenge to grow fintech at Apple. Today, Florence leads product-led growth at Runa. 6:00 - 6:30pm: Arrival & networking 6:30 - 7:15pm: Routes into product with Q&A 7:15 - 7:30pm: Break & networking 7:30 - 8:30pm: CV Review and interview practice (in groups) Limited tickets available so secure your spot today! (all proceeds go to the charity, Mind.) If you would like to attend online, please buy a ticket here.
Organizer: Product management leader raising money for Mind!
Title: Breaking into Product Management IN PERSON
Subtitle: All proceeds go to the charity Mind! Join us as we provide insights, advice, and networking opportunities to help you land your dream job

Description: On March 12th, 2024, Piano Smithfield, Barbican London will be alive with an exhilarating exploration of jazz.  The evening begins with a showcase of Petra Haller's debut album, "Shoulders I Stand On," now on vinyl - a unique tapestry composed of rhythmic tap dance and harmonious piano melodies that break through conventional jazz barriers. Celebrated by Jazzwise magazine as a Rising Jazz Artist of 2020, Haller has been pushing creative boundaries by integrating tap dance into the jazz and improvised music scenes. Over the years, her auditory experiments in partnership with the gifted Meg Morley have yielded rich, rhythmic conversations, which got their full expression in the album "Shoulders I Stand On," recorded at Ocean Sound Studios in Giske, Norway, in November 2022. Comprising nine compelling tracks, "Shoulders I Stand On" brings to life an intriguing interplay between the rhythmic essence of tap dance and the harmonic charm of the piano. Whether it‚Äôs the nuanced exchange in tracks like "Forever and a Day," Morley's melodious contributions in "Call of the Birds" and "Fearless," or the intense tension in ‚ÄúThicker than Blood," the album stretches the boundaries of the contemporary jazz form. The latter half of the night unfolds into an immersive improvisational experience with the inaugural performance of Haller's new project, 'Orbit.' Renowned spoken word artist Jeffrey Durrant, alongside some of London's finest jazz musicians, engages in a spontaneous musical dialogue, unfenced by scripts or scores.In a stirring collaboration of sound and color, acclaimed artist Natalie Webb will be creating live art throughout the evening, adding another layer of dynamic expression to the performance.  This evening of robust rhythm and fluid form promises a visceral, multi-faceted adventure into the world of contemporary jazz. Doors open at 7 pm, music from 8pm.
Title: Petra Haller Double Bill:  "Shoulders I Stand On" Vinyl Release + " Orbit"
Subtitle: Join us on March 12, 2024, as we celebrate the vinyl release of "Shoulders I Stand On" and experience the premiere of "Orbit"

Description: This is the story of a year in which the record business appeared to be firing on all cylinders, when commercially the CD was in its imperial period, bringing in staggering sums of money for the global record business. The good times ‚Äì and they were phenomenal times, both culturally and financially ‚Äì looked like they would never end for record labels.Yet by December 1999, a bomb had been squarely set under their core business. All was to change with the arrival of digital. This is the true story and not simply the oft-repeated tale of an industry complacent and caught napping.Eamonn Forde is a freelance music business and technology journalist and has written about all areas of the music industry since 2001. His books with Omnibus Press include The Final Days of EMI: Selling the Pig and Leaving the Building: The Lucrative Afterlife of Music Estates. Eamonn will be in conversation with LAURA BARTON
Title: EAMONN FORDE - 1999 : THE YEAR THE MUSIC INDUSTRY LOST CONTROL
Subtitle: Book launch event: Eamonn Forde in conversation with Laura Barton

Description: We‚Äôre delighted to be joined by Ramie Targoff at Waterstones Piccadilly as we celebrate the publication of Shakespeare‚Äôs Sisters. Discover the lives and work of four ambitious renaissance women who made themselves heard and read in the time of Shakespeare. Targoff flings them open to uncover the treasures left by these extraordinary women; in the process, she helps us see the Renaissance in a fresh light, creating a richer understanding of history and offering a much-needed female perspective on life in Shakespeare's day. Ramie Targoff is the Jehuda Reinharz Professor of the Humanities and Co-Chair of Italian Studies at Brandeis University. She holds a B.A. from Yale University and Ph.D. from University of California, Berkeley. She is the author of several award-winning books on Renaissance English poetry, as well as a biography and translation of the sixteenth-century Italian poet Vittoria Colonna. Claire van Kampen is a composer, playwright and performer. She is currently the Globe Associate, at Shakespeare‚Äôs Globe Theatre and Senior Research Fellow for early Modern Music, and Creative Associate of the Old Vic theatre, London. Please note: Book and ticket option includes a copy of Shakespeare‚Äôs Sisters (RRP ¬£25) available for collection on the night.
Title: Ramie Targoff in conversation with Claire van Kampen at Piccadilly
Subtitle: We‚Äôre delighted to be joined by Ramie Targoff at Waterstones Piccadilly as we celebrate the publication of Shakespeare‚Äôs Sisters

Description: This Dance Movement Psychotherapy Taster evening will provide you with you an opportunity to understand more about the principles and practice of this exciting and transformative field of study. The evening will include presentations, lectures and experiential work under the expert supervision of our academic team. This course will give you an insight into the field, including what professional training options are available, and what the experience of being a professional practitioner entails.¬† This course is ideal for you if you are looking for an introductory overview on the field of Dance Movement Psychotherapy. The taster evening offers you a unique chance to explore the area in terms of how theory and practice are combined with the training and how this training becomes later relevant to the professional field. You will have an opportunity to talk with Lecturers from our MA Dance Movement Psychotherapy programme about range of aspects you may be interested in finding out more about, including course content and career development. There will be a particular focus on the psychodynamic orientation of Dance Movement Psychotherapy which we specialise in. This taster evening is suitable for those wishing to gain an initial insight, whether you are considering this field as a profession, or if you are generally interested in expanding your knowledge and experience. In addition to this course, or if you already have a good overview of this field, you may be interested in our Introduction to Dance Movement Psychotherapy course, which is a full day workshop. The course includes: ‚Ä¢ A presentation on Dance Movement Psychotherapy as an expressive arts therapy, including the essential elements of the training and the development of the professional field. ‚Ä¢ A lecture focusing on a particular area of practice, including a case study. ‚Ä¢ A practical movement session in which you get to experience an aspect of Dance Movement Psychotherapy ‚Ä¢ An opportunity for reflection, discussions and questions. The course takes place from 6-9pm live and on campus. **Due to the Taster evening being just 3 hours we do not issue certificates of attendance** ¬†
Title: Dance Movement Psychotherapy Taster Course | Goldsmiths University
Subtitle: This course is ideal for you if you are looking for an introductory overview on the field of Dance Movement Psychotherapy.

Description: Join us for an enchanting evening of **Poetry, Music, and Community** at the Queen Of The South Pub! As we celebrate 1 year of providng a platform for you amazing creatives what better way to celebrate than iviting some of our faves  Miss Yankey  with an exceptional bio, knkown across the globe for her profund talents will be our headline and our amazing features... Raggo Zulu Rebel Calm Carl  Tannika Taylor Myndstate Date: Tue Mar 12 2024 Time: 19:00:00 GMT+0000 (Greenwich Mean Time) Location: Queen Of The South Pub Open mic sign up on the door  Indulge in the mesmerizing blend of powerful words and soulful melodies as we celebrate the art of poetry and music. This event is a unique opportunity to connect with fellow enthusiasts and immerse yourself in a vibrant community of creative minds. Whether you're a seasoned poet, a talented musician, or simply appreciate the beauty of artistic expression, this event promises to ignite your imagination and leave you inspired. Feel free to bring your own original work to share or sit back and enjoy the captivating performances of others. Don't miss out on this extraordinary gathering! Join us at the Queen Of The South Pub on March 12th, 2024, and be a part of an unforgettable evening filled with creativity, passion, and the magic of words and music. Meet Miss Yankey, a Spoken Word Samurai who skillfully wields words to create captivating experiences. Her poetic prowess has taken her on a journey around the globe, leaving audiences mesmerized by her performances. With a mission to introduce Spoken Word to diverse spaces, Miss Yankey's words have graced TV, radio, theatre, and even the Tower of London. Miss Yankey's unwavering dedication has demonstrated that Spoken Word possesses transformative power, extending beyond poetry to effect positive change. Whether commanding the stage or leading empowering workshops, her words resonate deeply, sparking inspiration in individuals from all walks of life.
Title: When We Talk We Heals - Poetry Music Community
Subtitle: Brought to you by When We Talk We Heal, an enchanting evening of poetic melodies and a tight-knit community featuring Miss Yankey

Description: In recent years, two mining tailings dams collapsed in the state of Minas Gerais, causing Brazil's worst ever socio-environmental disasters. Hundreds were killed, millions were affected. Communities were displaced and two main rivers became mud, flooding the Atlantic Ocean with rejeito, or tailings, the toxic waste accumulated in massive dams over many years.Both dams that collapsed, in Mariana and Brumadinho districts, were operated by transnational mining giant Vale and certified safe by the state government of Minas Gerais, which is home to another 354 highly precarious dams. Further dam collapses threaten millions in Brazil who live below these ticking time bombs. The shocking images of the two mining tragedies were explored to exhaustion by mainstream media. The documentary ‚ÄúRejeito‚Äù, by Pedro de Filippis, points to the backstage and beyond following Teca, the sole citizen representative on the state environmental council. She voted against the certification of the dams which collapsed. Teca confronts the modus operandi of the government, while dam refugees resist mining companies‚Äô abuses in their threatened communities. After the film we will hear (on video) from residents of Barra Longa district whose health has been severally affected by exposure to toxic sludge that invaded their district.The panel will be formed by Ali Rocha from Brazil Matters, Paul Robson from London Mining Network (LMN) and Anabel Marin from Institute of Development Studies (IDS) who will discuss the social-environmental impacts of tailings dams for mineral extraction and how civil society resistance can lead to more sustainable policies and democratic governance.
Title: Rejeito - The Impact of Tailings Dams in Brazil
Subtitle: Film Screening and Panel Discussion on the Destructive Effects of Mining Waste and Dam Failures in Brazil

Description: Beni di Batasiolo is the largest family-owned wine producer in Italy‚Äôs Piedmont region. Since 1978, this esteemed winery has expanded to encompass over 320 acres of vineyards. The Dogliani family, with a legacy spanning three generations, works harmoniously with the land, prioritising the quality of their wines. Batasiolo‚Äôs vineyards thrive across nine beni (estates) in Piedmont. These estates, characterised by their unique soil, climate, and hillside positions, yield a diverse range of noble and elegant wines. Among their notable offerings is the Barolo DOCG, a wine that boldly expresses the essence of the Nebbiolo grape. Adding to the amazing wine selection and to the introduction from Francesco Dogliani, we came up with a suitable menu for you to enjoy your night to the fullest! _________ Wine and food menu: Spumante Metodo Classico Brut Millesim√©, 2016 Parmigiano Lollipops - Gavi del Comune di Gavi DOCG, Gran√©e 2022 Hazelnut, Fig & Gorgonzola Salad - Barolo DOCG, Riserva, 2012 Mushroom & Barolo Risotto - Barolo DOCG, La Morra, Vigneto Brunate 2012 Beef Wellington, Crushed Baby Potatoes, Tenderstem Broccoli, Barolo Reduction - Barolo DOCG, Bussia, Vigneto Bofani, 2010 Barolo DOCG, Serralunga, Vigneto Boscareto, 2012 Cheese Selection, Frozen Grapes, Onion Chutney, Celery & Walnuts, Crackers _ _________ P lease get in touch with us if you have any dietary requirement or food allergy EVENT IN COLLABORATION WITH THE WINE PLACE COVENT GARDEN w ww.italianwines.com

Description: The typical format of the session is a full stretch, a 25 minute HIIT workout and end with a full stretch. Every week will be different and sometimes the format will be completely different! There are 4 sessions in a calendar week. The Mon session will be repeated Tue, Thur and Sun sessions. You can attend more than 1 session a week however if you can repeat the session you attend on your own a few times before next week you should get maximum benefit. There will be a session plan to take a photo of each session. Nothing to bring but yourselves however optional additions would be a yoga mat for floor work and non marking shoes. Outside shoes not to be worn in the squash court however socks ok for most exercises. When arriving, head to the courts and find Trevor. If you can't make it there aren't any refunds issued inside 24 hours of the event but let us know please so someone else can join in. If you know you can't make it more than 24 hours before the event 'request a refund' through Eventbrite and you'll get the money back minus the administration fee. This will then free up a ticket for someone else to book. If you have any questions, let us know!
Organizer: Walthamstow Cricket, Tennis and Squash Club

Subtitle: High Intensity Interval Training - 4 sessions a week to cater all schedules

Description: * *By Popular Demand** This is an informal and exclusive London Historians visit to the workshop used by the three gas lighters of British Gas to keep London's remaining gas-powered street lanterns in working condition. Most of these items date from the nineteenth century, so there's lots to see and enjoy, particularly if you're an aficionado of our capital's street 'furniture'. There is constant political pressure to have these lovely old lamps replaced by modern LED replicas. Our ticket money will go towards campaign funds to keep these relatively few remaining gas lights intact and in situ, hopefully for many years to come. Our visit should take about an hour, but could overrun depending on how absorbed we become in the whole business! T he location of the workshop is not a state secret, but we'd prefer to send the actual workshop address separately in due course: it's very close to the station. Ticket proceeds go to the London Gasketeers group, whose remit is to protect London's surviving gas lamps from conversion to LED. Please don't book right away if you've done this one before, but by all means contact us nearer the date to check availability.  Strictly L ondon Historians Members only. Join London Historians.
Title: London Gas Lamp Workshop 3
Subtitle: Literally the workshop in Battersea where London's surviving gas-powered street lamps are maintained and repaired.

The courses is suitable for all skill levels, but suited more to those starting out with MagicQ. Experienced users can pick up new tips and tricks. Description: ARTCAN UNRAVELLED - PRIVATE VIEW - March 12th, 18:00 - 20:00 Join us for an unforgettable art experience at RuptureXIBIT (front gallery)! Get ready to immerse yourself in a world of creativity and inspiration. This in-person event will take place at High Street, Hampton Wick, Kingston upon Thames, UK. 'Unravelled‚Äô is co-curated by ArtCan members Catherine Sweet and Melanie Jordan presenting a group exhibition of ArtCan artists working with fibre and textiles. ArtCan Unravelled aims to highlight how the boundaries of practicality and aesthetics can be blurred with the variety of methods used to create textile art, and to ‚Äòtug on the thread‚Äô of the narratives created within the whole. Participating Artists: Abigail Weston, Adele Cloony, Alison Aye, Anne Griffiths, Carol Ann Eades, Carole Bury, Catherine Hill, Diana Burch, Elizabeth Griffiths, Elly Platt, Gillian Brett, Hannah Pratt, Hilary Rosen, Jan Lee Johnson, Jane Higginbottom, Jo Cooper, Joanne Olney, Jonathan Armour, Kate Marsden, Marsha Roddy, Melanie Jordan, Nerissa Cargill Thompson, Rebecca Tucker, Sabatin Bascoban, Sophie Levi-Kallin, Su France, Sumit Sethi, Svetlana Atlavina, Sylvie Millen, Tracey Elizabeth Downing, Vicky O‚ÄôLeary. The exhibition runs concurrently in two venues: The venues are 10 minutes from one another on public transport. There will be a series of public talks and demonstrations across both venues during the exhibition run, including a panel discussion with Kate Howe, who heads up the RuptureXIBIT space, on the benefits of artistic collaboration and curating in community spaces. Find the full programme for talks and demonstrations across both venues via artcan.org.uk/unravelled Don't miss the chance to witness the unraveling of incredible artworks by ArtCan talented artists. Mark your calendars and get ready to be amazed! The Curators Catherine Sweet Catherine Sweet is an ArtCan artist and a member of the ArtCan Advisory Group. Catherine is the Founder and Director of BobCat Gallery , an independent online gallery showcasing original and affordable small scale artwork, and she provides independent curation and arts advisory services. She has also recently stepped down as Chair of Visual Arts for South West London charity Arts Richmond. Melanie Jordan ArtCan artist Melanie Jordan is based in rural Kent. Her art practice is very tactile and haptic, with thread based crafts at its core. She has exhibited throughout the UK and internationally, including ArtCan‚Äôs ‚ÄòVienna Calling III‚Äô exhibition, and ‚ÄòSupermarket Art Fair‚Äô in Stockholm. Her work has also been shown at Turner Contemporary Gallery in Margate. She was awarded an MA in Fine Art from The University for the Creative Arts, Canterbury in 2020. The Venues RuptureXIBIT (+Studio) is first, a working art studio, and second, a flexible exhibition space designed to give artists an affordable place to expand and further define their practice through showing their experimental work and talking about it across disciplines and communities. 55 High Street, Hampton Wick, KT1 4DG rupturexibit.com ¬† The Landmark Arts Centre, an independent charity that has evolved into a vibrant arts space offering a  has evolved into a vibrant arts space offering a stimulating mix of activities including classes, concerts and exhibitions.¬†¬† Ferry Road, Teddington, TW11 9NN landmarkartscentre.org About ArtCan ArtCan is an artist-led, non-profit arts organisation with members across Britain and internationally. ArtCan‚Äôs work is supported by the efforts of artist-member volunteers, contributions from Founder Friends and Friends of ArtCan and with the valued guidance of the Board of Trustees. ArtCan has expertise in producing collaborative art exhibitions in London, across the UK and  internationally. The exhibitions complement the work of established galleries by enabling talent to gain experience and skills. ArtCan work with galleries, but also seeks new spaces where art becomes a part of everyday life and with the aim of involving audiences in an organic and personal way. ArtCan‚Äôs artist-centred ethos means that the model does not involve charging membership fees or commissions on sales, to help artists focus on developing a sustainable practice.
Title: ARTCAN UNRAVELLED - PRIVATE VIEW
Subtitle: Come and experience the exclusive unveiling of ARTCAN UNRAVELLED - PRIVATE VIEW

Description: Calm Mediation is giving skilled mediators an opportunity to take on cases within the community. We are an organisation with a long-standing reputation as a front-runner in conflict resolution and in the field of Community Mediation in particular. We run well-regarded accredited annual training in Community Mediation that takes 6 days. However, for those who are already accredited in a different discipline of conflict resolution, we have created a one-day course and called it a ‚Äòconversion‚Äô as it allows you to learn how the principles you are already familiar with can be applied to Community Mediation to mediate between neighbours. These approaches have been used to great success across London and beyond, as we receive referrals from many Housing Providers. Our resolution rate is excellent with eight out of ten clients who meet in mediation reaching an agreement. The course is delivered by Freddie De Luca, an accredited and practising community mediator, with years of mediation experience. Freddie will be supported by Anya Zvezdina who has customised our case management system for Community and other sectors. Arrive at 9.30am to meet the trainers in the Upper Hall.  The workshop will commence at 9.45am, ending at 3.30pm.
Title: Mediate Cases in Your Community:  Conversion Training
Subtitle: Calm Mediation is giving skilled mediators an opportunity to diversify their practice to work within the community.

Description: Join us with Mike Parker talking about his brilliant book All the Wide Border. All the Wide Border is a personal journey through the places, amongst the people, and across the divides of the border between England and Wales. Taking in some of our loveliest landscapes, and our darkest secrets, this is a region of immeasurable wonder and interest. It is here that the deepest roots and thorniest paradoxes of Britishness lie. The border between the countries, even as a concept, is ragged, jagged and many-layered. Mike has adored and explored these places his entire life. Born in England but settled in Wales, he finds himself typical of many in being pulled in both directions. Picking apart the many notions and clich√©s of Englishness, Welshness and indeed Britishness, Mike plays with the very idea of borders: our fascination with them, our need for them, and our response to their power. In his hands, the England‚ÄìWales frontier is revealed to be a border within us all, and it is fraying, fast. 'No-one maps the secrets of the UK quite like Mike Parker‚Äô Ayesha Hazarika ‚ÄòA kind of mini-biography of the British psyche emerges from Parker's work‚Äô Horatio Clare ‚ÄòPart history, part psychogeography, part polemic, part panegyric, part love letter... engaging, entertaining and very readable‚Äô Nation Cymr ‚ÄòI loved this book‚Ä¶ funny, thoughtful and evocative‚Äô Jesse Armstrong, creator of Succession ‚ÄòBlending history, literature and personal anecdote, Mike Parker writes with energy and wit‚Äô Times Literary Supplement About the author: Mike Parker was born in England and has lived in Wales for half of his life. His other books include the bestseller Map Addict, The Wild Rover and On the Red Hill, which was shortlisted and Highly Commended for the 2020 Wainwright Prize for UK Nature Writing and won the non-fiction Wales Book of the Year Award. In 2021, he received the Glyndwr Award for outstanding contribution to the arts in Wales. He is an experienced broadcaster, occasional stand-up, failed politician and has written for the Guardian, Sunday Times, Observer and many more. Follow Mike  @mikeparkerwales The event will start promptly at 7.00pm Tickets ¬£7 Includes glass of wine/soft drink ¬£4.00 off the published price of All The Wide Borders for ticket holders when purchased on the evening. To keep up to date with events at Stanfords, please sign up to our newsletter. Please ensure we have an up-to-date contact email address or telephone number when booking your ticket so that we can contact you with any updates. Please do not come to an event if you are experiencing any symptoms of COVID-19 or have been in contact with anyone displaying symptoms.
Title: All the Wide Border by Mike Parker
Subtitle: This is Stanfords, London event

Description: Unlock Your Acting Potential with Nancy Bishop! Date: March 12, 2024 Time: 6:30 PM Ready to take your acting skills to the next level? Join us for an exhilarating session of acting exercises led by the renowned casting director, Nancy Bishop, CSA. Nancy is not just your average casting director ‚Äì she's an Emmy-nominated powerhouse with a portfolio bursting with nearly 100 major feature film and television projects. From London to Prague, Nancy has cast hundreds of actors and collaborated with industry giants like Brad Bird, Roman Polanski, and Guillermo del Toro. Catch Nancy's TV credits on Netflix's highly anticipated series "The Liberator," ABC/Warner Bros' "Whiskey Cavalier," and A&E's "Knightfall." Plus, dive into her wealth of knowledge as an author of two acclaimed books: "Auditioning for Film and Television" and "Secrets from the Casting Couch." Studio credits include European casting on Mission Impossible ‚Äì Ghost Protocol (2011), Bourne Identity (2002), Hellboy (2004), and Snowpiercer (2013), and she has also worked with directors such as Roman Polanski, Peter Greenaway, Neil Burger, and Michael Apted. This is your chance to learn from the best and elevate your craft! Don't miss out on this exclusive opportunity to train with Nancy Bishop. üìç Location: Film&TV Charity (London) Get ready to unleash your talent and shine on the big screen! Description: Following the success of our previous "Mendology Meet-Up" event last October which delved into the art, science, history, theory, and practice of mending (A recording of the conversation from the night between Kate Sekules, Bridget Harvey, Barley Massey & Emma Mathews can be heard Here) We are very happy to be offering a second (more "hands on")sewcial. Come and celebrate #mendmarch with Kate Sekules - aka "Dr Mend" and her two "Mendy Care" assistants Barley & Emma. New & seasoned menders all welcomed for a mendspirational evening together! F ormat for the evening: 6:30pm: Doors open / drinks / sewcialising / start mending if you wish! 7 ‚Äì 7:15pm: Introductions from Kate, Barley & Emma 7:15 - 8pm: "Show us your hole!" 8 - 8:15pm: Mending stash swap 8:15 - 9:30pm: Mendication prescriptions and stitches galore! There will also be opportunity to get your ‚ÄòMend‚Äô book signed by Kate (there will be copies available to purchase on the night, but feel free to bring your own copy if you have Kate's book already!) We encourage you to bring along: Please Note: The refreshments and "surgery" will take place in Fabrications studio (which is downstairs from the shop via 12 steps) Your ticket includes wine / soft drinks & nibbles & a surprise little gift from Kate! Fabrications Booking Terms & Conditions can be found: HERE Kate Sekules is the author of "MEND! A Refashioning Manual and Manifesto." She teaches fashion history at Pratt Institute Brooklyn, a new course, "Mending Fashion" at Parsons School of Design NYC, while completing her doctorate at the Bard Graduate Center with a dissertation titled "A History and Theory of Mending." She is the founder of the crowd sourced world mending map visiblemending.org and MAWG, the Mending Archives Working Group, to make mends legible and searchable in museum contexts. She hosts regular surgeries as Dr Mend, as well as workshops and #mendmarch on instagram. Barley Massey is the creator, crafter and care-taker behind Fabrications. Barley started sewing at a young age, thanks to both her grandmothers and just hasn't stopped! A textile graduate of Golsdmth's University, Barley went on to work in costume for Film & TV before establishing her own textile studio and shop (Fabrications) where she has been championing upcycling, mending and "Cradle to Cradle" principles for over 25 years. Alongside producing one off upcycled pieces, offering her "Remember Me" service, Barley hosts regular classes and events at Fabrications and also free-range! E mma Mathews is the founder of sustainable, unisex sock brand Socko. Socko's socks are made from 'waste' and manufactured by a 4th generation family run factory in Leicestershire. Each pair of socks is accompanied with a mending kit. Socko is also on a mission to extend the active life of clothing by re-teaching the lost art of darning. Emma has taught over 200 people to mend, both in person and via Socko's online workshops. Emma's first book "How to Quit Fast Fashion" was published in October 2020, giving practical tips on things we can all do to have more sustainable wardrobes.
Title: Sewcial: Mending Surgery with "Dr Mend" - Kate Sekules
Subtitle: Join us for a fun and mendspirational evening!

Description: In a special Spiritland Talk, we welcome the legendary photographer Dennis Morris. Dennis Morris has famously chronicled the careers of Bob Marley, The Sex Pistols, Public Image Limited, Lee Scratch Perry, Simply Red, Linton Kwesi Johnson, Marianne Faithful and more. He‚Äôs also known to music heads as the lead singer of Basement 5, a seminal reggae funk band. His photographs have appeared in publications including Rolling Stone, Time, People, V, GQ, I-D, Vogue, and the Sunday Times and he has held exhibitions worldwide in cities including Sydney, Tokyo, London, New York, Paris and San Francisco. He picks out some of the tracks that have guided him along the way, talking through his choices with DJ, author and erstwhile punk Bill Brewster.A limited number of tickets available for this very intimate event available now.
Title: Spiritland talks: Dennis Morris interviewed by Bill Brewster
Subtitle: We welcome the legendary photographer Dennis Morris to Spiritland for a very special evening. He will be interviewed by Bill Brewster

Description: Frida has always been on a journey of self-discovery and is passionate in her underlying belief that the whole is greater than the sum of the parts. In 2014 she met her spiritual teachers Francoise Freedman and Dr Gowri Motha. Both imbued a humbleness, warmth and love (which are vital for true transformation) and giving that came straight from the heart. It was these rare traits along with their radiant presence which enticed Frida to their teachings. Frida went on to study Kundalini Yoga with Gurmukh and completed her teacher training in 2019. She is currently completing her studies to qualify as a Kundalini Yoga Therapist with the renowned multidisciplinary and holistic director of Kundalini Medicine, Guru Dharam. Others who have inspired Frida along the way are Master Sean Dooney, Teacher of Reusi Dat Ton, Thai Hermit self-healing Yoga. Devi Stern, specialising in both Energy Medicine and Kabbalistic Healing. The late Prof. Eliyahu Kelman, of blessed memory, for his in-depth knowledge of all things mystical in the realms of higher consciousness. The Daoist practitioner, Master Zhongyian Wu for sharing the power of internal cultivation through the Chinese arts. It is with all the above and Frida‚Äôs commitment to lifelong study of these Eastern traditions, that creates a vibrant, multi-disciplinary and empowering experience for her students. Frida‚Äôs sole interest is to transfer these magical teachings for self-empowerment, healing and transformation. Frida currently teaches fortnightly on a Tuesday evening, alternately at: St Katherines Greek Church, Friern Barnet Lane London N20 0NL Unitarian Church, Newington Green, London N16 9PR Frida also commits to healing the homeless once a week in the Borough of Barnet. Future projects to include the vulnerable in our community whether it be on the streets of London or those in prison. Since qualifying as a Kundalini Yoga Teacher, Frida‚Äôs teaching has supported both Birthlight and Gentle Birth Foundation Charities. Supporting: Birthlight Trust Charity No. 1088207 Gentle Birth Method Foundation Charity No. 1173798 "I have more confidence, energy and positivity and have learnt through the breath- calmness". "I wish I had met Frida years ago". -Val Grime "When I was looking for a yoga class to join back in 2020, I could never have imagined what awaited me after finding Frida's leaflet".-Chloe May ".......Frida, I just thought I should let you know this, I'm feeling wonderful physically and mentally......!"-Alem Selassie
Title: Kundalini Therapeutics with Frida
Subtitle: Kundalini Therapeutics- connecting to the magic within. A multidisciplinary approach to combine, unite and harmonise soul, body and mind.

Description: These old lamps are special because, for economical and ecological reasons, many thousands have already been retro-fitted with LED bulbs of varying types, and there are plans to modernise most of the survivors as we move away from fossil fuels. There are strong arguments against this, but for now we must enjoy them while we can. We'll meet just before dusk as the gas lamps flicker into life, taking a route past Buckingham Palace, through Royal Parks, down The Mall, along Carlton Terrace and around Trafalgar Square to Covent Garden and its busy theatreland. Experience the romance of this soft lighting along tree-lined paths, main roads, narrow alleyways and around royal palaces. Stroll down London's first gaslit street to see some of the oldest lamps and visit the site of a demonstration for King George III that made all this possible. You'll also hear how the lanterns are maintained today ‚Äì we may no longer need lamplighters every evening but there is still a team of enthusiastic men employed to keep the lamp lights burning. This tour is led by London Historians Member Jane Parker, who offers a wide range of guided walks, many of which focus strongly on London's urban fabric. Find out more here. ___________________________________________
Title: London by Gaslight - Palace to Piazza.
Subtitle: A softly-lit route from Victoria to Covent Garden via Buckingham Palace following an evocative trail of gas-powered street lamps.

Description: What is Getting Things Done¬Æ or GTD¬Æ? GTD is the shorthand brand for 'GettingThingsDone', the ground-breaking work-life management system by David Allen that provides concrete solutions for transforming overwhelm and uncertainty into an integrated system of stress-free productivity. About the Seminar: The headwinds we face in life today are formidable. Emails and instant messages come in at a relentless pace. Calendars fill up. Distractions abound. We are consistently busy, but we lack the sense that we are focused on the right things. We seldom celebrate real achievement. Home life suffers, at the mercy of the demands of our professional lives, and vice versa. GTD: Level 1 Fundementals is a one-day seminar that provides practical techniques that help you to get control of your world. You will increase your productivity, yes, but you will do so while maintaining a clear mind and the confidence that you are consistently focused on the right things. Who Should Attend?: Anyone who wants to get more of the right things done, in less time, with less stress and greater mental clarity. Prerequisites: None. The seminar introduces the fundamental thinking and practices of the Getting Things Done methodology. TIME: Registration & continental breakfast from 8:15am. Seminar begins at 9am and finishes at 5pm. Lunch will be served from 12:30-1:30pm. DATE: Tuesday 12th March 2024 (Please note: Registration will close on Friday, 8th March 2024) COST: Early bird rate: ¬£515 + VAT (valid until 6th February 2024) Standard rate: ¬£595 + VAT (valid from 7th February 2024) MATERIALS: Seminar materials will be provided at the venue. PARTICIPANT LOCATION: Next Action Associates is only licensed to deliver virtual seminars to participants based in the UK and Ireland. Participants whose billing addresses are from outside these geographies will not be able to join the seminar and, as per our standard terms and conditions, a ¬£50 processing fee is charged to issue a refund. FREE LIVE SYSTEM SET-UP Q&A WEBINAR: As a participant of this seminar, you will be able to join a live ‚ÄòSystem set-up Q&A‚Äô webinar for 90 minutes on Tuesday 19th March at 10.30 am. Course Outline So if you are interested in GTD¬Æ, personal productivity, time management or are simply looking for stress-relief then sign up today. FAQs What can/can't I bring to the event? Some people find it helpful to bring any portable versions of what they currently use to manage their work, such as any working lists of to do's, goals, projects, etc. But it's certainly not required and you will receive a comprehensive participant pack when you arrive, that includes the Getting Things Done book by David Allen, a course workbook, JumpStart Guide to create draft projects and action lists, a workflow map, methodology booklet, a pen, and more. Where can I contact the organiser with any questions? info@next-action.co.uk What is the refund policy? Here are our different cancellation options: - More than seven (7) days prior to the event: - Between seven (7) days and three (3) days (72 hours) prior to the event start time:No - Within three (3) days (72 hours) of the event start time: Please contact our office at info@next-action.co.uk to let us know how you would like to proceed or if you have any questions or need further information.

Description: In the early '60s, four friends from Liverpool formed a band. But this is not the 'fab four' story we know. Mary, Sylvia, Valerie and Pamela - also known as The Liverbirds - were one of the world's first all-female rock'n'roll bands. At an early gig, backstage at the Cavern Club, a young John Lennon told them that 'girls don't play guitars'. But they took that as a challenge. Despite the early scepticism, they won over tough crowds, toured stadiums, recorded two hit albums, and played with the Kinks, Rolling Stones and Chuck Berry - all in the space of just five years. Now, the two surviving members of the band tell their incredible story in full for the first time - capturing a lost era of liberation and rock'n'roll, as they thrived in the vibrant Merseybeat music scene and formed a friendship that has endured through the decades. Lucy O‚ÄôBrien is the author of Madonna: Like An Icon (2018), which was translated into 13 languages. She also wroteShe Bop: The Definitive History of Women in Popular Music (published in three editions). It inspired the 2002 Radio 2 series She Bop, and two exhibitions: She Bop at the National Portrait Gallery in 2001, and She-Bop-A-Lula, at the Strand Gallery, 2012. She collaborated with Alison Goldfrapp for the chapter: 'Country Girl: Rural Feminism in the Performance of Alison Goldfrapp', in Mute Records: Artists, Business, History (2018). She has also contributed to Gina Arnold and George McKay's forthcoming essay collection on punk (due 2020), and Voicing Girlhood in Popular Music: Performance, Authority, Authenticity (2016). Dusty, her classic biography of 60s pop legend Dusty Springfield, was recently revised and updated for a new 2019 edition. She has also written the in-depth biography Annie Lennox. She‚Äôs worked for the music press since the 1980s, starting on NME and contributing to a range of titles including Q, Mojo, The Sunday Times, The Guardian and The Quietus. Lucy has acted as a consultant and guest contributor in television and radio, for example on Channel 4 News, BBC Radio 4 - Woman‚Äôs Hour, Radio London and numerous BBC 4 documentaries. She also co-produced Righteous Babes, the 1998 Channel 4 film about rock and new feminism. She currently teaches at London College of Music, UWL, and was Course Leader for BA (Hons) Music Journalism and BA (Hons) Music Marketing & Promotion courses at UCA, She also taught Media and Communications at Goldsmiths, University of London, University of Westminster, and Southampton Solent University. Her specialist research areas are music subcultures and scenes, feminism and popular culture, writing and publishing biography. And back in the late 70s/early 80s, Lucy played and sang in all-girl punk band The Catholic Girls.
Title: The Liverbirds: Mary McGlory & Sylvia Saunders in conversation
Subtitle: Join acclaimed music writer Lucy O'Brien with Mary McGlory and Syvia Saunders for the amazing story of the Liverbirds.

Description: Conrad's The Secret Agent cast a critical eye over London at the end of the nineteenth century when the capital was home to a series of revolutionary anarchist groups. They had come to police attention following royal pressure after the assassination of the Tsar of Russia. The Secret Agent, Verloc, in Conrad's novel is a double agent, ¬†blackmailed to commit an outrage which ends in family tragedy. ¬†The death of Stevie, Verloc's son in law, ¬†is closely based on a real anarchist explosion near the Greenwich Observatory in 1894. Successive waves of exiles from France, Germany and Russia had made a home in Fitzrovia and Soho, close to the British Museum where Marx and Lenin studied, yet in an area where foreigners ran the bookstores and shops. On this walk we will find the street housing Verloc's pornographic bookshop and revisit the site of the Autonomie anarchist club, raided by police after the Greenwich bomb. We will also learn more about the actions of Chief Inspector Melville, who was the model for Chief Inspector Heat.
Title: Walking Tour - Conrad's Secret Agent and Anarchism in Fitzrovia
Subtitle: Explore the anarchist circles in London through the eye of Joseph Conrad in his Secret Agent, based on true events

Description: Mitchell Coony knows what people say about him. He‚Äôs washed up. Bitter. Incredibly handsome and supremely talented. But does anyone know the real Mitchell Coony? He wants to tell the truth. Open up and be vulnerable. Watch as he drops names, drops his guard, and finally ‚Ä¶ get‚Äôs real. Join him for a tell-all  interview as he relives the roles that defined him and dishes on the juicy secrets of his scandalous career. Find out which of his ex-wives was the ex-iest, learn the secrets of Hollywood success and help him as he prepares for his toughest role yet ... himself. A solo comedy featuring silly characters, audience interaction, and some very serious monologues.  Michael Kunze is an award-winning actor, writer, director and improviser. His solo debut, ‚ÄúLil Saffron: Ragu to Riches‚Äù, received five star reviews at the 2022 Edinburgh Fringe and transferred to the Pleasance and Soho Theatres. Description: Be the first to try Climpson & Sons latest Showstopper coffee as we experiment with the physics of brewing, exploring one coffee through three notably different brew methods inspired by Jonathan Gagne‚Äôs ‚ÄòThe Physics of Filter Coffee‚Äô. Climpson & Sons Showstopper Coffees are notable for their distinct and elevated flavour profiles. A celebration of exclusive varietals produced in optimal circumstances. This Cupping Club is an exclusive chance to try our latest Showstopper for the very first time.When fine tuning a filter coffee recipe we seek a scientific and methodical approach, changing just one contingent variable in the process to move towards the most balanced extraction as possible. In this regulated experiment, we work with three different brew methods of contrasting shapes, sizes and immersion to percolation ratios to taste this coffee at its best. How does the underlying shape, design and immersion level of a brewer affect the complexity of profile and flavour? In this cupping club we experiment with a V60, Clever Dripper and the humble cupping bowl to find out. Bring your technical brewing questions and be prepared to geek.
Title: Cupping Club | Try our Showstopper Coffee, Brewed 3 Ways
Subtitle: Be the first to try Climpson & Sons latest Showstopper coffee as we experiment with the physics of brewing.

Description: Unleash the power of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in your business. This event equips leaders and professionals with the knowledge to leverage AI for growth, efficiency, and competitive edge.  This event is designed to help CEOs, managers, and professionals learn how to leverage AI to drive growth, improve efficiencies, and gain a competitive advantage. Topics covered include: Join us for an engaging and informative day of learning, networking, and inspiration! C-suite executives and senior leaders: expand your knowledge of technology trends and AI applications, with the goal of implementing these technologies to enhance business outcomes and reduce costs. Mid- to senior-level functional managers: explore how AI can enhance performance within their area of expertise Product and technology managers: create and launch an AI-based product, build and train a team for AI product development, and understand the business implications of AI  KÔªøey outcomes WÔªøho is presenting Dr Stylianos (Stelios) Kampakis is a data scientist with more than 10 years of experience.  He has worked with decision makers from companies of all sizes: from startups to organisations like, the US Navy, Vodafone and British Land.  His work expands multiple sectors including fintech (fraud detection and valuation models), sports analytics, health-tech, general AI, medical statistics, predictive maintenance and others. He has worked with many different types of technologies, from statistical models, to deep learning to blockchain and he has 2 patents pending to his name. He is a member of the Royal Statistical Society, honorary research fellow at the UCL Centre for Blockchain Technologies, a data science advisor for London Business School and CEO of The Tesseract Academy.
Title: The Business of AI: Data science for CEOs, managers and professionals
Subtitle: Learn how AI can create value and solve business challenges. Uncover its true potential, and learn how it can help your business.

Description: Meet up to 15 potential matches within the 40 - 55 age bracket at our relaxed and informal event, hosted by www.itsadate.club. Located on Gresham Street just a 3-minute walk from Bank station, The Anthologist is a gorgeous bar & restaurant with a cosy semi-private seating area reserved exclusively for your It‚Äôs a Date event. This venue has a remarkably warm and welcoming vibe, combined with our host and a group of outgoing singles, and you have the recipe for a fantastic speed dating evening! Our host will be at the venue ready to welcome you at 19:30. Please arrive on time for registration, grab any drinks from the bar, and receive a summary of how things will work. You will be given an optional name badge, a pencil, and a note card to keep track of everyone you‚Äôve met. Ladies will be seated on tables adequately spaced, discreetly numbered, and arranged in a comfortable area of the venue. When speed dating commences, gents will join ladies for 4-minute dates to get to know one another. Your host will notify all guests at the end of each date, signalling for gents to move to the next table in ascending numerical order. During table rotations, you will have a moment to record on note cards your feelings towards the previous date and intention to reconnect, for your reference only.Mid-way through the evening, your host will indicate a 15-minute comfort break to use the rest room, head to the bar, or socialise with new connections. Dating will then resume for the second half of the evening. At the end of the speed dating the bar will remain open for more socialising. You can then access the event listing in your dashboard to enter feedback on dates and await your matches. If you have any questions on the event or how things will work, please get in contact with James on 07517 065 492 or james@itsadate.club.
Title: Speed Dating in The City
Subtitle: Feel-good speed dating event for guests aged 40 - 55 looking to connect with others in a relaxed, fun, and informal setting.

Description: This workshop is a transformational journey of exploring the inner depths of our trauma through stretching. Trauma is an innate experience which all humans experience in our day to day lives. Humans however are the only animals who cannot release trauma naturally and instead recycle it into our muscles and nervous systems. These traumatic events that we experience are embedded into our bodies and each time we think about these fearful experiences, our trauma is more deeply anchored into our bodies and become more difficult to release. This can lead to pent up emotions and never realising how our bodies have a secret weapon to release what is stored deep inside. Our bodies have the wisdom to heal trauma and restore goodness. "I didn't know I could feel this comfortable this quickly in a group of strangers." - Workshop Participant
Title: Stretching Through Trauma Classes
Subtitle: Get ready to heal and find peace as you are guided through stretching exercises designed to help you work through embodied trauma

Description: In this brand-new course, you will explore how to act successfully songs from the musical-theatre repertoire. You will learn to apply some of the greatest actor-training exercises and techniques whilst singing - to improve your acting through song both for stage, and in audition. The course will explore material where you are singing to another character, directly to an audience, and when your character is onstage alone. The course is led by Paul Harvard. As author of the book Acting Through Song, Paul is internationally-renowned for his leading work in this subject. He was the Head of Musical Theatre at the Urdang Academy for many years - and has taught the subject at leading conservatoires such as: Arts Educational, Mountview and Royal Central School of Speech and Drama. Musical-Theatre Actors trained by Paul have played leading roles in countless West End musicals including: Hamilton, Miss Saigon, Hairspray, Strange Loop, Get Up, Stand Up, A Chorus Line, Once and This Island, L√©s Miserables and many more. We are passionate about working with actors from underrepresented groups and we will always seek to break down barriers to access in professional actor-training. Scholarships are available for those who are facing challenging circumstances. If you want to learn more about how to apply, email admissions@collectiveactingstudio.co.uk
Title: Acting Through Song
Subtitle: Acting Through Song - Every Tuesday morning 10.30 to 12.30 - 20th February to 2nd April 2024
