Description: Our 12 week Introduction to Musical Theatre course started on 9th January 2024, Sign up for the rest of the course or come along just for this workshop. Come along and join us for this upbeat and joyful Singing in the Rain inspired Musical Theatre workshop! Learn a vocal and basic dance routine from this hit Film, Broadway and West End musical. If you enjoy the workshop and would like to enrol for the remainder of the course you will be given the opportunity to do so as long as spaces are still available. No experience is necessary! Just the willingness to have fun and give it a go. If you choose to sign up for the remainder of the course you will be led by Stage & the City‚Äôs Musical Director Jack Holliday who will guide you through a selection of musical theatre numbers, working on the essential components of acting, singing and dance. You will learn all the tips and tricks to performing in a musical and what it takes to keep an audience entertained. This is a great fun and fabulous way to learn three disciplines in one. An upbeat course that will have you singing, dancing and acting in no time. We understand you may be a bit nervous if this is your first time, but classes are taught in a fun and supportive environment. Most of the singing will be done as a group but there are opportunities for solos! It doesn‚Äôt matter how old you are (as long as you‚Äôre over 18) you‚Äôre never too old to try something new! - ----------------------------------------------------------------------- This course will be delivered each Tuesday evening and will suit anybody who loves the idea of performing in a musical but has no or little experience. For those that have already completed an Introduction course with Stage & the City, or an alternative elsewhere, we suggest you look at our Musical Theatre for Beginners course or even consider auditioning for our Musical Theatre Troupe. Please note, if the course becomes fully booked before your workshop you will not be able to attend, so if you are sure you would like a place on any of our courses, it is best to secure your place by enrolling. More information about the actual course can be found here Any questions, please do not hesitate to e-mail satc@afperformingarts.com If you do decide to book a taster day please keep an eye on your junk emails so that we can send you instructions nearer the time. Please ensure you provide us with your correct phone number just in case any details have to change.
Title: Introduction to Musical Theatre - SINGING IN THE RAIN Workshop

Description: Yin Yoga is a slower form of yoga for all levels and abilities. Each pose is practiced in a lying or seated position and held for 3-5 minutes. The aim of Yin Yoga is to slow down, turn your focus inwards and target your joints and connective tissue (fascia). Yin also has a big focus on the emotional body, helping you to relax the mind, create more balance and move any stagnant or stuck energy and emotions. Yin Yoga is more meditative and restorative, focusing on cultivating mindfulness, stimulating the flow of energy in the body and relaxing the spirit.Instructions Please arrive in comfortable clothing, - yoga pants, or leggings are preferred. Stay warm with a jumper and feel free to bring a blanket too! Please ensure you arrive 5 minutes early, the door is locked at 8pm, so you wont be able to enter after this time.Car parking is free on Norman Road. Greenwich DRL station is less than 5 mins away.
Title: Yin Yoga in Greenwich
Subtitle: Experience the bliss of yin yoga and feel relaxed, calm and reenergised!

Description: DateinaDash are the market leaders for Speed Dating London. Launched in 2011 we have hosted over 5,000 events and won the award 'Best Speed Dating Event' at the UK Dating Awards. Ranked #1 in Google and with a 4.7 Trustpilot rating you can rest assured our events are busy, well organized and lots of fun!   Go on 15 dates with DateinaDash at our popular Gay Speed Dating event in Soho at 100 Wardour St  for ages 21-45. With more and more people going offline to meet their future partners it has never been a better time to attend one of our fun Speed Dating events. Expect a lively crowd with a great mix of personalities and backgrounds. Unlike other LGBT dating events you will meet everyone in the room! On arrival at the venue our bubbly host will register you for the event and explain how the evening will unfold. We'll provide you with everything you need (scorecard, pen, name badge) and show you to your seat. Sit back, relax and enjoy a pre-event drink before the flirty fun begins!  Each date will last around 4-5 minutes which is enough time to know whether you'd like to see that person again. After each round half the room will move along to the next table. The following day you can log your matches via our website and if you have a mutual connection you can contact them through our safe and secure messaging platform.  Typically 80% of guests get at least one match at one of our events. We have a 'yes' option or 'friendship' so even if you don't meet anyone with a romantic interest you can always make a new friend or two.  After the Speed Dating has finished guests are welcome to drink at the bar and continue socializing. This event has a '100% No Match Guarantee' which means if you don't meet anyone you would like to see again you can attend another event for free.  What's included? This is one of our favourite venues and certainly are most popular midweek Speed Dating event which means it usually books up very quickly. If you would like to come along then please ensure you reserve your place in advance.  For any questions please contact us via e-mail through our website or on EventBrite and we will be happy to assist.  We look forward to meet you soon at one of our fun Speed Dating events in London! ¬† ¬†
Organizer: The Best Speed Dating Events in London
Title: Gay Speed Dating in Soho (Ages 21-45)
Subtitle: Go on 20 dates at a Gay Speed Dating event in London at an exclusive venue for ages 21-45. It's a fun, fast & flirty way to meet new guys!

Description: DateinaDash are the market leaders for Speed Dating London. Launched in 2011 we have hosted over 5,000 events and won the award 'Best Speed Dating Event' at the UK Dating Awards. Ranked #1 in Google and with a 4.7 Trustpilot rating you can rest assured our events are busy, well organised and lots of fun!   Go on 15-20 dates with DateinaDash at our most popular midweek Speed Dating event in Soho at the exclusive 100 Wardour St for ages 25-40. With more and more people going offline to meet their future partners it has never been a better time to attend one of our fun Speed Dating events. Expect a lively crowd with a great mix of personalities and backgrounds. Our events always have equal numbers of men and women with at least 20 dates. The event takes place in the restaurant which is a semi-private area at the back of the venue. Guests will able to take advantage of table service throughout the event. On arrival at the venue our bubbly host will register you for the event and explain how the evening will unfold. We'll provide you with everything you need (scorecard, pen, name badge) and show you to your seat. Sit back, relax and enjoy a pre-event drink before the flirty fun begins!  Each date will last around 4-5 minutes which is enough time to know whether you'd like to see that person again. The men will move to the next table on the sound of a whistle and after each date you can either make a note on your paper scorecard to upload to the website later or through our mobile website after each date. Typically 80% of guests get at least one match at one of our events. We have a 'yes' option or 'friendship' so even if you don't meet anyone with a romantic interest you can always make a new friend or two.  After the Speed Dating has finished guests are welcome to drink at the bar and continue socialising or enjoy the live music in the downstairs club.  This event has a '100% No Match Guarantee' which means if you don't meet anyone you would like to see again you can attend another event for free.  What's included? This is one of our favourite venues and certainly are most popular midweek Speed Dating event which means it usually books up very quickly. If you would like to come along then please ensure you reserve your place in advance.  For any questions please contact us via e-mail through our website or on EventBrite and we will be happy to assist.  We look forward to meet you soon at one of our fun Speed Dating events in London! ¬† ¬†
Title: Speed Dating in Soho @ 100 Wardour Street (Ages 25-40)
Subtitle: Go on 15-20 dates with DateinaDash at a Speed Dating event in London at an exclusive venue for ages 25-40. Tickets ¬£20.

Description: Welcome to the Women in St Alfege Tour! Come join us at St Alfege Church on Tue Mar 12 2024 at 17:30 for an exciting tour highlighting the remarkable women who have shaped the history of this historic church. Discover the stories of influential female figures who have made a lasting impact on St Alfege and the community. March 2024 marks 30 years since the first women in the Church of England were ordained as priests and we are delighted to launch a new tour during Women History Month. Join us to hear the fascinating stories of women connected to St Alfege Church and the role they played through the centuries ‚Äì from organists to bellringers, from scientists to suffragettes. Get a unique chance to visit the bell ringing chamber and take a closer look at rare historic manuscripts from the church‚Äôs archive. This in-person event will take you on a journey through time, exploring the contributions of women in various aspects of the church's history. Don't miss this unique opportunity to learn, connect, and celebrate the important role of women in St Alfege!
Title: Women in St Alfege Tour
Subtitle: Join us for a fun and informative tour celebrating the inspiring women of St Alfege - let's explore their stories together!

Description: Our new Tuesday night Gay Speed Dating event takes place at 100 Wardour St in Soho for ages 21-45 (age guide). A beautiful venue hired exclusively for our event with table service throughout. At this event you can expect to meet around 15-20 people in 4-5 minute dates with an interval half way through for refreshments. Speed Dating kicks off at 8pm prompt and any guests arriving late may not be able to take part so please ensure you arrive 15-30 minutes before the scheduled start time to allow for registration. When all the guests have arrived the host will explain how the evening will unfold and you will be provided with a scorecard and pen. When the event begins half the men will be seated and the other half will rotate between tables every 4 minutes. There will be an opportunity to meet everyone at this event afterwards. At the end of each date guests mark on their scorecard whether they would like to see that person again. Alternatively, use our mobile website to log your matches and get the results immediately after the event ends! Once the event finishes we invite you to join us in the club, the perfect setting for further conversation and socialising. The following day we'll e-mail you with the results and if you have a match you can communicate with them through our safe and secure website. Please be aware that speed dating places are limited and the majority of our events do sell out, so please book early to avoid disappointment. If you have any queries about this event please contact us at enquiries@dateinadash.com or call our telephone bookings hotline on 0845 862 1448 (9am 5pm).

Description: Come join us for a turbo charged hour of comedy in the heart of Brixton! Round off the work day and start the night off right at our very special 'Happy Hour Comedy' night. Bring your work buddies, your mates, your date, or come by yourself to the friendliest comedy club in London! Your hosts will be Arielle Souma (the funniest Funniest French Ivorian Stand up in U.K) and Suse Steed ("Suse‚Äôs message, intelligence, storytelling and humour simply boom out into the aether... MumbleComedy.net). They will be joined by a selection of their favourite comics from the UK circuit. There will be a mix of established acts trying new material and rising stars from the comedy scene. Come catch them while they are hot. Our venue is the fabulous ‚ÄòBrixtonia‚Äô right in the centre of Brixton on Brixton Station Road. You may know this as ‚ÄòCafe Brixton‚Äô and they have been at the heart and soul of Brixton life for a very long time. They serve a huge range of alcoholic drinks and cocktails and will be offering some special drinks offers for special comedy night! If you don‚Äôt drink alcohol you will have lots of choices and of course you can have a cuppa tea or a coffee too! We love running comedy nights and at 'Let's Laugh' you will find comedy where you can expect the unexpected. We've had people perform who are now on the telly a lot but the vibe we like is where everyone is welcome. We like people who are famous in the community as much as we like people whose face you see on the box. And the thing we like most is a mix of the two! Doors open at 5.45pm for a 6pm start and the show will run until 7pm. Space is limited so what are you waiting for? Grab your ticket today! We can't wait to see you there. Description: Daoist Dynamic Tai Chi - Tuesday evenings Come join us for a rejuvenating session of Tai Chi every Tuesday evening at Hackney Showroom! Our Daoist Dynamic Tai Chi class will help you find balance, improve flexibility, and reduce stress. Located on Murrain Road in London, UK, our classes are perfect for beginners and experienced practitioners alike. Let's flow together and embrace the Daoist philosophy through the graceful movements of Tai Chi. See you there! This evening class teaches the Lishi Yin and Yang arts. The first hour focuses on the Yin arts, working on suppleness and strength through Kai Men (Taoist Yoga), expanding the breath and the body's vitality through Dao Yin, and calming the body and mind through the soft, flowing movements of the Lishi tai chi forms. The second part of the class is more dynamic as we explore the Yang arts, getting the heart rate up, training co-ordination, speed and stamina through Hand of the Wind, foot flows, evasions and forms. With the combination of deep breathing, Chinese yoga, tai chi, and invigorating exercises, by the end of the class you will feel both relaxed and energised. Your body will feel alive, strengthened and more supple while your mind will be clear, focused, and revitalised. This class is tailored to beginners and and no prior experience is needed, expect a good work out and a fun way to get physically, emotionally and mentally fit.
Title: Daoist Dynamic Tai Chi - Tuesday evenings
Subtitle: Come join us for some relaxing and energizing Daoist Dynamic Tai Chi every Tuesday evening!

Your focus will be on your baby and whatever it is they happen to be up to, so there is no formal emphasis on ‚Äòlearning‚Äô the songs, but I find that over the course of a few weeks parents pick them up naturally and start to join in. I share a mix of songs, some which might be familiar to you and some which will be new. Some are really bouncy and others are ideal for lullabies. I often meet parents years later who say their children still request the songs from my classes ‚Äì they seem to go deep! We will end the session with that all important cup of tea and a chat. Description: Welcome to London‚Äôs leading Enterprise Generative Ai networking breakfast. We are delighted to be in our new home for our dining events, The Anthologist (58 Gresham St in the City of London). These networking breakfast events are a wonderful way to start the day and catch up with people you really will love meeting and learning from. We began hosting Enterprise Gen Ai meetups in 2023, in London, New York City and New Zealand. We wanted to bring the community of professionals together to learn from each other and form friendships. Kegai was established by Founder, Simon Small, who has a rich history in deploying Generative Ai to Enterprises and co-founded Gen Ai Unicorn, Arria NLG. Kegai stands for Knowledge Elevator Generative Ai. This event will be co-hosted by Simon and Tanveer Mohammed (CTO and AI Entrepreneur who heads up Kegai Union, the social wing of Kegai). Our goal is for you to get as much value as possible from attending. Everyone is welcome. Our events attract open-minded, top-achieving people from all walks of life who are passionate about Enterprise Generative Ai. ++++++++ A word from Simon and Tanveer now: ‚ÄúThis meetup is where you connect with those deeply involved in the real work. This is for all those involved in Enterprise Generative Ai as Consultants, Vendors, Platforms, Founders, Artists and Large Organisations. All those aiming to increase the understanding of Enterprise Generative Ai around the world. We also welcome those intrigued by Enterprise Gen Ai. But make no mistake, we dive in headfirst, fearlessly, into the deep end (when we will run future events with talks from experts). We're motivated by practical solutions that consistently deliver with zero errors. Our goal is to usher in an era of global understanding of Enterprise Generative Ai and what it can do for the planet and humanity. Here, we both compete and collaborate, for the greater good. We know that if we come together, we can lead the way and be a positive force on humanity‚Äôs evolution. We‚Äôre out to create something holistically better than what we have today. We keep abreast of the overwhelming wave of Gen Ai advancements, recognising that staying informed is a full-time occupation. Together, we refine, understand, and evolve as the pace of Gen Ai progress outstrips even Moore‚Äôs Law by 2.5 times." +++++++ If any of this speaks to you, we suggest you grab a ticket now, to save disappointment. Schedule:8-9.30am held fortnightly (every 2 weeks for our American friends) through 20248am Breakfast and drinks on arrival (range of choices included in your ticket price)Networking - Unstructured breakfast (choice of sitting / standing)9.30am Networking breakfast concludes Location: The Anthologist, 58 Gresham Street, City of London, EC2V 7BB(turn left as you enter - we'll be in The Snug on the far side of the bar)Note for earlybirds: the Anthologist only opens its doors for business at 8am
Title: London's Enterprise Generative Ai Networking Breakfast Series(NBS);by Kegai
Subtitle: Embrace the serendipity: meet and mingle with the experts who are making Enterprise Generative Ai happen in the City of London.

Description: To get your 10% FORS Discount, please email info@fbgtraining.com BEFORE you purchase your ticket. IMPORTANT: When booking a ticket, you must inform info@fbgtraining.com of your full company name, so we can upload the FORS Training successfully to TFL. *LUNCH* Please note: This course includes a light lunch. For dietary / allergy requirements, please contact info@fbgtraining.com (One light lunch per candidate). Registration: Starts at 7.30am It is your responsibility to ensure you plan your journey in advance. If you do not attend there will be no refund of your course fee. If you turn up after the course has started you will be refused entry and any rebooking will be subject to a full rebooking fee. The course includes a practical ‚Äòon-road‚Äô cycle training element and gives drivers a ‚Äòreal life‚Äô experience as to a cyclist‚Äôs perspective of riding on busy roads, as well as in traffic. The FOR Professional Safe Driving course highlights a driver‚Äôs regulatory responsibilities, the importance of safe driving practices on motorways, rural and urban roads, and other hot topics that can negatively impact safe driving such as driver fitness, health, distraction, and impairment. The course includes a practical on-cycle session and a theory module. Both modules (i.e., the practical and on-cycle sessions) are 3.5 hours each, counting towards seven hours of Driver CPC, plus the mandatory work-related road risk training as required at FORS Silver. The course involves both classroom and an on-road practical cycling element totalling seven hours training plus breaks. Please ensure that you dress accordingly. To add, Hi-Vis sleeveless jackets and helmets are provided by FBG Training on the day and must be worn by all delegates at all times throughout the cycle element. This is for your safety. IMPORTANT: Any driver attending the course must have their identity checked by either a photo card driving licence, Operator card or a Driver Qualification Card (DQC). This will allow FBG Training to register the driver onto the Transport for London master SUD database which confirms the driver has attended the course. For a driver to be uploaded to the FORS/TfL register and/or be accredited with the Driver CPC hours they must complete the entire course. Generally, the only reasons for not taking part in the cycle element are on medical grounds, or if during the cycle familiarisation session, the driver is risk assessed as not safe to ride a bike on public roads ‚Äì in these instances it is acceptable for the drivers to walk the course meeting up with the cyclists at the exercise/discussion points and joining in with the discussion. You MUST bring your Driver Qualification Card to ensure you are eligible for Driver CPC periodic training. This course contains content relevant to drivers that hold a vocational category C1, C, CE. The course content is not fully aligned to drivers with a vocational category D1, D, DE. The holder of these categories, however, can attend and gain their 7hrs. IMPORTANT- Have you completed this course before? You cannot attend the same course within a 5-year period unless you have a good reason to repeat it. For more information, contact our office info@fbgtraining.com. Did you know? FORS insist all delegates complete the cycle element in all-weather types to gain your certificate so COME PREPARED. Bring suitable clothing, water and sun cream if applicable for the weather conditions on the day. Refusal to participate in the full course will result in no accreditation. Please note: Travel costs are not included. Refreshment: Tea, Coffee and Light Lunch included. (For dietary and allergy requests, please contact: info@fbgtraining.com at least 1 week prior to the course date.) Parking: All candidates MUST register their vehicle registration at reception upon arrival in order to park on site for free. It is your responsibility to adhere to this stipulation. Failure to do so may result in a car parking charge being issued. Learning Disability: If you have a learning disability and/or require additional support, please contact FBG Training at info@fbgtraining.com to let us know. Own equipment If you prefer to use your own bicycle, you may bring & use it subject to a safety check. You use this at your own risk and security. Farrow Browne and Gryspeerdt Ltd will not be responsible for the safety and security of your equipment or any damage to your equipment that may occur while using the equipment on our course. You MUST inform a member of the admin team at least 48hrs prior to the course date if you wish to bring your own bike. Contact: info@fbgtraining.com *Occasionally images or video footage may be taken on our courses. By purchasing a ticket, you are complying with Farrow Browne Gryspeerdt Ltd's terms and conditions that if images or video footage is taken, it will only be used for marketing purposes on our website or social media pages. (If you do not wish to participate in any imagery or video, it is your responsibility to contact Farrow Browne Gryspeerdt Ltd before your course date.) All bookings are subject to our Cancellation Policy and by registering for a course you are agreeing to its terms. Email info@fbgtraining.com for our cancellation policy.
Title: FORS Professional Safe Driving Course (Dartford, Kent)
Subtitle: A new course for 2024 combining FORS VanSmart and FORS Safe Urban Driving

Description: In celebration of Women's History Month, we are delighted to have Vivien Morgan a former BBC and ITN TV News Journalist, who will be talking about her book "Cross-Dressed to Kill" - women who went to war disguised as men. Vivien will discuss her book and talk about why young women dressed as men to fight as soldiers in the 17th to 20th centuries. Hundreds of known women cross-dressers were in Britain, Europe and the Americas, yet they have been erased from social and military history. Copies of Vivien's Book will be on sale after the session for a discounted price of ¬£8, cash or card. Key information about booking: Vivien Morgan is a former BBC and ITN TV News Journalist and Documentary Director, who picked up a camera to become a TV Videojournalist pioneer. Travelling undercover she reported from the closed Communist countries, from Tibet and Myanmar and later from much of Sub-Saharan and West Africa as well as the Middle East and Iran.Her fascination with these historic young women who cross-dressed in the 17th-20th centuries came from her own experience of what it meant to hide your identity to get your story, but not going as far as swapping skirts for trousers and signing-up for the army to fight! Fascination turned into research and ended up with this book to commemorate them. If you are not able to or do not wish to provide us with any contact details (landline or mobile number and email address) you won‚Äôt be able to purchase a ticket online. Please visit the library that is hosting the event to purchase a ticket in person. Walton Library and Vivien Morgan are looking forward to seeing you!
Title: Cross-Dressed to Kill, Author Talk with Vivien Morgan at Walton Library
Subtitle: Illustrated Author Talk with Vivien Morgan on her book "Cross-dressed to Kill"  at Walton Library

Description: Violent Divinity: Immersive Audiovisual Exhibtion An act that introduces historicity and ruptures the archetypical presence, as perceived by the audience, entails an experience of violence and birth. Inspired by Siteng‚Äôs debut art pop EP, which features a violently nurturing subaquatic world, the immersive audiovisual experience, Violent Divinity, summons an underwater bloom of Asian artists. As artist/scenographer, JINGYI curated a biotically diverse wetland in a living home space. Encompassing photography, experimental films, performance arts, and interactive installations, the artworks highlight the power in acknowledging & transforming battle scars into art and thriving in a hostile environment. Siteng and JINGYI also ensure that the resonance will be further amplified by the Scene to create ripples through space and time. With a splashing multi-sensory opening performance, Violent Divinity will be followed by a five-day exhibition. The opportunity created to champion Asian artists will ripple far into the global art scene. The exhibition features works from 8 interdisciplinary artists of Asian origins: Siteng, JINGYI, Flo Yuting Zhu, Alya Kautsaranti, Julia D√®ng H√†nz√∫, Runxuan Yang, Aashfaria Anwar, and Luyin Cao. The exhibition is generously supported by Wired4Music, Youth Music, and LuckyPot. Contact sitenmusic@outlook.com and jingyi_studio@outlook.com for inquiries.
Title: Violent Divinity: Immersive Audiovisual Exhibition
Subtitle: An exhibition featuring 8 Asian Artists' eclectic works ‚Äì inspired by Siteng's debut art pop EP.

Description: Come and experience the healing power of sound and join me for a weekday sound immersion with guided meditation and gentle breathwork. Allow the beautiful sound frequencies of the crystal bowls to wash away your stresses and worries. Give yourself permission to relax and let the sound do it's magic to restore you. "Listen, listen. This wonderful sound brings me back to true self" - Thich Nhat Hanh. No experience necessary, the whole session will be guided. Yoga matts, cushions and blankets provided. Please wear comfortable clothes. Layers and warm socks also recommended as body temperature can fluctuate during a sound bath. Bring water too as it's very important to stay hydrated after a sound bath. Important information: Contraindications: please note this event is not suitable for women in their first trimester or very close to their due date. Is is also not suitable for anyone with a pacemaker/difibrillator fitted or metal plates/pins in the body; who have epilepsy, serious mental health issues or are intoxicated. If unsure if a sound bath is suitable for you, please get in touch.

Description: It's London Repair Week and we want you to love your clothes for longer. But what do you do if your clothes are beyond repair? We have plenty of ideas for repurposing or upcycling fabrics! This workshop will introduce you to the delightful and satisfying craft of creating a piece of patchwork from scraps of fabric. You will learn: ‚Ä¢ how to choose the right fabrics ‚Ä¢ how to make your templates ‚Ä¢ how to prepare the hexagons ‚Ä¢ how to sew together by hand. We will also discuss ideas for things you will be able to make from your patchwork, however large or small you want to make it. At the end of the class you will have the beginnings of a patchwork project which you can take home and continue to make into anything you like. At the Textile Repair Caf√©, we keep our class sizes small to allow plenty of time for questions and 1 to 1 guidance as necessary. WHAT TO BRING All equipment and materials will be provided. You will have access to a selection of suitable fabric scraps but feel free to bring along your own fabric / old clothes if you have a particular colour palette in mind.
Title: Introduction to Patchwork using Hand Sewing and Paper Piercing
Subtitle: Learn how to transform fabric scraps into heirloom patchwork using simple hexagon templates and hand stitching

Description: Dear community,Join us for a transformative experience at "Tribal Sound Journeys+"This immersive event offers more than just a good time - it is a sacred pathway to holistic well-being and self-empowerment.Engage in Somatic Movements to unlock or release energy, and connect deeper with your body and emotions. Activate your self-awareness during Meditation, and experience the therapeutic power and higher self-guidance during a Tribal Sound Journey.The benefits include stress relief, increased mindfulness, enhanced creativity, and a deeper connection to your body, mind, soul, and community.Join us for an evening that fosters personal growth, joy, and a renewed sense of vitality. Your presence will enrich the event and contribute to your overall well-being.Time frames:18.30 - 19.00 - arrivals+social19.00 - 20.45 - workshop20.45 - 21.15 - leavingThings to bring with you to make your evening more comfortable:‚Ä¢ üß£ blanket or a big scarf (to cover yourself during the sound journey, we have many cushions)‚Ä¢ üç∂ bottle of water (to keep yourself hydrated during the night)‚Ä¢ ü´ñ Tea and some refreshments will be available before and at the end of the event (you can bring yours too, vegan preferred, thank you üôè)All Spirit-Key events are free of charge and are on donation-based terms with all money being raised going to charity and non-profit organizations. We will have an event in the springtime planting trees.We do not want to put a 'suggested donation', please be mindful that we need to cover the cost of hiring the venue and are raising money for those in need.Your generosity is appreciated.About the facilitator:Meet Mantis Oras, a skilled facilitator, youth worker, and musician specialising in community activities like Drumming Circles, Tribal Sound Journeys, Fire Rituals, Brotherhood Circles, and Unique Workshops.His intuitive, powerful yet humble approach, paired with trauma-informed, music leadership, martial arts, dance, and shamanic expertise creates transformative and safe spaces.In these spaces, Mantis guides exploration, expression, reflection and nurturing.We rise by helping each other rise!Donations online - EventBrite donation or supportive ticketsDonations on the door - cashOne love, many blessings"Spirit-Key": Mind = Body = Soul Reflections to inspire:It was very profound and touched me deeply. Just being in the safe and caring space was fantastic. I got more than I went for. It was great for my mind, body and soul.I will make time to come for future gatherings thanks to the warm and positive vibes ü§ó--------An absolutely incredible evening full of joy, love, wisdom and connection, literally helped me to go from a 4/10 to a solid 9/10, held by such a beautiful brother in such a beautiful authentic intuitive magical way. Blessed to have been able to go to one of these gatherings ü§ó
Title: "Spirit-Key":  Tribal Sound Journey+
Subtitle: Get ready to unlock your spirit with a powerful combination of somatic movement, meditation, and a mesmerizing tribal sound journey

Description: The London Cybersec Network is a Business Network dedicated to professionals working within London‚Äôs world-leading InfoSec industry & Related sectors. Join us at the Famous Burlington Arms in Mayfair for our March 2024 Networking Drinks Reception and join us in sampling their wonderful Food, Drinks and the opportunity to chat about the computing security sector, learn more about the many related topics and make new friends and seek out fresh business leads. Each ticket includes two drinks (alcoholic or soft) a food buffet and your own printed attendee sheet to take away. Running for over a Decade our networking events are a proven, cost effective and fun way to generate new business and connections. As the World of ComputerSecurity spans many different fields guests from any professional sector are welcome to book and attend. From consultants to lawyers. From software-engineers to CTO's to CEOs. Situated on a quiet street between Savile Row and Bond Street The Burlington Arms has been a feature of Mayfair life for almost two hundred years. We‚Äôll be enjoying their hospitality in their private lounge with food and drinks from their wide selection of craft beers, traditional ales, wines and spirits - their homemade scotch eggs proving to be a renowned favourite amongst food critics! Sectors represented:Application Security Cloud Security Consulting and Training Data Security:  Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity Endpoint Security Identity and Access Management (IAM) Incident Response Network Security Penetration Testing and Vulnerability Assessment Regulatory Compliance Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) Threat Intelligence All our networking events are extremely relaxed and casual affairs Just buy a ticket and turn up on the day and enjoy yourself! Our event will be held in the Burlington's Private Lounge from 18:00 till 20:30. A relaxing and productive way to end the working day and line-up meetings for the rest of the year ‚Äì just don‚Äôt forget to bring your business cards... This event is part of ‚ÄúTech Tuesday‚Äù - our Mid Monthly Meetup for London based‚Ä¶ *Fintechs *IT & Computing Experts *Ecommerce firms *Programmers + Developers *Artificial Intelligence *Cyber Security Businesses Plus firms from related and supporting industries - feel free to network with everyone at the event :)
Title: London Cybersecurity Mayfair March Business Networking Reception
Subtitle: London Cybersecurity Net: Monthly networking for experts, firms, startups, and enthusiasts to tackle challenges and forge ahead in InfoSec.

Description: This event by Unified Dating offers a relaxed and friendly way to easily meet new people locally. If for any reason the event that you want to book onto says Sales Ended please email us at customercare@unifieddating.com stating the event that you want to book onto and date so that we can check and confirm if it is possible for you to book on. If the Venue Name and Address are not on the event page then at the latest we will add this to the event page by 2 hours prior to the event start time. At that point you will then be able to see the Venue Name and Address on the event page if we have not added it prior to this. Bored of swiping on dating apps? Want to meet someone new? Stop swiping and start dating! We know what makes a great party and we‚Äôve designed our events to help people make the most of the night. The event will be with people single and ready to mingle. It really is that simple! Dress code: Dress to impress/smart casual/ be yourself! If the event has sold out, please add yourself to the waitlist or email us to be added to the waitlist as more places may become available. To register with Unified Dating please visit: https://www.unifieddating.com/ Book your ticket, arrive at the venue, introduce yourself to everyone, get a drink and easily meet new people in your area!. Bring A Friend: You can book tickets for friends at 50% off using code BringAFriend at checkout. You will need to ensure at least one ticket is booked at full price in order to bring friends at up to 50% off. Enter the code in the promo code section at checkout and click apply to then scroll and select the 50% off Bring A Friend tickets. Please note Bring A Friend tickets are for people that are single and looking to participate in the event. Please note this event is a dinner event and attendees are expected to order from the food menu. Please note the ticket price is simply to book on to attend this event. Any drinks or food you will need to purchase directly from the venue. You must not bring any food or drinks from outside into the venue. We cannot guarantee the availability of food or drinks. *Our events are for mixed ages. Our minimum age requirement is that attendees must be 18+ to book on and attend our events. *All attendees are required to have purchased a ticket for our events online prior to attending our events. We only sell our tickets online. We do not sell tickets at the event. Event Organiser: Unified Dating *Please note: Refund Policy: No Refunds. Additionally, we cannot guarantee the number or gender mix and do not offer refunds if some attendees fail to attend or the numbers are low or the gender mix skewed. As stated on this event page, order form and in our Terms and Conditions of Business we have a no refunds policy. We can offer an event credit if a valid reason is provided.  *Unified Dating has a zero tolerance policy towards any form of discrimination. News: Get Me Pampered has partnered with us to offer our customers 20% off on bookings!. Get Me Pampered offer hair, beauty and massage treatments at your home, hotel or office in London Zones 1 to 5 and Oxford, in other UK areas can also be offered at request. Find out more and to book for yourself, a group pamper party/ special event or as a gift: getmepampered.com. Use code GET20%OFF for 20% off at checkout on Get Me Pampered for bookings.
Title: Unified Dating Gay - Meet Singles over Dinner in London (Ages 28+)
Subtitle: Book your place on this offline in-person dinner event and easily connect with new people in your area!

Set in a relaxed, informal setting conducive to fostering connections and discussions, this gathering is pivotal for those in the gamin industry as well as support and advocacy groups. The event aims to facilitate a comprehensive dialogue among the diverse sectors, encouraging collaboration, sharing of best practices, and exploration of emerging trends and challenges within the gaming landscape. Attendees benefit from the unique opportunity to network with peers, engage with industry leaders, and develop partnerships that drive forward their objectives in an ever-evolving global environment. Sectors include:*Advertising, PR and Communications *Analytics and User Research *Art design *Communities and Social Networks *Education and Training: *Esports *Game Development & Programming *Game Engines+Tools *Game Publishing *Hardware Manufacturing *Indie Developers *Journalism & Reporting *Legal providers *Localization and Translation *Merchandise and Licensing *Music+Sound production *Online and Mobile Gaming *Streaming and Content Creation *Testing and Quality Assurance (QA) *Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR) Gaming Join us at the Famous Burlington Arms In The Heart Of Mayfair For Our March 2024 Networking Reception and join us in sampling their wonderful Food, Drinks and the opportunity talk about the immigration ecosystem, make new friends and seek out fresh business leads. Situated on a quiet street between Savile Row and Bond Street The Burlington Arms has been a feature of Mayfair life for almost two hundred years. By popular request this event is now part of ‚ÄúTech Tuesday‚Äù - our Monthly Meetup for London based‚Ä¶ *Fintechs *Ecommerce firms *Programmers + Developers *Artificial Intelligence Experts *Gaming Firms *Cyber Security Businesses *IT Experts - Plus firms from related and supporting industries - feel free to network with everyone at the event :) Each ticket includes two drinks (alcoholic or soft) a food buffet (including vegetarian options) and your own printed attendee sheet to take away. Our event will be held in their private lounge from 18:00 till 20:30. A relaxing and productive way to end the working day and line-up meetings for the rest of the year ‚Äì just don‚Äôt forget to bring your business cards... Running for over a Decade our events are a proven, cost effective and fun way to generate new business.

With a seemingly effortless style that‚Äôs eerily reminiscent of the original Sultans Of Smooth, Triffitt, Long and Adams croon their way through a timeless setlist that includes Fly Me To The Moon, New York New York, That‚Äôs Amore and Mr. Bojangles. Description: DateinaDash have been established for over 10 years organising the best Speed Dating events in London. With over 50,000 customers and more than 5,000 events organised we are the market leaders when it comes to Speed Dating in London. We have been hosting our Speed Dating events in Richmond since 2012 and it is a very popular evening and the busiest event for singles in South West London.  Our Speed Dating event in Richmond is for the age group 30-50 (it's a guide so a few years either side is absolutely fine!) the wide age group means there is a great mix of personalities and types so there is bound to be someone you're interested in! Infact, one happy couple tied the knot after meeting at our event in Richmond in 2017. The events take place in One Kew Road, a cosy pub situated opposite the train station making it very easy to travel to and find. We have the upstairs room exclusively and it's very big which means the dates are spaced out making it easy to hear your date. As this is one of our most popular nights, you can expect to meet at least 20 people over the course of the evening with each date lasting around 4 minutes.   Registration starts at 7:30pm and the action kicks off at 8pm. On arrival at the venue head upstairs and our host will greet you and explain the rules. Grab a drink at the bar and find your seat in good time before the fun begins. Don't worry if you've never done it before because most people are in the same boat and don't panic if you're flying solo because we are on hand to break the ice and introduce you to others. After a brief introduction the event begins and the men will rotate every 4 minutes when the whistle sounds. 4 minutes is enough time to establish whether you'd like to see that person again or not. It's fun, it's frantic and it's good fun! We will provide everything you need (name tags, scorecards & pens) or you can complete your matches on our mobile website. After each round simply make notes on who you like. A 'yes' and a 'yes' is a mutual match but we also offer a 'friend' option as a great way to make new connections. We believe there is no better way to meet new people than in person so ditch the endless dating apps and book a ticket to one of our upcoming Speed Dating events in Richmond today! What happens if I have no matches? The good news is, we have a 100% 'No Match' guarantee which means if you don't meet anyone you'd like to see again you can attend another event for FREE. To recap.. For more information on our events in Richmond and other areas please visit our website here https://dateinadash.com and for any questions contact us and we will be more than happy to help!  ¬†
Organizer: The Best Speed Dating Events in London
Title: Speed Dating in Richmond @ One Kew Road (Ages 30-50)
Subtitle: Enjoy a  Speed Dating event in Richmond for ages 30-50. Go on 15-20 dates in one evening. Tickets only ¬£20. It's fun, fast & flirty!

Description:
Join DateinaDash for our flagship Tuesday night Speed Dating event, exclusively held at the elegant 100 Wardour St in Soho, catering to ages 25-40. During the event, you'll get the chance to meet up to 20 people through 4-5 minute dates, with a refreshment interval midway.
 
 Promptly starting at 8pm, we advise guests to arrive 15-30 minutes before the scheduled start time for registration, as latecomers may not be able to participate. Upon arrival, the host will explain how the evening will unfold and provide you with a scorecard, name badge, and pen. The women will be seated, and the men will rotate between tables every 4 minutes.
 
 After each date, guests mark on their scorecards whether they would like to see that person again. There will be a 15-minute break halfway through the event for refreshments, and we invite you to join us for live music in the lounge club once the event finishes, perfect for socializing and continuing conversations.
 
 Before leaving, the host will collect all scorecards, and the matches will be collated on our website. The following day, you will receive an email with the results. Please keep in mind that spaces for our speed dating events are limited and sell out quickly, so book early to avoid disappointment.
 
 For any further inquiries regarding the event, feel free to reach out to us at enquiries@dateinadash.com or call our telephone bookings hotline on 0845 862 1448 (9am-5pm).
Title: **15-20 dates** Speed Dating Event in London | Ages 25-40
Subtitle: 15-20 fast dates at this fun Speed Dating event at the stylish 100 Wardour St in Soho. Ages 25-40. Tickets ¬£20. Stop swiping & start dating!

Description: DateinaDash, London's leading Speed Dating company present a fun Gay Speed Dating event at 100 Wardour St  in Soho for ages 21-45 (age guide). Enjoy an action packed Speed Dating experience with 15-20 dates in a exclusive venue in Soho This is a gorgeous venue with lots of spaced out seating and table service. On arrival at the venue at 7:30pm you'll be welcome by our friendly host and given a dating scorecard and pen. Head to the bar and grab a drink before the action starts. Once everyone has arrived and after a brief introduction of the rules half the men will be seated and the rest of the boys will rotate every 4 minutes. It's fast, it's fun & it's flirty! After each date simply make a note on your card or directly onto our website using your phone of your likes and dislikes and the following day we'll contact you with your matches.  We'll ensure there is an equal ratio of dates with a great mix of personalities. Infact, over 80% of our attendees get at least one match at our events but if you don't find anyone you would like to see again you can attend a second event for FREE.  Once the event finishes guests are welcome to stay in the venue and enjoy the live music downstairs. It's a great venue and the perfect place to meet new people.  We believe it's time to get offline, ditch the dating apps and start meeting people in person at one of our fun Speed Dating events in London!

Description:
DateinaDash are the market leaders for Speed Dating Events in London, established in 2011 we now host more events and have more matches at our singles nights than anyone else. Over 80% of our guests get at least one match but even if you don't find anyone you'd like to see again you can attend a future event for FREE. 
 
 About This Event
 
 Enjoy a fun and flirty night of Speed Dating in London at the exclusive 100 Wardour St in the heart of vibrant Soho. This event is for ages 25-40 age guide and you can expect to meet around 18-20 people over the course of two hours. This is one of our busiest events and attracts a young professional crowd and always has a great atmosphere.
 
 The event takes place in a semi private area called 'the atrium' at the front of the venue. We have table service during the event so no waiting around in a queue at the bar.  Easily one of our favourite venues with delicious cocktails and a fantastic atmosphere. 
 
 Speed Dating is a fun way to meet lots of people in a relaxed and pressure free environment. Each date lasts about 3-4 minutes, women will be seated and the men will rotate when the host blows the whistle. There will be a break half way through for refreshments. The following day guests will be e-mailed any matches and you will be able to contact each other through our website or alternatively do your matches using your phone during the event and get instant results at the end of the night. 
 
 There will be plenty of time for guests to socialise after the event ends and with live music until late it's the perfect excuse to let your hair down and enjoy a cocktail or two!
 
 Our events do sell out in advance so please book early to avoid disappointment! 
 
 Please get in touch if you have any questions about this event and we will be more than happy to help with your query.
Organizer: DateinaDash: Speed Dating London & Singles Parties

Description: DateinaDash have been established for over 10 years organising the best Speed Dating events in London. With over 50,000 customers and more than 5,000 events organised we are the market leaders when it comes to Speed Dating in London. We have been hosting our Speed Dating events in Richmond since 2012 and it is a very popular evening and the busiest event for singles in South West London.  Our Speed Dating event in Richmond is for the age group 30-50 (it's a guide so a few years either side is absolutely fine!) the wide age group means there is a great mix of personalities and types so there is bound to be someone you're interested in! Infact, one happy couple tied the knot after meeting at our event in Richmond in 2017. The events take place in One Kew Road, a cosy pub situated opposite the train station making it very easy to travel to and find. We have the upstairs room exclusively and it's very big which means the dates are spaced out making it easy to hear your date. As this is one of our most popular nights, you can expect to meet at least 20 people over the course of the evening with each date lasting around 4 minutes.   Registration starts at 7:30pm and the action kicks off at 8pm. On arrival at the venue head upstairs and our host will greet you and explain the rules. Grab a drink at the bar and find your seat in good time before the fun begins. Don't worry if you've never done it before because most people are in the same boat and don't panic if you're flying solo because we are on hand to break the ice and introduce you to others. After a brief introduction the event begins and the men will rotate every 4 minutes when the whistle sounds. 4 minutes is enough time to establish whether you'd like to see that person again or not. It's fun, it's frantic and it's good fun! We will provide everything you need (name tags, scorecards & pens) or you can complete your matches on our mobile website. After each round simply make notes on who you like. A 'yes' and a 'yes' is a mutual match but we also offer a 'friend' option as a great way to make new connections. We believe there is no better way to meet new people than in person so ditch the endless dating apps and book a ticket to one of our upcoming Speed Dating events in Richmond today! What happens if I have no matches? The good news is, we have a 100% 'No Match' guarantee which means if you don't meet anyone you'd like to see again you can attend another event for FREE. To recap.. For more information on our events in Richmond and other areas please visit our website here https://dateinadash.com and for any questions contact us and we will be more than happy to help!
Organizer: DateinaDash: Speed Dating London & Singles Parties

Description: Tala's classes radiate with playfulness, kindness, and love. She creates a safe and nurturing environment where participants feel held and where every asana (pose) is a purposeful step towards self-discovery. Yoga is a gentle tool that can be used to help you navigate the realms of your inner world. What to expect: Revel in this midday escape and return to your day feeling refreshed, centered, and inspired! About Tala: Tala is a Palestinian yoga instructor with a passion for decolonizing the wellness industry. At the heart of her classes, yoga is acknowledged as a holistic tool, forging a connection between individuals and their highest selves. The emphasis lies on portraying the practice as a transformative movement meditation. She uses yoga as a gentle tool to help people befriend their bodies where trauma of the past may be stored. Her classes cultivate a safe space for students to reflect on their inner and outer worlds with love and ease. Tala invites students to not only move their bodies but also connect with the profound wisdom and heritage that yoga offers for a transformative experience. She is dedicated to educating her students on the true roots of yoga, believing that understanding its origins is crucial for reaping its full benefits. Unless otherwise stated, Tala's classes are suitable for all levels.
Title: CEREMONIAL YOGA
Subtitle: Take a rejuvenating break from the hustle of your day-to-day with this sacred yoga practice. Perfect for a midday mental refresher...

Description: Upcoming Art exhibition, as part of Make Arts in Nine Elms, The Garden of Abundance is a Fashion & Textile installation reflecting on the theme of  Grow & Flourish by F√©e Uhssi showcasing a variety of textile art & fashion recycling  creations; from recycled , upcycled and transformed fashion items to F√©e Uhssi's unique art of Fashion Wrapping and Furoshiki designs to patchwork, collage and other playful creations, the Garden of Abundance is the fruit of the Artist's reflection on what growing and flourishing means as an individual but also as a community. It is also a testimony of the relationship between fashion and textile production and Nature aiming to raise awareness on environtmental issues. The Garden of Abundance is an evolutive and collaborative installation aiming to raise awareness on sustainability while celebrating Diversity in Nature and Humanity. Therefore it offers an opportunity  to Nine Elms, Battersea and Wandsworth residents and community members to get involved and contribute to the Garden by creating a piece to be added to the final installation.  F√©e Uhssi is a Wandsworth-based, Franco Nigerian Fashion & Textile Artist, Wellness Coach, Art & Colour Therapist and Community Activist with a passion for promoting positive living, togetherness through Arts. TÔªøhese 3 hours workshops will give you the oportunity to  discover a range of textile art tecnhiques and create a unique piece that will be showcased as part of the final installation.

Description: The Food Teachers Centre, together with the support of host schools, are offering Marking and Moderation meetings to support GCSE NEA 1 and 2 and  WJEC Hospitality & Catering L1-2 NEA. The meetings are being held across the country in March 2024 in twilight or Saturday sessions. The aim of the face-to-face meeting is to bring teachers together to look at the Marking and Moderation of GCSE NEA 1 and 2 and/or H&C Unit 2 NEA. It is also an excellent opportunity to network with other teachers within your area. Please note: The exam boards that are included are: This is a community style meeting, which is less formal and more self-help than our other training days. As there are over 50 regional meetings, the Food Teachers Centre team try to attend as many as possible, but we cannot attend them all. To ensure that people get the most effective help we can provide, you will have access to an informative video presentation prior to the meeting. Your host will also receive a video to recap the key points and activities for the meeting. By the end of the sessions/event teachers/trainers will be able to: The training will provide effective professional development by giving: Standards are from the government framework: Food teaching in secondary schools: A framework of knowledge and skills 1. Developing professional competence 1.3 Further their professional expertise by selecting appropriate professional development activities, such as shadowing, school visits, practical training in food skills or updating their subject knowledge (through face-to-face events and online training) Teachers from the different exam boards (AQA, EDUQAS, OCR and WJEC Hospitality and Catering) will be together initially but will have the opportunity to discuss and moderate each other‚Äôs work with colleagues from the same board during the workshop. (N.B. For boards that have small national uptake (like OCR) we cannot guarantee this at every event). Outline agenda: 1. Welcome and light refreshments 2. NEA Marking and Moderation - a QUICK recap of key points (a detailed RECORDED presentation for GCSE and H&C will be made available PRIOR to the event in the NEA TOGETHER Training room) 3. Exam Board based group workshop - moderating with colleagues 4. Q&A - next steps/networking AND Please bring some work to mark with colleagues - at least 1 NEA submission. Please remember these need to stay confidential throughout the process, as these are live projects. Note: You do not need to have completed the NEA process in school or finished marking to attend. I have found some really useful resources - including presentations on things to check when marking the NEAs and the evidence which the moderators want to have clearly marked. If you haven't been to any of the NEA - Together events, then this could be a really good option for you. It's pretty budget friendly at ¬£20 as well. Jordi Major Wonderful resources - the best CPD I have had in 13 years of teaching. Ben Taylor I've used the NEA Training to help with marking and preparing for next term. It is really useful information, especially if it's your first time running one of the GCSE courses. Emma Fenn We ask for a minimum donation of ¬£20 to help us cover the costs of video production, emailing and setting up the on-line training room and managing the tickets.
Title: NEA Mark and Moderate Together (HATFIELD)
Subtitle: The Food Teachers Centre, together with the support of host schools, are offering Marking and Moderation meetings to support GCSE and  H&C.

Description: Near Ten Miles Around - John Rocque and the growth of London Join us for an exciting in-person event at the London Metropolitan Archives to explore the fascinating journey of London's growth through the work of 18th Century cartographer John Rocque. Discover how Rocque's 1746 map 'An Exact Survey of the city's of London Westminster ye Borough of Southwark and the Country near ten miles round / begun in 1741 & ended in 1745' charts the early modern expansion of London into previously suburban and rural regions of what is now Greater London, using this highly detailed and beautifully engraved map of London and its environs as a starting point. We will be giving a a 30 minute talk, followed by a 30 minute document viewing and handling sessions in which you will get a chance to see and handle original and reproduced engravings of Rocque's famous plans of Georgian London. This event is part of a series and will focus on South London. See our other listing on Eventbrite for sessions on North, East and West London later in the year. Each session will also repeat later in the year.
Title: 'Near Ten Miles Around' - John Rocque and the growth of South London
Subtitle: This talk and document viewing will tell the story of the growth and development of South London, using sections of John Rocque's 1746 map.

Description: Networking is all about building up relationships.  When you make a purchasing decision quite often people look at the recommendations of others who have already purchased before they buy and networking works on the same basis.  Get to know the people in your group, find out about them and their businesses and explore how you can collaborate and help each other out. There a plenty of opportunities to network with 60 groups in the UK and 7 national online only groups within WIBN and our social media platforms have a reach of over 50,000. Come along and see what WIBN networking is all about.  We don‚Äôt pressure you into joining but we will assure you of a warm welcome and some great connections. Here‚Äôs what some of our visitors have said:- ‚Ä¢	I really enjoyed yesterday. Much more than I thought I would if I‚Äôm honest! You are all so knowledgeable and insightful. It‚Äôs all so new to me and it‚Äôs great to feel I‚Äôm in the company of those who are experienced in business in the ways you all are.  ‚Ä¢	I‚Äôve never done any anything like this in my 25 years of business, only training courses, I love the way the lockdown has encouraged us to stretch out a bit and take new pathways.  ‚Ä¢	Networking is a long term investment, and the rewards are priceless - both from a work and personal perspective. You don‚Äôt have to be part of a corporate business to benefit from networking, we have a wide variety of business women in the network.  Some members are employed by businesses whilst others run their own. Some are full time, some part time and all sorts of professions are represented. We would love to meet you and here about what you do so please do take the plunge and book in a visit! This  group meets at The Prae Wood Arms  and the cost includes lunch.

Description: Experience the mesmerizing rhythms of Royal Holloway‚Äôs 21-piece percussion ensemble. Featuring an eclectic mix of modern percussion chamber pieces, this concert promises a thrilling exploration of sound, rhythm, and musical expression with composers Steve Reich, Walker Martz, Lisa Ann Marsh, and more. Don't miss this unique opportunity to witness the power and precision of percussion, brought to life by the talented performers of the Royal Holloway Percussion Ensemble and their Director, Dr Tom Wagner. This event is presented as part of the New Sounds Festival 2024, in partnership with the International Concert Series at Royal Holloway University of London. When you arrive for a College event at our Egham campus, please park in car parks 12 or 4. Car park 12 can be accessed by turning right as you enter the main College gates and is located next to the tennis courts. If this car park is full, please drive further onto our campus to car park 4, which can be accessed by turning left at the mini-roundabout behind the Students‚Äô Union. We would advise that you bring the College map to campus with you and give yourself plenty of time to park. Blue Badge holders can find designated parking spaces in Car park 1W, as well as between Gardeners Lodge and the Williams Annexe. You can find these locations by looking at our campus map opposite. If you require any assistance on arrival, please contact our premises team in advance of your visit by emailing: premisesadmin@royalholloway.ac.uk and they will be happy to help. Please note that we operate an Automatic Number Plate Recognition (ANPR) system on certain parts of our campus, however if you are here for an organised event, parking is unrestricted for event guests in car parks 12, 4 or 14 (or display your blue badge permit if parking in a disabled bay). If you have any questions about parking, please email: premisesadmin@royalholloway.ac.uk
Title: New Sounds 2024: Pulses with Royal Holloway Percussion Group
Subtitle: Experience the mesmerizing rhythms of Royal Holloway‚Äôs 21-piece percussion ensemble, featuring an eclectic mix of modern percussion pieces.

Description: When: Every Tuesday (term time)Where: Marshalswick Family Centre, Sherwood Park, Sherwood Avenue, St Albans, Time: 4.15-5.15pm Suitable for: Years 9,10,11 students (without their adults) who identify as LGBTQIA+, gender non-conforming or questioning their identity along with those who identify as being from a neurodiverse or neurodivergent background. Free to attend If you‚Äôd like to make a donation towards our work, please choose 'donation' as your ticket option. If you'd like to come along - please book a free place, this will take you to a form which needs to be completed by a parent/carer/responsible adult. We provide a safe space within St Albans for weekly meet ups that will introduce years 9,10 and 11 students to the world of horticultural therapy! We plan to meet indoors until spring comes at the Marshalswick Family Centre, we will provide a range of forest school activities, along with planning what to grow at the community garden and starting off seedlings. When Spring arrives we will meet the group at our community garden, located at The Sandridge Road Allotments. Some of the benefits to Young People are; improved mental health, emotional wellbeing, confidence and resilience, sense of self potential, improved physical health, increased life skills and knowledge about sustainability and where food comes from and how to grow your own food!If you're not within this age range but know someone who is/who might be interested, please do share with them! We also have a Grow & Gather Group which meets the first Saturday of each month and is open to all, we wold love to see you there! The OLLIE Foundation was launched in 2016 by three parents who, having each lost a teenage son to suicide, pledged to prevent such losses for other families. OLLIE is devoted to empowering individuals and organisations to reduce suicide in their communities through education, intervention, and prevention. By providing the right support and knowledge, we're confident in our ability and yours to create positive change and save lives because‚Ä¶ One Life Lost Is Enough Contact: If you have any questions about the group please contact katie@theolliefoundation.org Access support: If we can provide any access support, including support to complete our booking form, please contact: katie@theolliefoundation.org
Title: ENRICH: Growing with Pride
Subtitle: A supported, nature based weekly group for LGBTQIA+/gender non-conforming and neurodiverse 13-16 year old's local to St Albans.

Description:
Join us for our newest event, Tuesday night Gay Speed Dating at The Roxy in Soho, exclusively hired for our age 21-45 attendees. Enjoy table service throughout the night at this beautiful venue.
 
 Expect to meet around 15-20 people for 4-5 minute dates, with a half-time interval for refreshments. The event will begin at 8 pm sharp, so please arrive 15-30 minutes before the scheduled start time for registration. If you are late, you may not be able to participate.
 
 Once everyone is registered, the host will explain the event and provide you with a scorecard and pen. Half the men will be seated, and the other half will rotate between tables every 4 minutes.
 
 After the event, you'll have the opportunity to meet everyone. Guests mark their scorecards after each date, indicating whether they would like to see that person again. Alternatively, use our mobile website to log your matches and get the results immediately after the event ends!
 
 Join us in the club after the event to continue the conversation and socialize. The following day, we'll email you with the results, and if you have a match, you can communicate with them through our safe and secure website.
 
 Please note that speed dating spots are limited, and most of our events sell out. To avoid disappointment, book early.
 
 If you have any questions about this event, please contact us at enquiries@dateinadash.com or call our telephone bookings hotline on 0845 862 1448 (9am-5pm).
 
 
 
 
 
 Regenerate response
Title: Gay Speed Dating in London (Ages 21-45)
Subtitle: DateinaDash host a lively Gay Speed Dating event in Soho on Tuesday night for singles aged 21-45. Tickets only ¬£20. Expect 15-20 dates.

Description: Note: bring a journal/pen I am a certified Therapist & Coach taking a holisitc & somatic approach to healing & self-development as well as anxiety, stress relief and depression recovery support. I specialise in inner child, trauma and attachment wound healing and subconscious repgrogramming. I am dedicated to support and empower you to transform anxiety, fears and limiting beliefs so you can step into your true, authentic self with love, trust & courage. Take time out for ‚ÄòYOU‚Äô to access inner peace, find a deeper connection and help regain a sense of control and clarity over any emotional struggles, challenges and/or life transitions. You will experience a full session of deep, conscious connected Breathwork to regulate your nervous system, facilitate mind and body healing, release suppressed emotions and/or unresolved trauma, relieve anxiety, stress, depression, and rebalance and reenergise the body. It will help restore safety and trust in the body and mind, and hold space for an emotional releases and somatic movement (e.g. tapping). It will also include coaching and therapy tools and practices to learn and take away with you. The Breathwork session will be made of 2 parts: 1st half is active, transformational, deep belly breathing and long breath holds . It will discharge the Sympathetic nervous system, remove excess cortisol, facilitate healing and offer emotional release. Breath holds increase CO2 tolerance which increases O2 in body, alkalises blood, teaches trust and accesses deep inner peace. 2nd half is slow, conscious connected breathing to regulate and rebalance nervous system, teach it to feel safe again and sync up heart with rest of body. Allow you to access deep relaxation What will happen in the Workshop? 1. You will learn the science behind Breathwork and understand how it is your internal medicine to manage and relieve any emotional and mental struggles such as anxiety, stress or depression. 2. You will learn how to set intentions in an effective way and we will call upon these at the start of the Breathwork and seal in the cacao ceremony at the end. 3. We will do some therapeutic self-development work around anxiety, specifically around transforming your relationship with anxiety (I go into this deeper in the 'Transform your Relationship with Anxiety workshops). There will be some journalling questions to help you bring conscious awareness and compassion to the subconscious thoughts and limiting beliefs driving the feelings in the body that are driving the unhealthy and unwanted patterns of behaviours, habits, choices and responses. 4 . You will learn and takeaway tools and daily practices to help challenge and reframe the negative thoughts and 'untruths'., with your truths. 5 . As you start to challenge your thoughts with your truths, you will create some powerful affirmations that we will weave into the Breathwork session and I will teach you some simple tapping (eft) to combine this with. 5. You will experience a full deep session of Breathwork which will be carefully curated to offer you the space and somatic support for any emotional release. I will encourage sound and movement and guide you through your journey. 6. You will tap into the power of your breath and use it to connect, regulate your nervous system, enter theta brainwave state where healing and change work can happen, access inner peace, cultivate acceptance, trust, love and compassion for yourself 7. After the Breathwork your body and mind will be in an optimal state for some meditation 8. We will end the workshop with a short cacao ceremony to seal intentions, share experiences if you feel like it and have a final release and celebration with some movement/dance You will take away practices and tools to help manage and alleviate daily anxiety symptoms, build resilience and continue restoring safety and love for yourself to live life with joy, love and courage and be everything you're meant to be, not who you 'think' you're supposed to be. You will start regaining control of the mind, reframing toxic thoughts, unlearning limiting beliefs and generating healthier, truthful, empowering thought structures. The key to healing is within our subconscious mind as well as our body supplemented by the right support, enough self-compassion and courage to take personal responsibility. NOTE As we breath deeper and faster we enter the theta brainwave state (hypnotic/dream like state) where the subconscious mind is most open and receptive to change. This offers you the opportunity for some powerful healing and self-development work W hen we function from fear - we lose sight of our true self and fail to meet our own needs, seeking validation, approval and safety from external sources. What trumps fear? Love. When we choose to be more loving, kind and compassionate with ourselves, we can allow ourselves to feel, heal, grow and evolve into who we are meant to be with courage, purpose and passion. ---------------------------------------------------------------- I am humbled to take you on this healing and self-development journey. It will b e 1.5 or 2 hour nourishing & empowering experience to honour your feelings, learn how to love yourself, control your mind, heal your body and upgrade your life. You will leave feeling empowered and more connected with yourself to regain control of the anxiety to continue cultivating a healthier relationship with it. Please feel free to contact me to ask any questions: Insta: @aliyahcoaching Whatsapp/message: 07944127004 website: www.breathe-feel-heal.com Check and add a google review: https://www.google.com/search?hl=en-GB&gl=uk&q=Breathe-Feel-Heal&ludocid=10397374060940211643&lsig=AB86z5Ub831TdxuUJtMsryDyW89L&mat=CYzv_2C_ce2hElcBl7_Ll826aMMV-ZWTMeqq-e7Wba3q0EboU8nF2D5PgZQaBrXVkqHKRCnslK_BMoN_nu5hPslQyu6qZtRWbNY1S2LcUi5joXPIRL7E4efTs6EhamzmlH8&authuser=1
Title: Breathwork Workshop & Energising Cacao - Release Stress & Self-Regulate
Subtitle: Tap into the healing and nourishing power of your own breath - your internal medicine to self-heal & regulate your nervous system.

Description: Java OOP Course (Object-oriented programming)  Online Interactive Instructor-led, practical, hands-on. Who would find this course useful? Or use our interface. Duration: 1 Day Breaks: At 1pm about 30 minutes lunch break and after every session a small break,¬† Session 1:   Using packages,  Creating and calling methods, parameters, retrun values, method overloading,  Data protection through encapsulation Returning multiple values, Unknown number of input parameters. ¬†Session 2:  Classes, objects.  Inheritance, Method Override, Polymorphism or runtime binding¬†.  Final keyword.  Create final classes, methods, and variables. Static keyword. Instance and class variables. Lamba-methods. Session 3: Constructors, parameterised constructors, this and super keywords  Create abstract classes and methods,  Create and use an interface¬† Session 4: Use the access modifiers protected and the default (package-friendly).  Create static variables, methods, and initialisers. Nested classes , inner classes. Singletons. Enum.

Description: This is a 1-hour intermediate level dance class. You don‚Äôt need to bring a partner. We will rotate partners in class. This is a walk-in class, not a course, so these classes can be taken in any order, start any time and drop in whenever you like. Please read the level description to make sure you are ready to take this class. This class is not for beginners. When? 8.30pm-10pm Tuesdays, with practice time afterwards. Registration opens from 8pm, so come early to get a drink and warm up before class. Where? Jazzbourne, 443 New Cross Road, London SE14 6TA If you book online: ¬£15 per class or buy a package of class credits for great savings here. If you pay at the door: Booking is not essential, walk-ins are very welcome. If paying at the door, the price per person is ¬£15 (if you take the 7pm class too, the price is ¬£25 for both). We are cashless, so card/contactless payments only please. This is a Level 2 class. You should already be familiar with Lindy Hop basics, including 8-count, 6-count and Lindy Charleston. You should have some experience with social dancing, and be comfortable dancing with a variety of partners. You MUST know how to Swing Out and Lindy Circle to take this class, no exceptions. This is a walk-in class, so you can start anytime and drop in when you like. You don‚Äôt need to take these classes in any particular order and it‚Äôs no problem if you miss a week or attend irregularly. This is a traditional Lindy Hop class, meaning you will have to choose at the start of the class whether you want to learn the ‚ÄúLeader‚Äù role or the ‚ÄúFollower‚Äù role. We encourage all our students to try both roles, because they are both fun in different ways. At the start of each class the teacher will ask you to choose the role you would like to dance today. You can always choose the other role next time! All our classes are gender-neutral. Cancellation Policy: Due to administrative costs and the small capacity of our events, all bookings are non-refundable. If you cancel your booking more than 48 hours before the event, we can give you the balance as a credit to your account or in your name to use for a future event. Alternatively, if you contact us more than 48 hours before the event, we can transfer your booking to another person you name. No-shows and cancellations with less than 48 hours notice will not be refunded and no credit given. If you book through EventBrite, the EventBrite booking fee is non-refundable in all cases. Questions? Check out our Frequently Asked Questions page. Or email info@jazzbourne.com Photos by: Matt Christie
Title: Intermediate Swing Dance lesson with Sharon Davis
Subtitle: Take your Lindy Hop fundamentals to the next level. A weekly drop-in class with teacher Sharon Davis. Learn to swing dance at Jazzbourne!
