Description: Banner description can be found at the bottom of this page. We will learn elements of three Indian classical dance forms: kathak, bharatanatyam and odissi, through attuning to our non-visual senses as a means of learning and embodying movement. Workshops will be led by Meera Patel (kathak), Shivaangee Agrawal (bharatanatyam) and Maryam Shakiba (odissi), focusing on one style within a single workshop. This time round, we are excited to be joined by Baluji Shrivastav OBE, who will co-facilitate and provide live Indian classical music for workshops 3-8 (13th Feb - 19th March). Who are these workshops for? We are prioritising the workshop spaces for blind and partially sighted adults. We are also interested in working with D/deaf, disabled and neurodiverse adults, adults with other sensory impairments / sensitivities and adults who suffer from long-term health conditions. If you are a sighted individual / do not identify as disabled and are interested in joining the workshops, please get in touch at Sensing.IC.Dance@gmail.com with the date(s) you would like to attend. You will be put on a waiting list and will be contacted on the Friday before the workshop date if places are available. Access Participants will be collected from the Lilian Baylis Stage Door Reception / Cafe area and taken to the studio. The studio has step-free access. Accessibility information including a visual guide can be found on Sadler‚Äôs Wells website here. There will be a company access worker on hand to support with navigating to and from Angel Underground Station to the venue, access in and around the venue including toilets and rest areas and any additional access needs during the workshop. If you require assistance from Angel Underground Station, please answer 'yes' when asked in the Order Form. If you plan to attend with your own guide or support worker, please book a separate 'Companion' ticket. There will be a BSL interpreter for all workshops. Contact Any questions or issues with booking, please get in touch at Sensing.IC.Dance@gmail.com Supported using public funding by Arts Council England. Supporting partners: Sadler's Wells, CICD, Attenborough Arts Centre, Akademi With thanks to Quiplash who are providing access consultancy across the project. Banner description: A mosaic of images of brown-skinned people in triangles. From left to right: Photo credits 1, 2, 4 - Christy Ku, 3 - Simon Richardson
Title: Learn Indian classical dance through your non-visual senses
Subtitle: Workshops return to Sadler's Wells as part of the second phase of project 'Sensing Indian Classical Dance' by Meera Patel

Description: This course is designed for anyone looking for: Yoga is for everyone and is an awareness practice. Main objectives in this course is to teach you the fundamentals of a balanced yoga practice - posture, breathwork, meditation and relaxation - in an inclusive and welcoming environment. You‚Äôll learn the fundamentals of yoga in order to build a strong foundation and understanding of yoga. Every class will contain elements of a rounded yoga practice: Please book for each week you can attend individually. About the instructor: Sinem Er is a Yoga Alliance USA certified E-RYT 500 and YACEP teacher (YA ID: 147459) She has led Yoga Alliance USA Approved 200-hour Teacher Training Programs and Continuing Education Programs since 2014. She teaches multi-level, alignment-based vinyasa yoga classes, grounded in the practices of mindfulness and compassion. She has been practicing yoga since 2005 and has found a great joy in sharing the teachings of yoga since 2010. She was fortunate enough to learn about yoga from many valuable teachers, but her root teacher is Cyndi Lee, the first western female yoga teacher to integrate yoga and Buddhism, the founder of the legendary OM Yoga School. She completed her 200-hour training in 2010 and 500-hour advanced training in 2015 with her. www.sinemeryoga.co.uk You will be welcomed to the beautiful Mayfair Library Rooms overlooking Mount Street Gardens, the perfect setting to relax and focus on your practice. (Photos below).
Title: Feel Better With Yoga - Mayfair
Subtitle: For anyone interested in starting or re-visiting an accessible, balanced yoga practice from the ground up.

Description: At EYPaD we will be providing a healthy low-cost lunch from Monday to Friday between 11.00 am to 12.30 pm at our family friendly Cafe. Please book 24 hours in advance or you can order on the day. Please be aware you can pay cash in the office or book via eventbrite FREE CAR PARKING AVAILABLE Sensory Zone is strictly for children from birth to 12 months/ crawlers and Explore Zone and Garden is for children walking to 60 months. This is for the safety and comfort of other patrons. If you have an older child and a baby, please book the Explore Zone and speak to a member of staff who can provide you with some portable baby-appropriate toys. Sensory Zone: This is a place of wonder for you to enjoy with your child (birth to crawling/12 months); filled with a huge variety of age and stage appropriate materials to stimulate your baby and help them develop the essential skills for later learning. Explore Zone and Garden: Young children are curious, with growing sense of independence and, of course, full of energy! The Explore Zone and Garden are the ideal playground for young minds to challenge themselves; building, exploring, imaginative role-play, gardening, messy play ‚Äì we have it all. Please ensure you book the right session for your child and access appropriate play zone. You may arrive at any time for your session from the allocated start time, however, the session has a designated end time, and the room needs to be re-set for the next session. Therefore, if you arrive late, you will have a shorter time to enjoy the facilities. PLEASE NOTE: While in the centre, your child/ren remain your full responsibility at all times. Other information: N o food or drinks allowed in the session. However, water is available in the session. There is a private Baby Feeding Lounge where you can enjoy a quieter feeding experience with your baby. However, the centre is Breastfeeding Friendly and therefore, you are welcome to breastfeed in any of the public areas.
Title: EYPaD: Kids Lunch
Subtitle: We will be providing a healthy low-cost breakfast every Monday between 9.00 am to 10.30 am at our family friendly Cafe.

Description: London has a fantastic pub culture and some of these establishments have been trading for over 400 years. Our pub tours take in the hidden gems, literary haunts, pubs with a nefarious story and those providing both traditional and new-age craft beer experiences. Each week I will focus on different areas of London and groups of up to 10 will be personally be guided by me around 4 classic pubs enabling the inquisitive traveller to easily engage with my city's unique pubs. EÔªøxplore the pub where a soldier caught cheating at cards came back to haunt the property after his fellow players took their revenge. Discover a tiny gem assembled over three floors and full of memorabilia and listed bar equipment. We will drink in the pub frequented by the Beatles whose manager lived across the street and enjoy a beer in the room where the Great Train Robbery was planned
Title: The Hidden Mews Pubs of Belgravia
Subtitle: London is full of tiny mews streets behind large mansions and embassies which we will stroll along, stopping at the unique pubs within them

Description: Join us as we embark on a journey through Brixton, uncovering hidden gems and indulging in delicious African and Caribbean cuisine. Here's what you can expect during this unforgettable experience: Historical Landmarks: Visit iconic sites that hold cultural significance, delving into the history of Brixton. Brixton's Art Scene: Explore the vibrant street art scene, discovering captivating artworks that showcase the area's creativity. Brixton Market: Step into Brixton Market, a bustling hub where cultures collide and flavors intertwine. Explore the vibrant stalls and immerse yourself in the multi-cultural atmosphere. Indigenous Flavours: Discover new African and Caribbean foods, fruits, and spices, expanding your palate. Local Eateries: The highlight of our tour will be visiting 4/5 exceptional local eateries that specialise in African and Caribbean cuisine. Prepare to be tantalised as we sample an array of mouthwatering dishes and delectable desserts, each bursting with authentic flavours and aromas. The evening tour price includes all food and  2 x alcoholic cocktails and soft drinks. *Tour is suitable for vegetarians, gluten and dairy free.* Skip breakfast/ lunch - you'll be full after this tour :o)
Title: OBI'S AFRICAN & CARIBBEAN FOOD TOUR - BRIXTON
Subtitle: Join me as we enjoy the wonderful culinary delights and learn about the African & Caribbean history of my hometown Brixton.

Description: Play a city game and go on a surreal walking tour in London where you will follow clues to discover amazing places and local stories. On this London tour, you will uncover facts about computer scientist Alan Turing and many other people, but also about the city‚Äôs oldest garden center and other hidden spots. Are you ready to explore Little Venice, London? The route you‚Äôre going to follow in the city is sprinkled with unique places, fun clues and challenges, and incredible stories. The experience will play out like you‚Äôre the main characters of a movie, only that you‚Äôre experiencing everything in first person! Fun dialogue, intrigue, and unexpected interactions are guaranteed. HOW IT WORKS‚ùì 1. Book your tickets üé´ 2. Download the Questo app - it's free üì≤ 3. Head to the starting pointüìç WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO The game is an interactive activity where you are guided by a mobile app through the city. With it, you follow directions and solve very fun puzzles, riddles, and cryptic codes. During the game, you will also visit popular and hidden places in the city while learning fun (and we mean it) stories about them. This is a storytelling experience just as much. The people doing these city exploration games gave them an average rating of 4.7/5 around the world. Join the playground too! ------------------ More about Questo üö∂‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Questo is an urban entertainment platform offering thematic real-world exploration games. It is currently available in over 150 cities üåé and has entertained hundreds of thousands of players already. As of today, the app offers more than 400 different experiences created by a growing network of local content creators and event organizers.
Title: Magical London Outdoor Escape Game: Highlights of Little Venice
Subtitle: Follow clues, solve puzzles, discover new places and learn incredible stories during this city adventure.

Description: Dinner and a movie are soooo last decade. Instead, you can go on a quest to explore the most romantic place in London, made famous by the film starring Julia Roberts and Hugh Grant.  Notting Hill is a vibrant, iconic neighbourhood known for antique markets, colourful architecture and one of the most important street festivals in the world!  Discover the origins of the Notting Hill Carnival, stroll along Portobello Rd, and take a peek at some "musical temples" to learn why this charming neighbourhood has become a long-term destination for celebrities. AÔªøre you ready to find Notting but Love? We are inviting you two (or you three - hey, we don‚Äôt judge!) to a romantic couples activity that‚Äôs part outdoor escape room, part scavenger hunt and part walking tour.  We promise this experience will make you want to kiss and tell <3. We‚Äôve hosted more than 20.000 dates this year. So, we‚Äôre pretty sure you will absolutely love it too!  If you don‚Äôt, let us know and we‚Äôll live the rest of our lives in shame. So, we‚Äôre pretty sure you will absolutely love it too!  But if you don‚Äôt, let us know and we‚Äôll live the rest of our lives in shame. WHAT WILL YOU DO‚ùì - Prepare your camera to photograph the most colourful and Instagrammable streets. - Stroll through blockbuster film locations like Notting Hill, Love Actually, Paddington, and more. - Be amazed by one of the most ridiculous taxes ever. - Visit the places where great music stars have drunk, played, and died. - Learn how Caribbean immigrants changed the course of British history. HOW DOES IT WORK‚ùì The entire experience is delivered through a mobile app. 1. Book your tickets üé´. 2. Get the instructions via email. 3. Download the Questo mobile app (as instructed via email) and head to the starting point on any day that you chooseüìç. 4Ôªø. Invite your significant one. FEATURES ‚úîÔ∏è - Available 24/7. - Pause and resume anytime. - Private. -Ôªø A bunch of cute & instagrammable places. WHEN CAN YOU TRY THIS EXPERIENCE‚ùì - date night - anniversary - birthday celebration - holiday date - Valentine‚Äôs Day - as a gift for any occasion AÔªøGE RECOMMENDATION If you have little ones and want to bring them along with you, feel free to do so, this experience is kid friendly.
Title: Romantic Notting Hill: Cute Scavenger Hunt for Couples
Subtitle: Surprise your lover with a cute date idea where you will explore the most romantic, vibrant  and iconic neighbourhood - Notting Hill.

Description: The Great Game Treasure GPS Mobile Phone Treasure Hunt around The City of London We are rated 5/5 on Google and 4.5/5 on TripAdvisor! This game is perfect for families and friends wanting to explore the city and do something quirky as well as team building. Get ready for an exhilarating treasure hunt experience! Can you complete the hunt and find the treasure? The treasure is a great pub with discount. Here are the key details you need to know: You can start anywhere you like in The City of London. From Liverpool Street and Brick Lane to the Tower of London, Bank Station and St Pauls Cathedral. All the questions are scattered around this area and the game isn't linear. GAMEPLAY ‚Ä¢ Load the app on your phone one phone per team. ‚Ä¢ Explore your surroundings to find 30 thrilling questions/challenges. ‚Ä¢ Prepare for a mix of environment-related questions, brain teasers, puzzles, and trivia. ‚Ä¢ Each challenge is worth 50 points, but you only have 5 minutes to conquer it. ‚Ä¢ There are some bonus questions each worth double points. ‚Ä¢ Some challenges are tougher than others, so be ready for a real test of your skills. ‚Ä¢ With a time limit of 2 hours, you‚Äôll need to be quick and plan an efficient route to tackle as many questions as possible. ‚Ä¢ At the end you will reveal your treasure - a great local pub at which you can receive discount! ‚Ä¢ If you are playing in teams see your scores on a live leader board and purchase weapons to slow other teams down! HOW TO PLAY ‚Ä¢ Mobile Phones: Make sure each team has a fully charged mobile phone (up to 50% battery usage during the game) and some data. You‚Äôll need an internet connection or data to initially download the game, but subsequent connections will be required only for occasional photo downloads and uploads. ‚Ä¢ Starting: To begin, access the game using the provided link or QR code. Before diving in, carefully read the instructions on how to play. ‚Ä¢ Time: The game is set for 2 hours which starts as soon as you have read the instructions and are prompted to ‚ÄòStart game‚Äô (there is a warning written above this button). ‚Ä¢ Finishing: The game ends if a team either: ‚Ä¢ Completes all the questions. ‚Ä¢ The time runs out. ‚Ä¢ After finishing, you‚Äôll receive directions to the end pub for a well-deserved celebration. Prepare yourselves for an unforgettable adventure filled with challenges, competition, and the thrill of the hunt. Good luck! HOW TO BOOK: Please note your tickets are flexible and can be chosen on any day that suits you. Pub opening times and kitchen times can be found on our website. U18's are allowed in the pubs during the day but in the evenings some venues might not, please check on our website for these times also. Good luck!
Title: Fun Mobile Phone GPS treasure hunt of City of London and Tower of London!
Subtitle: Our brand new GPS mobile phone treasure hunt tech has just launched and there's no better family game or team-building experience out there.

Description: Learn to create a magical miniature garden at this fun, hands-on terrarium class from Art Play London! If you're looking for eco-friendly London attractions to try or need therapeutic team building activities, you can't go wrong with this relaxing workshop. Led by an expert teacher, you'll learn all about making a terrarium in a warm, welcoming environment. Starting with a glass vessel, you'll combine live plants with various natural elements such as soil, stones, sand and moss to create your beautiful biome. As you create your piece, your guide will explore the history of terrariums, dispense plenty of handy hints about finding the best terrarium plants and teach you how to care for your mini garden. You'll finish your chilled-out terrarium class with impressive new skills and a gorgeous glass terrarium to take home!
Title: Adult's Workshop: Make a Terrarium
Subtitle: Learn to make a gorgeous glass terrarium with the help of a local expert.

Description:
We make no charge for admission to this event.  Instead, we invite participants to make a donation to  MDA - the Israeli Red Cross organisation which provides emergency medical services to victims of the current war regardless of race, religion or ethnicity. 
 
 We will take a journey through the streets and alleys of London to discover the thousand-year history of the Jews in England. From the arrival of a Jewish community from Normandy in 1066/67 to the Kindertransport children of 1938/39, Jews have played important roles in the unfolding drama of British history. On our journey we will encounter the Jews of medieval London, the unfortunate Jewish doctor who inspired the creation of Shylock, Queen Victoria‚Äôs favourite Prime Minister, the Jewish stockbroker who saved the British government during the 1745 Jacobite rebellion, the Protestant rabble-rouser who became an Orthodox Jew and other colourful characters. We will visit some of the most spectacular sites in the City. We will also reveal the little-known Jewish associations of some of London‚Äôs most famous landmarks. Ian & David
Title: Jewish London ‚Äì 1,000 Years of History
Subtitle: A walking tour in aid of World Jewish Relief's Ukraine Crisis appeal, offered in association with London Walks

Description: Descubre todos los secretos del Londres m√°s antiguo con nuestro Free Tour Londres a orillas del T√°mesis, un paseo desde la Catedral de St Paul hasta Tower Bridge, donde te contaremos su origen, su historia y sus principales monumentos y calles. El tour comienza en la Catedral de San Pablo, la catedral anglicana de Londres y la m√°s grande de la capital. Mientras descubrimos c√≥mo se organiza la City de Londres, cruzaremos el Millenium Bridge hasta llegar a la zona de Bankside. All√≠ recorreremos una de las zonas mas populares y tur√≠sticas actuales de la ciudad, donde los antiguos londinenses ven√≠an a divertirse al teatro y al circo. A d√≠a de hoy encontraremos la galer√≠a de arte moderno Tate Modern, el Globe Theatre, una reproducci√≥n del teatro original en el que William Shakespeare interpret√≥ sus obras m√°s conocidas; y la prisi√≥n Clink, una de las c√°rceles m√°s antiguas de la ciudad. Desde el mirador tendremos unas vistas impresionantes de los rascacielos de la City y otros monumentos, como el London Bridge. Tambi√©n conoceremos la Catedral de Southwark, el Borough Market, el mercado m√°s antiguo de Londres al que ven√≠an los londinenses a hacer sus compras, y The Shard, el rascacielos m√°s alto de la Uni√≥n Europea. El tour finaliza en City Hall, el Ayuntamiento de Londres cuyo edificio fue dise√±ado por Norman Foster. Desde aqu√≠ veremos dos de los monumentos m√°s emblem√°ticos de Londres: el Tower Bridge, el puente m√°s famoso de la ciudad, y la Torre de Londres, donde se guardan las Joyas de la Corona, pero que realmente es famosa por haber sido una de las prisiones m√°s temibles de Londres. ¬øC√≥mo encontrar al gu√≠a?
Title: Free Tour Londres a Orillas del T√°mesis

Description:
THE CITY IN SPIRES - A TOUR OF WREN‚ÄôS CHURCHES After the Great Fire of London, Christopher Wren (1632-1723) rebuilt 51 churches. On this guided tour, you‚Äôll see several of his spectacular places of worship including St Paul‚Äôs Cathedral, St Stephen Walbrook and St Mary-le-Bow.  Judge for yourself which is the finest! The tour takes around 90 minutes including stopping to look at things along the way.Limited spaces which MUST be booked in advance. Reserve your place now.We try to make our tours as inclusive and accessible as possible Safety: 
 The safety of our guests and Guides is paramount and we have limited group numbers to help manage this. 
 All Guides follow the Institute of Tourist Guiding (ITG) Covid-19 Guidance for Tour Guiding. 
 Our walks are outside but you  will in a group with people you don't know and  you are very welcome to wear a face covering
 Please bring your own hand sanitiser. 
 If, on the day, you  have a positive lateral flow test result or feel at all unwell please cancel your place.
Organizer: City of London Guide Lecturers Association
Title: Guided Walk: The City in Spires

Description: We make no charge for this tour and invite you instead to donate to MDA, the Israeli Red Cross organisation which is providing emergency medical services to victims of the current war regardless of race, religion or ethnicity. With a history stretching back two millennia, London has seen more than its fair share of rebellion and righteous (or not so righteous) retribution. We will guide you from the Roman Wall marking the City‚Äôs Eastern boundary to the Bank of England. Along the way, we will explore narrow alleys, view spectacular ancient and modern architecture and encounter some of the larger than life characters and momentous events that have left their marks on London over its two thousand years of history - including Queen Boudicca who destroyed Roman London in the year 61, the rebel "Emperor" Carausius whose revolt against Rome led to the destruction of the London Forum in the year 300, the 1381 Peasant's Revolt, Samuel Pepys who chronicled the destruction of London in 1666, Bonnie Prince Charlie's Jacobite rebels of 1745, the notorious 18th Century Hellfire Club, the Gordon rioters who attacked the Bank of England in 1780 and the climate change protesters who invaded the Mansion House in 2019. Ian and David
Title: Revolting London: 2000 years of rebellion and retribution
Subtitle: A  walking tour of London uncovering two thousand years of rebellion and retribution in aid of World Jewish Relief's Ukraine Crisis appeal

Description: Welcome to the district of Mayfair ‚Äì the champagne and caviar of London. Embark on a glamorous adventure in the home of British aristocracy, solve clues and hang out with the cr√®me de la cr√®me of the upper-class. But don‚Äôt let yourself be fooled! Behind the closed doors of the opulent mansions, equally extravagant secrets are waiting to be discovered. Ready? The route you‚Äôre going to follow in the city is sprinkled with unique places, fun clues and challenges, and incredible stories. The experience will play out like you‚Äôre the main characters of a movie, only that you‚Äôre experiencing everything in first person! Fun dialogue, intrigue, and unexpected interactions are guaranteed. HOW IT WORKS‚ùì 1. Book your tickets üé´ 2. Download the Questo app - it's free üì≤ 3. With it, you follow directions and solve very fun puzzles, riddles, and cryptic codes. During the game, you will also visit popular and hidden places in the city while learning fun (and we mean it) stories about them. This is a storytelling experience just as much. Description: üèõÔ∏è  Discover historical landmarks & hidden gems üïµ‚Äç‚ôÄ  Find clues & solve cryptic puzzles üß≠  Self-guided tour ‚Äì do whenever you like & at your own pace üç∫  Plenty of historical pubs along the route ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Average Tripadvisor rating (across all trails) is 4.9/5! Well, you‚Äôve come to the right place, detective! The Monopoly Murders is an immersive treasure hunt with a whodunit twist. This imaginative self-guided city tour experience leads you on a thrilling journey past some of Europe‚Äôs most visited attractions. Along the way, you‚Äôll discover historical landmarks and hidden gems, solve cryptic puzzles and find hidden clues to ultimately deduce whodunit. The game is afoot! The Monopoly Murders ‚Äì West End Murder Mystery Trail is a self-guided walking tour that navigates you past some of the best historical landmarks the UK has to offer, including: üìç Trafalgar Square üìç The National Gallery üìç Somerset House üìç Covent Garden üìç Leicester Square üìç China Town üìç Piccadilly Circus üìç Buckingham Palace üìç and many hidden gems The route of this London treasure hunt is relatively flat and approximately 4km long. Allow 3 hours to appreciate your surroundings and complete the trail at a leisurely pace. There are plenty of refreshment stops and photo opportunities along the way. This trail focuses on London‚Äôs West End area. We also have another trail which explores the City of London. Both trails make such a great way to discover London‚Äôs must-see landmarks! Ideal for tourists and locals alike. So, what are you waiting for?! ‚Ä¢ Start and end location: Trafalgar Square, WC2N 5DN (the trail is a loop). View on Google Maps ‚Ä¢ Clue difficulty: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê ‚Ä¢ Duration: ~3 hours ‚Ä¢ Distance: 4km ‚Ä¢ Terrain: Easy ‚Ä¢ Wheelchair/buggy accessible: No* Christian in room #004‚Ä¶ Trinity Harlot in a sleazy bar‚Ä¶ And now Lucy ‚ÄúDeucey‚Äù Jellicoe in Convent Garden. Three murders with a deliberate trail of taunting calling cards left by the cunning culprit. You face your most formidable challenge yet, with wits matched against an egotistical maniac. Can you deduce who the serial killer is and end this sequence of catastrophes before they strike again? ‚Ä¢ Receive two high-quality printed copies of the trail through your letter box! ‚Ä¢ Printed on 120gsm white uncoated A4 paper with a single-sided print. ‚Ä¢ One staple in the top left corner of each copy. ‚Ä¢ FREE delivery! ‚Ä¢ We ship to the UK only. Unfortunately, we don‚Äôt deliver to Jersey, Guernsey or the Republic of Ireland. If you order from another country you will be refunded. International customers, please visit our Killer Trail Etsy store! ‚Ä¢ 2-3 working days for delivery. We deliver using Royal Mail tracked; delivery times are estimates.  ‚Ä¢ Book your trail here or via killertrails.co.uk. Only one purchase required for a group of up to 6 people. ‚Ä¢ Our trails are self-guided. This means you can do the trail whenever you like. You don't have to do it on the specific day you've booked.  ‚Ä¢ If you need the trail urgently and/or you'd rather print it off yourself, please let us know in the email and we will send you a digital PDF instead. Or alternatively, you can order a digital PDF of this trail here. *The route is all paved or solid. Some road crossing points may not have dropped kerbs. Some of the route has cobbled streets.
Title: London West End Murder Mystery Trail (Whodunit Treasure Hunt) Killer Trails
Subtitle: Explore the eerie streets of London with a murder mystery treasure hunt. Discover landmarks, find clues & solve puzzles to deduce whodunit!

Description: MySQL Intermediate Course, 3-day Excellent course to get valuable information, trends, summaries, statistics and insights from your company data. This MySQL Intermediate course is ideal for managers who need to get business intelligence from their data, or data analysts who should provide such information. Create your own queries with ease. This course uses MySQL Workbench. MySQL Workbench is a unified visual tool for database architects, developers, and DBAs. MySQL Workbench provides data modeling, SQL development, and comprehensive administration tools for server configuration, user administration, backup and much more. MySQL Workbench is available on Windows, Linux and Mac OS X. Course Duration: 3 consecutive days, the first of which displays as the booking date. Beginners: Attend all 3 days: day 1,2,3 Intermediate: If you know all about where clauses, joins and aggregate, then day 2 and 3 are for you. Select the ticket at checkout. MySQL Intermediate Course Contents: Session 1,2 and 3: Brief revision of Basics Session 4: LIMIT, UNION and AGGREGATE Functions The LIMIT clause, Union, Union all, Aggregate, Group By , Roll-up with group by, Having. Session 5 : Joins and Sub-queries. Joins with original syntax, Table aliases, Natural joins, Join using, Join on, Multi-table joins. Cartesian products. Correlated and uncorrelated Sub-queries. Session 6: Numeric and Character Functions. DATE, TIME and Other functions. Session 7: Create, alter and drop Views. Stored procedures, without and with parameters. Custom Functions. Session 8: Create and drop Databases. Create, alter and drop Tables. Datatypes. Constraints. Session 9: Create, alter and drop Indexes. Session 10: Managing Data Inserting rows, Replacing rows, Updating rows, Deleting rows, The truncate statement, The COMMIT and ROLLBACK commands, Savepoints, Implicit commits Session 11: Access Control Creating users, Renaming users, Dropping users, Granting privileges, Revoking privileges Session 12: Import and Export INCLUDED: System requirements: Your MYSQL Database, Workbench query interface and sample data must be ready before the course starts. Read more: https://pcworkshopslondon.co.uk/mysql-intermediate-course.html
Title: MYSQL Intermediate Course, 3-Days, London Classroom OR Online
Subtitle: Data analytics with queries using Oracle MySQL. From basics to intermediate MySQL course. Hands-on. Practical. Online. Instructor-led.

A very unique, next level sound journey experience! AVAILABILIY & MEDITATION THEMES FOR UPCOMING SESSIONS - PLEASE SEE BELOW OR IN THE PHOTO GALLERY AT THE TOP. "An oasis of calm in our busy lives." Londoners stressed out by their busy lives can now turn to Aerial Relaxation Pods‚Ñ¢ to transform their tension to calm, and restore the body‚Äôs natural healing wisdom. ‚ÄúOur pods are here to help Londoners relax. As a former teacher myself, I am fully aware just how busy and stressed a lot of people are. And most of us just don't find the time to unwind. Our Aerial Relaxation Pods are going to help you alleviate stress, providing time & space to allow your body to deeply rest, harmonising your nervous system. You‚Äôll feel rejuvenated and refreshed after one session.‚Äù Seth Newman, co-founder of Aerial Relaxation Pods‚Ñ¢. Please arrive only 5 min before session start time as there is no waiting room at the venue. If the session is sold out, you can join the waitlist as sometimes we receive cancellations and will contact you at least 72h prior to the event and offer to book a space. ***MARCH*** -Tue, 5 March 7:15pm-8:30pm Body Sensing & Mixed Sound Journey (SOLD OUT) 8:45pm-10:00pm Breath Sensing & Mixed Sound Journey (available) -Thu, 7 March 7:15pm-8:30pm Laughter Pods & Mixed Sound Journey (SOLD OUT) 8:45pm-10:00pm Inner Resource & Mixed Sound Journey (available) -Tue, 12 March 7:15pm-8:30pm Gong bath (SOLD OUT) 8:45pm-10:00pm Gong bath (available) -Thu, 14 March 7:15pm-8:30pm Gong bath (SOLD OUT) 8:45pm-10:00pm Gong bath (available) -Tue, 19 March 7:15pm-8:30pm Body Sensing & Mixed Sound Journey (SOLD OUT) 8:45pm-10:00pm Breath Sensing & Mixed Sound Journey (available) -Thu, 21 March 7:15pm-8:30pm Laughter Pods & Mixed Sound Journey (available) 8:45pm-10:00pm Inner Resource & Mixed Sound Journey (available) -Tue, 26 March no sessions -Thu, 28 March System Reset workshop 7:15pm-10pm, info & bookings here ***APRIL*** -Tue, 2 April 7:15pm-8:30pm Gong bath (available) 8:45pm-10:00pm Gong bath (available) -Thu, 4 April 7:15pm-8:30pm Gong bath (available) 8:45pm-10:00pm Gong bath (available) -9, 11, 16, 18 April no sessions -Tue, 23 April 7:15pm-8:30pm Body Sensing & Mixed Sound Journey (available) 8:45pm-10:00pm Breath Sensing & Mixed Sound Journey (available) -Thu, 25 April no sessions -Tue, 30 April 7:15pm-8:30pm Laughter Pods & Mixed Sound Journey (available) 8:45pm-10:00pm Inner Resource & Mixed Sound Journey (available) MORE DATES TO BE ADDED SOON üíô Monthly 'System Reset' workshop featuring Bioenergetic, Creative Flow & Aerial Relaxation Pods, details and bookings here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/123649855045 -Thu 28 March 7:15pm-10pm System Reset: Bioenergetics, Creative Flow & Pods üíúSEE ALL OUR UPCOMING WELLBEING EVENTS, RETREATS, FESTIVALS: ecstaticdancelondon.com/events 1) Strictly no latecomers! - Sorry, please arrive on time! Unfortunately, if you are more than 10 minutes late, you will not be allowed entry (and there can be no refunds if you are more than 10 minutes late, very sorry!) as we need to make it a calm & peaceful space for people who are already here. 2) If you have a persistent cough or you're showing any Covid -19 symptoms, please DO NOT attend the session. We reserve the right to refuse entry as we need to make it a calm & peaceful space for people during the session. Please pass on your ticket to family or friends as we can't offer last minute refunds. See our cancellation policy below. 3) Please only arrive 5 minutes before the start of the session, as there is no waiting room. 4) Clothing: Please wear a sleeved shirt that covers the armpits and leggings or yoga trousers that cover your knees. Wear form-fitting clothing. Please do not wear baggy clothing as they can snag and catch on the sling‚Äôs fabric causing accidents. Ensure that your clothing is "zipper free" and remove all jewellery (body piercings, watches and hair clips etc). These items can snag and damage the silk hammocks. 5) Weight limit is up 300 pounds (140kg). 6) This session is not suitable for people with pacemakers and other therapeutic electronic devices or persons suffering from severe mental health issues due to the vibratory nature of the session. Please seek advice from your GP if you have any concerns prior to attending our session. 7) Our sound journeys are very gentle and not loud/intense therefore suitable for pregnant women. It is believed that there are many positive and beneficial effects to be gained from relaxation and healing sounds to the growing foetus. The advised healing practice is gentle flowing sounds around the pregnant mother for the beneficial and positive effect of both mother and baby. Please seek advice from your GP if you have any concerns prior to attending our session. Two new studies published in Current Biology suggest our brains are evolutionarily programmed to respond to rocking. Research also provides insight into why rocking is calming to babies. The brain wave synchronization occurs much easier through a rocking motion and allows the baby to feel more at home (i.e. it feels closer to being in the womb). And let‚Äôs not forget that we spend the first nine months of our lives being gently rocked in an amniotic sea. ‚ÄúSince immemorial times we‚Äôve rocked our babies, and often ourselves, to sleep,‚Äù says lead author on the new paper, Konstantinos Kompotis, at the University of Lausanne, also in Switzerland. ‚ÄúOur study provides new insights into the neurophysiological mechanisms underlying this phenomenon.‚Äù Dr Michael J Breus, a Certified Sleep Specialist, states that it‚Äôs the simplest of soothing, sleep-inducing remedies, something we all naturally do: rocking a baby gently to sleep. But why does it work? How exactly does a gentle rhythmic motion change the sleep architecture of the brain? Repetitive motions, like those experienced in the gentle rocking of a hammock, can soothe anxiety. Dr. Herbert Benson, founder of Harvard‚Äôs Mind/Body Medical Institute, recommends repetitive movement to elicit your body‚Äôs relaxation response. This reaction allows a lower heart rate, blood pressure, and muscle tension. The gentle rocking of a hammock will boost brain wave oscillations associated with better sleep and has been shown to provide a fertile ground for deep relaxation. More specifically, the rocking fortifies the brain waves that are naturally present during sleep which help maintain deep relaxation. Neuroscientist Laurence Bayer of the University of Geneva in Switzerland, likens the findings to our intuitive appreciation that a slowly rocking hammock can relax us and do wonders for our mood. ‚ÄúThis is potentially a very promising avenue for future clinical research,‚Äù he notes. Rocking to sleep may have significant health benefits such as better quality of sleep and even improved long-term memory formation. We all instinctively know about the power of a soothing, repetitive rocking motion and this in combination with live ambient soundscapes and aromatherapy is a potent synthesis for deep relaxation. "Words are inadequate to express the uniquely nurturing experience I had during your class... and the music was amazing! The feeling of being securely wrapped in a silk hammock from head to toe, suspended in the air, slowly rocking, with the gentle breath meditation, the crystal bowls and the ambient music created a sublime and profound atmosphere. It was as if I was in a cocoon of total support, allowing peace to flow into my entire being." - Alison "Being someone who is always on the move and finds it very difficult to relax, I found this session to be really valuable ‚Äòme time!‚Äô Initially, I found it difficult to let go and unwind where the muscles in my arms and legs were contracting. After a few minutes, I started to drift away into a soft slumber which was deeply relaxing. Despite this my senses were heightened and I became very conscious of the sounds that seemed to travel through my ears, vibrating all the way into my body. The gentle movements of the hammock with the music in the background made me feel like a young infant being rocked to sleep. A wonderfully calming and soothing experience, with the added bonus of not having to put in any physical effort. Great! I look forward to more of this." - Navpreet Seth Newman: As a coach, Seth is dedicated to helping people calm, empower and rejuvenate their busy minds and bodies to achieve the best versions of themselves. Seth brings a wealth of experience holding heart-centered spaces. In addition to guiding people on their life journeys, he enjoys helping clients design lifestyles of optimal health and balance with creative living practices. Seth has been running various body-mind integration classes and workshops for many years. His inspiration comes from many sources including Humanistic & Body Psychotherapy, the Human Potential Movement, 5 Rhythms, Tantra and Active meditations. Diana River: Trained in classical music from a young age, and later in contemporary music, Diana carries a life-long passion for singing, improvising and re-imagining traditional Celtic and folk songs with her own melodic vision. A singer at heart, she connects deeply with the melodies and harmonies of ancient Europe and beyond. Diana is passionate about bringing practices of rest and embodiment to others and her intention is to guide you on a journey of reconnection and self-discovery, reuniting you with the source of who you are. She is a co-founder of London Aerial Relaxation Pods and co-creator of many Ecstatic Dance London & URUBU wellbeing classes, workshops, retreats & festivals. URUBU has since evolved into a School of Transformational Arts - offering a variety of powerful holistic body-mind tools and practices. Description: Conocer la¬†Historia de la Humanidad¬†desde sus or√≠genes hace millones de a√±os es posible sin moverse de¬†Londres. Con nuestro¬†Tour Museo Brit√°nico¬†podr√°s descubrir, junto a un¬†gu√≠a oficial en espa√±ol¬†y experto en la materia, las principales piezas de las culturas m√°s destacadas que han poblado nuestro planeta. Parte del legado de los¬†egipcios, los¬†griegos¬†o los¬†aztecas¬†te est√°n esperando en¬†uno de los museos m√°s visitados del mundo. Comenzaremos nuestra visita en el exterior, en la¬†entrada del museo, donde comprobaremos su parecido con algunas construcciones de la Grecia Cl√°sica, como el¬†Parten√≥n de Atenas. Su gran tama√±o nos dar√° una pista de las incontables obras que podemos encontrar en su interior. Tras conocer la historia del edificio, continuaremos por el¬†Hall Central, el patio cubierto m√°s grande de Europa. Nos trasladaremos hasta la¬†Sala de la Ilustraci√≥n, la m√°s antigua del museo, que alberga una colecci√≥n de m√°s de¬†60.000 libros del Rey Jorge III, as√≠ como otras colecciones de origen privado.¬†¬†Seguiremos avanzando para sumergirnos en la cultura del¬†Antiguo Egipto, donde conoceremos todos los detalles de los¬†ritos funerarios¬†egipcios en diferentes √©pocas, adem√°s de imponentes¬†esculturas¬†con las que representaban a sus dioses, faraones o personajes destacados. Nuestro viaje al pasado continua hacia oriente, concretamente hacia la¬†civilizaci√≥n Asiria, que ocupaba el norte de la antigua¬†Mesopotamia¬†y de la que actualmente podemos encontrar numerosas piezas en el Museo Brit√°nico, como los¬†Lamassus¬†que proteg√≠an las puertas de las ciudades o palacios de este imperio. La¬†griega¬†ha sido otra de las culturas que han dejado un gran legado hist√≥rico. Continuando nuestra visita, podremos encontrar una parte importante de la estructura del¬†Parten√≥n de Atenas. En esta sala profundizaremos en la mitolog√≠a griega, mientras exploramos las representaciones escult√≥ricas que se dise√±aron para cada una de las partes de las que estaba compuesto este templo de m√°rmol dedicado a la diosa¬†Atenea. Finalizaremos nuestra visita descubriendo diversas piezas¬†aztecas¬†y de otras¬†culturas mesoamericanas¬†despu√©s de haber conocido a¬†Hoa Hakananai'a, un moai de la¬†Isla de Pascua¬†de m√°s de dos metros de altura. Si quieres recorrer el mundo en apenas unas horas y profundizar en toda su historia, ¬°reserva ya nuestro¬†Tour Museo Brit√°nico! ¬øC√≥mo encontrar al gu√≠a?

Description: This game is perfect for exciting unique team building days out for team bonding & to discover the city! We are rated 5/5 on Google and 4.5/5 on TripAdvisor! Get ready for an exhilarating treasure hunt experience! Can you complete the hunt and find the treasure? The treasure is a great venue at which we will organise food & drink for your party. You can start anywhere you like in or on the outskirts of St James or Green Park. All the questions are scattered around this area and the game isn't linear. GAMEPLAY ‚Ä¢ Load the app on your phone one phone per team. ‚Ä¢ Explore your surroundings to find 30 thrilling questions/challenges. ‚Ä¢ Prepare for a mix of environment-related questions, brain teasers, puzzles, and trivia. ‚Ä¢ Each challenge is worth 50 points, but you only have 5 minutes to conquer it. ‚Ä¢ There are some bonus questions each worth double points. ‚Ä¢ Some challenges are tougher than others, so be ready for a real test of your skills. ‚Ä¢ With a time limit of 2 hours, you‚Äôll need to be quick and plan an efficient route to tackle as many questions as possible. ‚Ä¢ At the end you will reveal your treasure - a great venue for your party! ‚Ä¢ If you are playing in teams see your scores on a live leader board and purchase weapons to slow other teams down! HOW TO PLAY ‚Ä¢ Mobile Phones: Make sure each team has a fully charged mobile phone (up to 50% battery usage during the game) and some data. You‚Äôll need an internet connection or data to initially download the game, but subsequent connections will be required only for occasional photo downloads and uploads. ‚Ä¢ Starting: To begin, access the game using the provided link or QR code. Before diving in, carefully read the instructions on how to play. ‚Ä¢ Time: The game is set for 2 hours which starts as soon as you have read the instructions and are prompted to ‚ÄòStart game‚Äô (there is a warning written above this button). ‚Ä¢ Finishing: The game ends if a team either: ‚Ä¢ Completes all the questions. ‚Ä¢ The time runs out. ‚Ä¢ After finishing, you‚Äôll receive directions to the end venue for a well-deserved celebration. Prepare yourselves for an unforgettable adventure filled with challenges, competition, and the thrill of the hunt. Good luck! HOW TO BOOK ‚Ä¢ The time runs out. Choose your number of people (every 4 people make a team, played on 1 phone). ‚Ä¢ The time runs out.After purchase email info@ggtreasurehunts.com to finalise the details of your event, this can be played on any day and there are several options for what venue to end at and what food & drink to have. Good luck!
Title: London, Westminster Fun Team Building Interactive Treasure Hunt!
Subtitle: Our brand new GPS mobile phone treasure hunt tech has just launched and there's no better team-building experience out there.

Description: The Great Game Treasure GPS Mobile Phone Treasure Hunt around St James Park London We are rated 5/5 on Google and 4.5/5 on TripAdvisor! T his game is perfect for team building exercises or corporate activities as well as families and friends wanting to explore the city and do something quirky. Get ready for an exhilarating treasure hunt experience! Here are the key details you need to know: Y ou can start anywhere you like in or on the outskirts of St James or Green Park. All the questions are scattered around this area and the game isn't linear. GAMEPLAY ‚Ä¢ Load the app on your phone one phone per team. ‚Ä¢ Explore your surroundings to find 30 thrilling questions/challenges. ‚Ä¢ Prepare for a mix of environment-related questions, brain teasers, puzzles, and trivia. ‚Ä¢ Each challenge is worth 50 points, but you only have 5 minutes to conquer it. ‚Ä¢ There are some bonus questions each worth double points. ‚Ä¢ Some challenges are tougher than others, so be ready for a real test of your skills. ‚Ä¢ With a time limit of 2 hours, you‚Äôll need to be quick and plan an efficient route to tackle as many questions as possible. ‚Ä¢ At the end you will reveal your treasure - a great local pub at which you can receive discount! ‚Ä¢ If you are playing in teams see your scores on a live leader board and purchase weapons to slow other teams down! HOW TO PLAY ‚Ä¢ Mobile Phones: Make sure each team has a fully charged mobile phone (up to 50% battery usage during the game) and some data. You‚Äôll need an internet connection or data to initially download the game, but subsequent connections will be required only for occasional photo downloads and uploads. ‚Ä¢ Starting: To begin, access the game using the provided link or QR code. Before diving in, carefully read the instructions on how to play. You can start anywhere you like in St James Park. ‚Ä¢ Time: The game is set for 2 hours which starts as soon as you have read the instructions and are prompted to ‚ÄòStart game‚Äô (there is a warning written above this button). ‚Ä¢ Finishing: The game ends if a team either: ‚Ä¢ Completes all the questions. ‚Ä¢ The time runs out. ‚Ä¢ After finishing, you‚Äôll receive directions to the end pub for a well-deserved celebration. Prepare yourselves for an unforgettable adventure filled with challenges, competition, and the thrill of the hunt. Good luck, and may the best team prevail! HOW TO BOOK: Please note your tickets are flexible and can be chosen on any day that suits you. Pub opening times and kitchen times can be found on our website. U18's are allowed in the pubs during the day but in the evenings some venues might not, please check on our website for these times also. Good luck!
Title: Fun Mobile Phone GPS treasure hunt of the parks around Buckingham Palace!
Subtitle: Our brand new GPS mobile phone treasure hunt tech has just launched and there's no better family game or team-building experience out there.

Description: Express yourself through your body photoshoot Take the opportunity to spend some time for yourself, in a space where you can feel free to explore and express through your body. Embrace your individuality and your uniqueness while I capture your body's beauty and your inner essence, and together we create art that you can treasure forever. Let your body tell its own story in this experience that promises to be both empowering and fun. You don't need to be able to pose Not only I will guide you during the entire session, but I will also accompany you before the shoot day with ideas and tips to get ready for the experience. This is a 1:1 session, available for solos, or couples (lovers, borthers, mum and daughter, friends, any type of love is welcome). The photoshoot will take place outdoor, but with an extra fee is possible to have the studio/indoor option. Experience lenght: up to 2 hours photoshoot with 3 to 4 outfit change, you will bring home 20 digital high resolution images, with the opportunity to purchase more or get prints in a beautiful wooden box! Feel free to contact me at giorgia.natella@gmail.com fore more info and availability. @lifeinaphotograph_gn	  www.lifeinaphotograph.com About me I believe in photography as a capture of feelings, of something ephemeral that through an image can be treasured and kept safe forever. Time won't change it, whether is an emotion awoken by a place, or a person. I get my inspiration from my travels, the constant learning from a new culture, new energies, new colors, or a new sunset. I am attracted to the uniqueness of human beings, and through my vision I aim to empower them, build a safe environment to feel free to express, and from this create art to make them feel understood and celebrated.
Title: Express yourself through your body photoshoot

Description:
Join us for an exciting evening of speed dating filled with fun, flirtatious conversations for ages 30-50, in the stylish and original venue of One Kew Road, located in the picturesque Richmond Upon Thames, which also happens to be Rob's favourite spot. Expect to meet around 20-25 people at this highly popular speed dating event in South West London, which typically attracts locals from Richmond and nearby areas.
 
 The event starts promptly at 8 pm, so please make sure to arrive 15-30 minutes before the scheduled time to allow for registration. Latecomers may not be able to take part. Once you arrive at the venue, head upstairs to the first floor where one of our friendly hosts will register you. The host will explain how the evening will unfold, provide you with a scorecard and pen.
 
 During the event, women will be seated, and men will rotate between tables every 4-5 minutes. At the end of each date, guests can mark on their scorecard or mobile phone whether they would like to see that person again. There will be a 15-minute break halfway through to allow for refreshments. The event will finish around 9:30 pm, but guests are welcome to stay afterwards.
 
 If you have used your mobile phone to enter your preferences, you will be able to view your matches instantly at the end of the event. Otherwise, please take home your scorecard and upload your matches before 12 pm on the following day.
 
 Please note that tickets for our events are limited and often booked up in advance, so early booking is recommended to avoid disappointment. If you have any questions, please contact us or call our telephone bookings hotline on 0845 862 1448 (9 am-5 pm).
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Regenerate response
Title: Speed Dating Event in Richmond @ One Kew Road (Ages 30-50)
Subtitle: Speed Dating in Richmond for ages 30-50 at One Kew Road. Go on 15-20 dates on Tuesday night at this popular venue in South West London.

Description: CUT // STICK // SHARE with the lazy susans Led by Holly, Kaia and Mala, each session will bring new themes, reimaginings and questions to explore via cutting, ripping and sticking. No prior art experience needed! Using second-hand magazines collected from local charity shops, hairdressers, hotel guests and neighbours, the session breathes new life into those glossy pages - not hiding the snips, transformations and selections from the Collage Cafe before. Collage has a rich history infused with activism, experimentation and art therapy and has been intrinsic to the Lazy Susan's curatorial and artistic practice, so they can provide assistance if you get stuck (pun intended). Holly has also been working on a collage series for the newly opened Ember Locke in Kensington, so make sure to pop in and have a look at the work made specially for their swanky stage area. Each session begins with a collaborative exercise to get those creative hands and minds warmed up, before entering the hour long collaging free flow. Experimentation, playing and sharing is encouraged. Materials, scissors and glue are all provided, but feel free to bring along your own mags if you like! The bar will be open, so why not treat yourself to a KRAFT beer or a Jim & Tonic. ****If you order a ticket but can no longer make it please cancel ahead of time so someone else can join us instead. Likewise, if the event is sold old, please message us and we can try to squeeze you in****
Title: Collage Caf√© with the Lazy Susans
Subtitle: An informal meeting point to collage mindfully with friends and new acquaintances, over a pint, sparkling water or mint tea.

Description: Description Do you know 92% of people trust personal recommendations more than any other form of marketing? Do you understand the potential of referral marketing for your business? Do you want to grow your business? Do you want to be part of London's best performing BNI Chapter? Visit us at our weekly networking event and discover how referral marketing can help grow your business and take it to the next level. Holborn is one of London's leading BNI Chapters with over 30 members meeting each week, promoting our businesses and passing referrals to each other. We're a lively bunch of business professions, business owners and entrepreneurs...all with the aim of getting more business. BNI is the world's largest professional networking organisation with over 200,000 members around the globe. The BNI philosophy is "Givers Gain"...in other words, if I give you business, you'll want to give me business. Members of the Holborn Chapter of BNI learn how to present their businesses to the other members. Members build trust with each other which makes it really easy for members to refer business to each other with confidence. "It's like having a sales team working for you every day" The best way to find out how BNI works and what it has to offer you and your business is to come along as a visitor. Businesses we are looking for: Building Surveyor Business Bank Manager CatererCommercial Cleaner International Removal and Storage Optician Private Dentist Private Doctor Quantity Surveyor Residential Estate Agent Stockbroker Structural Engineer And many, many more... FAQs Do I need to bring anything? Plenty of business cards - Your cards, along with everyone in the rooms cards will be passed around so you want to make sure there are enough for everyone. We normally have 35-40 people attending. Why so early? We understand that business owners and professionals are all busy people, by holding the meeting before the working day begins we don't loose any time normally spent with clients or from the day to day running of our businesses. Who else will be there? Visit our chapter website to see what other kinds of businesses will be attending.

Description: Learn the original solo dance steps of the jazz & swing age - The Charleston, Suzie Q, Shorty George, Apple Jacks and more! These steps are outrageously fun and expressive, with a soundtrack of hot & swinging jazz that will inspire you to move your body. Your teacher is world famous flapper & dance historian Sharon Davis. This is a solo dance class, no partner needed. Booking is not essential, walk-ins are very welcome. Level: This class is for beginners, zero experience needed. Teacher: this class is taught by Sharon Davis ‚Äì an award-winning swing & jazz dancer with over 20 years experience. When? 7.00pm-8.00pm Tuesdays.  Doors open 6.30pm, so come early to have a drink or warm up before class. Where? Jazzbourne, 443 New Cross Road, London SE14 6TA How much? Is this a walk-in class or a course? This is a walk-in class, so start any time and drop in whenever you like. You don‚Äôt need to take these classes in any particular order and it‚Äôs no problem if you miss a week or attend irregularly. You can pre-book the class online or pay at the door (card/contactless only, no cash accepted). How many classes should I take? Most beginners take this level class for 2-3 months before moving on to the higher level classes. After around 12 classes you will have a comprehensive education in the vintage jazz dance vocabulary. Venue info: Cancellation Policy: Due to administrative costs and the small capacity of our events, all bookings are non-refundable.¬†If you cancel your booking more than 48 hours before the event, we can give you the balance as a credit to your account or in your name to use for a future event. Alternatively, if you contact us more than 48 hours before the event, we can transfer your booking to another person you name. No-shows and cancellations with less than 48 hours notice will not be refunded and no credit given. If you book through EventBrite, the EventBrite booking fee is non-refundable in all cases.¬† Questions? Check out our Frequently Asked Questions page. Or email info@jazzbourne.com

Description: La historia de los asesinatos de Whitechapel es uno de los grandes misterios sin resolver. ¬øQui√©n se esconde tras esos terribles y violentos actos acontecidos durante el oto√±o de 1888? Acomp√°√±anos para descubrir la historia del asesino en serie m√°s famoso de la historia y recorrer las calles de Londres donde actu√≥ con nuestro Free Tour Jack el Destripador. Imag√≠nate la siguiente escena sacada del Londres de 1888. Una joven hermosa camina por una animada avenida, llena de gente, carruajes y farolas de gas. La niebla le perturba la visi√≥n y acaba entrando a un callej√≥n oscuro, aparentemente abandonado. All√≠ ve a un hombre con sombrero de copa alta y capa que se acerca a ella. De repente y sin mediar palabra, √©l la apu√±ala de manera brutal e inexplicable. Mientras ella cae al suelo mortalmente herida, el asesino desaparece entre la oscura y espesa niebla de Londres. ¬øEs esta la imagen que tienes tiene sobre el sanguinario asesino Jack el Destripador? En nuestra visita guiada en espa√±ol separaremos el mito de la realidad y de la ficci√≥n. Conoceremos la vida y muerte de las v√≠ctimas del asesino de Whitechapel mientras recorremos los callejones donde tuvieron lugar estos terribles cr√≠menes. Tambi√©n nos sumergiremos en la atm√≥sfera de la √©poca victoriana y sentiremos la sensaci√≥n de estar en pleno 1888 recorriendo el barrio m√°s pobre de la ciudad. Adem√°s, reuniremos pistas para tratar de averiguar qui√©n se esconde tras la figura de Jack The Ripper, conoceremos qui√©nes fueron los principales sospechosos (algunos escandalosamente sorprendentes) y entenderemos por qu√© nunca le atraparon. Con el Free Tour Jack el Destripador daremos un paseo por el Londres m√°s desconocido para todos los turistas. Completaremos la experiencia con im√°genes reales de los casos. ¬øC√≥mo encontrar al gu√≠a?
Title: Free Tour Jack el Destripador en espa√±ol
Subtitle: ¬øQui√©n era Jack el Destripador? Vamos tras las huellas del asesino en serie m√°s famoso de todos los tiempos.

Description: The Great Game Treasure Hunt Bloomsbury is a unique outdoor treasure hunt.  We are rated 5/5 on Google and 4.5/5 on TripAdvisor! The hunt will lead you around the city taking in all its famous landmarks and explaining a little bit of its history along the way. You are given a treasure map, compass and clues to find your way along the route. If you are successful you will reveal where to draw the X on your treasure map to show the location of your treasure - a great pub! At the pub you will receive discount off your bill.¬† It's one of the best activities to do in Bloomsbury or days out in Bloomsbury you can find! :) It can also be done as a Team Building Exercise or Corporate day out! What to expect: An exciting day out. Exploring famous landmarks and secret back streets. Challenge yourself with puzzles, riddles, codes and orienteering work. If you are successful you will reveal where to draw the X on your treasure map to locate the treasure. The treasure is a great pub at which you can receive 20% off your total food and drink bill. We will book a table at the pub so it's ready and waiting when you arrive. What's in the pack: Clues sheet Treasure map Clipboard Compass Prize envelope (contains a history of the pub and an activity pack) Wristbands for receiving the 20% discount at the pub. Please bring your own pen to help us save on plastic and our carbon footprint :) How to book: Choose your ticket for 1-2 people, 2-4 people or 5-8 people. You only need one ticket per group of this size. After purchase email¬†info@ggtreasurehunts.com¬†to redeem your ticket. Please include a¬†posting address¬†in your email! Please tell us¬†what time you are starting¬†in your email! It takes around 2-3 hours to complete and we will book a table under your name at the treasure pub. Your pack will be posted to you please allow up to 5 working days for it to arrive. Please note your tickets are flexible and can be chosen on any day that suits you. Pub opening times and kitchen times can be found on our website. U18's¬†are allowed in the pubs during the day but in the evenings some venues might not, please check on our website for these times also. Digital packs If you don't have the time to wait for the physical pack to be posted then ask for the digital pack in your email. This is a PDF of the hunt for you to print out or use on a mobile device, provided is a unique code use this to get the discount for your group. If you get a digital pack then we advise you print the hunt out or bring along a notepad to help with the workings out + a compass or compass app.  :) Good luck!
Title: Bloomsbury London Fun Puzzle Treasure Hunt! :)
Subtitle: Go on a super fun puzzle treasure hunt in London's Bloomsbury, where you can crack codes, solve riddles, and discover hidden gems!

If you are unable to make a donation please do still join us. You can just drop in at the centre or register here on Eventbrite. Please note: iÔªøf we ever need to cancel a session you will receive a refund.  If you have any questions about the drop-in meditation sessions, please contact us at  study.practice@rigpa.org.uk.  Health and well-being Please note: meditation is not a substitute for medical treatment. If you are receiving treatment for a mental or physical health condition, please continue your treatment and check with your doctor/care professional if these sessions would be suitable for you.  Note on Covid safety at the London Centre:  We will keep the shrine room well ventilated before, during and after sessions as far as practicably possible. Please wear a mask if you wish to, and continue to observe good hygiene, and use of hand sanitiser provided to minimise risk of transmission. If you have symptoms of a respiratory infection, such as COVID-19, and you have a high temperature or do not feel well enough to go to work or carry out normal activities, you are advised to try to stay at home and avoid contact with other people.

Description: We are really excited to welcome you into CAVE for our weekly life drawing sessions. An enjoyable and energising session with an emphasis on encouraging observational skills. The sessions are untutored, which gives you full freedom to be as bold and creative as you like - go for it! The object is to start, improve and develop your drawings by making them dynamic and spontaneous. We aim to do various short and long poses throughout the two-hour session. Ending in a long sustained pose.  Classes are ticket only ‚Äì tickets can be bought right up until the start of the class as long as there is availability. We encourage you to book ahead avoiding any disappointment. All materials and equipment are provided, but you are also welcome to bring your own. Tea and coffee are available along with some nibbles. Sessions cost ¬£15 and include all materials, nibbles and a drink. We are a small-run business trying to keep the artist community alive in SW London. Non-shows do affect us. Because of that, we split our tickets in two parts ¬£5 (non-refundable) and ¬£10 cash required at the door.

Description: Cycling Timetable: Tuesday   6.15pm Heart Rate Session 7.30pm Power Session Wednesday 6.15pm Heart Rate Session Thursday 6.15pm Heart Rate Session 7.30pm Power Session 	 The Pic and Mix gives you complete flexibilty at a fixed price. Can't make every week? Can't do set days? Dont worry you can pick whatever you wish theough the month to suit your diary. Turbo Beat LIVE streaming gives us the opportunity to run virtual classes globally instead of just at Crystal Palace. This is a fantastic way of you having fully structured sessions administered by Paul Mill of Elitecycling who is one of the most respected coaches in the UK. Sessions are based on working at a percentage of your¬†Maximum Heart Rate¬†and now also FTP (Functional Threshold Power) each session has a different element to help you build an all round fitness level. Of course as well as fitness, another aspect is that you will work alongside others working to their own personal parameters so nobody gets left behind and we want everyone to have fun along the way. The key as opposed to virtual reality platforms and chasing avatars is that we will encourage and motivate you personally to reach your goal. ¬†On enrolling to the monthly pass you will be added to the Turbo Beat WhatsApp group where you will receive further information.To optimise your session and give you the very best user experience you will need the following to start. Absolute essentials: 1) A bike 2) A mobile phone 3) A turbo trainer (any type will do) ¬†4) A Bluetooth heart rate monitor Good to have: 1) Headphones or a speaker to hear the music and instructions 2) Towel, drink, mat How it works The basis of this is that you do a turbo session at home that is almost identical to the Turbo Beat sessions that run at Crystal Palace. The Selfloops system allows you to share your heart rate data and you will need to download the free Selfloops fitness app. Instructions are all on the WhatsApp group that you will be added to when you enrol. Zoom allows you to hear Paul, good music and to see others in the session. The link for the session and password will be sent directly to you via phone or e mail
Title: Turbo Beat Individual Cycling classes  (Heart Rate) 6.30pm
Subtitle: We have now built in complete flexibility with bookings and now you can book any session you like as and when you are available.

Description: If you love nothing more than the relaxing scent of a good candle, why not come and craft your own at this blissful candle making class in London? In this chilled-out workshop, you'll learn how to melt, mix and pour wax to create DIY candles from scratch. Your teacher will guide you step-by-step throughout your journey and provide all the equipment and tools, so don't worry if it's your first attempt at candle making. You'll feel all of your worries melt away as you sit back and focus on getting creative with your group. Description: Join me for one on one Transformational breath session experience.  Come and experience a simple and easy-to-use breath technique that can support you in all areas of your life.  The transformational breath session focuses on three main areas ‚Äì increasing physical wellbeing, improving mental and emotional states, and spiritual expansion. Transformational Breath ¬Æ can help you let go of unhealthy breathing habits, such as shallow breathing, have a deeper understanding of breath patterns and release both physical and emotional tension from the body. Experiencing Transformational breath session can help you: - Feel completely energised - Become aware and let go of emotions that no longer serve you - Reduce stress and anxiety - Increase energy levels-  Experience deeply nourishing relaxation - Gain clarity, inspiration and connection with your intuition - Develop a deeper dimension to your practices/activities such as yoga, meditation, running Breathwork has benefits for everyone. Everyone is welcome and no prior experience is necessary. AWARD WINNING THERAPY The Institute of Complementary and Natural Medicine has announced that Transformational Breath¬Æ UK is the winner of its prestigious 'Best Complementary Medicine Organisation' for 2014. Join a 1-2-1 Breath Session with me to improve your well-being!  If you have any issues finding a suitable time, please contact me on info@mybreathingpath.co.uk If you would like to arrange a session for more than 1 person, please get in touch.
Title: 1:1 In Person Transformational Breath Session in Liverpool Street, London
Subtitle: Experience The Power of Breathwork to deal with life's challenges on a daily basis and to release suppressed emotions to live a joyful life

Description: Painting in your teacher's art studio with a glass of wine at your side, you'll learn to paint as part of a small group, creating your own masterpiece to take home with you. This class is ideal for beginners so if painting is new to you, don't worry, you'll be in good company! This painting workshop is a focused yet exciting arty adventure, giving you the chance to explore oils, charcoals, pastels and watercolours. All the painting materials you'll need to make your own piece of art will be provided and your teacher will give you lots of support to create something you'll be proud of. Soak up the creative environment, sip on a delicious glass of wine and develop your confidence and skill in painting in a supportive and inspiring space. Your experienced teacher, Katerina is a professional artist and will be with you every step of the way as you paint your way through your workshop. You'll receive all the guidance you need and with small class sizes, you'll have plenty of opportunities to seek tips and feedback.  If you're looking for painting classes to let you connect with your artistic side, or if you're just searching for fun things to do in London with your partner, colleagues or friends, this paint and sip workshop in Wimbledon is a fun and inspiring place to begin. As you work through your painting class, you'll explore your personal style at your own pace, making and correcting mistakes as you go. Your teacher's broad experience enables her to adapt her teaching style to suit your needs and painting style. You'll be supported to paint a still life, using images and inspiration from your teacher, or if you prefer you can bring along some ideas of your own. By the end of this wine and paint class in London, you'll have your own painting to take away with you, to work on further or to hang up in your home! You'll also have a range of new painting knowledge to inspire you to explore this hobby further.
Title: Evening Paint and Sip Class
Subtitle: Get in touch with your creative side, meet like-minded people and step into the art community with this fun and relaxing paint and sip class

Description: Men's Yoga Class East London - on a transformative journey towards physical and mental well-being. Come join us at Omega Hub for a rejuvenating yoga experience designed specifically for men. This class is all about helping you achieve balance in both your body and mind. Whether you're a seasoned yogi or a complete beginner, this class welcomes all levels. Expect to stretch, strengthen, and find inner peace in a supportive environment. Don't miss out on this opportunity to prioritize your well-being and connect with like-minded individuals. See you on the mat! Try this class at a 50% off by clicking here. How can Hatha Yoga help you? ‚Äì Improved Flexibility and Mobility: Hatha Yoga, with its emphasis on gentle stretching and deliberate poses, is a powerful tool for enhancing flexibility and mobility. Regular practice helps to release tension in the muscles, promoting increased range of motion and overall suppleness. ‚Äì Stress Reduction and Mental Clarity: Mindful breathing and relaxation techniques incorporated in Hatha Yoga sessions work wonders in reducing stress, promoting mental clarity, and fostering a sense of inner peace. ‚Äì Strength Building and Muscle Tone: Hatha Yoga may appear gentle, but it is a dynamic practice that engages various muscle groups. Through a series of asanas (postures), it aids in building strength and toning muscles, leading to improved overall physical fitness. ‚Äì Balanced Energy Flow: Hatha Yoga focuses on balancing the body‚Äôs energy centres, known as chakras, promoting optimal energy flow. By harmonizing these energies through specific poses and breathwork, practitioners often report increased vitality and a heightened sense of well-being. ‚Äì Enhanced Mind-Body Connection: A cornerstone of Hatha Yoga is the integration of breath with movement, fostering a profound mind-body connection. This heightened awareness not only improves coordination but also cultivates a sense of mindfulness, leading to a more conscious and intentional way of living.
Title: Men's Yoga Class East London-  a transformative journey
Subtitle: Join us for a Men's Yoga Class in East London to improve your physical and mental well-being on a transformative journey.

Description: Begin your journey into London's history at London Metropolitan Archives. The Unforgotten Lives exhibition presents the stories of Londoners of African, Caribbean, Asian and Indigenous heritage who lived and worked in the city between 1560 and 1860 and are recorded in London‚Äôs archives. Exploring a range of experiences from the pages of the extraordinary manuscripts, prints and maps in our collections, these multi-layered stories speak of love, enterprise, wealth and family life; discrimination, hardship, resilience and resistance. Informed by an ongoing research project which aims to reveal London‚Äôs complex and long-standing diversity and developed in partnership with Northeastern University London, the exhibition presents evidence of presence and community in a range of incredible documents created nearly 500 years ago. It celebrates well known figures from London‚Äôs past and introduces some of the thousands of names discovered in the archives. Olaudah Equiano, a key figure in the movement to abolish slavery and member of the Sons of Africa, features with his daughter Joanna. The London life and family of Ellen and William Craft is documented, following their extraordinary escape from enslavement, and a manuscript voting record of Ignatius Sancho from 1774, believed to be the first time that a person of African heritage voted in an election in Britain, is displayed for the first time at London Metropolitan Archives. We also meet many less familiar Londoners discovered by the research project including Katherine Auker, who successfully petitioned to be released from her enslaver in 1690. A man from Bengal known as John Morgan who escorts a cheetah to London in the 1760s and Prince Dederi Jaquoah who was baptised in the City of London in 1611.The archives also tantalisingly reveal what may be the identity of the servant of Sir Joshua Reynolds, who appears in several of his iconic paintings. Immersed in hundreds of years of London‚Äôs archives, Unforgotten Lives reveals glimpses of some of the 3300 people discovered by the research project to date, presenting their stories and their importance in the history of London. A complimentary art exhibition is now on display at London Metropolitan Archives from Monday 4 December until Wednesday 27 March. Admission is free. Inspired by the stories in the Unforgotten Lives exhibition, artists Annie-Marie Akussah, Elyssa Rider, and Tara Jerome Bernab√© have produced five new artworks to bring their stories to life. Annie-Marie Akussah showcases three-dimensional artwork that uses archival maps and images of landscapes that Black abolitionist, Ottobah Cuguoano, would have encountered in Ghana, Grenada and England - to confront the unknown, the new land. Elyssa Rider presents oil portraits of Ann Duck, a young mixed-race woman caught up in a life of theft and assault who is eventually hung for her crimes; and an imagined Japanese merchant woman, to re-address the absence of East-Asian women in the archive. Tara Jerome-Bernab√© reimagines the lives and images of young Black servants who were enslaved and made to work in aristocratic families as ‚Äòhouseboys‚Äô. Their new woven painting hopes to start a peaceful and more natural connection to the individuals trapped in certain derogatory paintings of the sixteenth to eighteenth century. We invite you to explore these unique artworks and engage with the conversations they evoke.
Title: Unforgotten Lives Exhibition
Subtitle: An extraordinary exhibition presenting the stories of Londoners of African, Caribbean, Asian and Indigenous heritage from 1560 and 1860.

Description: Painting with oils outdoors (Plein Air) in Hyde Park with a small picnic and wine to fuel your creativity. Easels and materials provided. Why not to enjoy a beautiful sunny weather in London and take your creativity outdoors. Join Katerina Kovalova , international artist and art teacher for this wonderful opportunity to paint en Plein Air, in the orchard and gardens of the most iconic and inspirational park in London, Hyde Park . The workshop will begin with Katerina giving a brief talk about outdoor painting, followed by a demonstration of painting in the garden. Participants will then find their own spot to paint autonomously whilst Katerina circulates offering help and advice where required. Working in an intimate part of the park, the aim of this workshop is to produce a series of 'plein air' sketches that simplify the varied and complex views seen. Distilling the subjects through mark-making and colour to capture your experience of the day. Meeting by the Dolphin and a boy fountain for initial briefing, students will then walk to a park where easels and picnic will be set up. Students will produce a series of paintings by the end of the day. These sessions can be attended using whatever medium you choose to work in - e.g. oils, watercolours, pastels, etc. Refunds and options for reschedule will be given in case of bad weather All materials provided
Title: Painting in Hyde park (plein air) with picnic and wine
Subtitle: Painting with oils outdoors (Plein Air) in Hyde Park with a small picnic and wine to fuel your creativity. Easels and materials provided.
