Description:
MENTAL HEALTH FIRST AID COURSE - MHFAIDER¬Æ TRAINING
 The mental health first aid training qualifies you as mental health first aider. It‚Äôs 16 hours course which can be taken online or face to face. If you choose the online mental health first aid option you will attend  16 hours live sessions with one of our instructors 
 
 We run face to face mental health first aid training in London on Mondays-Tuesdays (09:30 am ‚Äì 5:00 pm) in our Old Street venue and Thursdays-Fridays (09:30 am ‚Äì 5:00 pm) in our London Bridge venue
 
 MHFAiders¬Æ gain the knowledge and skills to spot the signs of a person experiencing poor mental health, the confidence to start a conversation and the tools to signpost to appropriate support
 
 MHFA England‚Äôs training is grounded in research. It has been developed through an inclusive lens, with input from people with lived experience and in collaboration with clinical practitioners, learners, and workplaces 
 
 The MHFA training is proven to increase MHFAiders¬Æ confidence in supporting people with mental ill health. 
 
 With confidence, community and access to exclusive resources and events, MHFAiders¬Æ will feel empowered to provide support where it‚Äôs needed and begin to help shape a healthier workplace with a thriving culture
Title: Mental Health First Aid
Subtitle: Mental Health First Aid Training

Description: ‚ÄòDinner and a movie‚Äô is so 2021! Especially when the movie is now played out in the real-world. Let us explain! The route you‚Äôre going to follow in the city is sprinkled with charming and picturesque places, fun clues and challenges, and romantic stories of past and present. The experience will play out like you‚Äôre the main characters of a movie, only that you‚Äôre experiencing everything in first person! Fun dialogue, intrigue, and unexpected interactions are guaranteed. Experience the sights, smells, and sounds of picturesque Bushy Park.  It's all about the beautiful walk as you solve simple clues to find your family & hear fun facts about local inhabitants. An exciting couples, family & buggy-friendly journey to discover a rich cornucopia of beautiful plants & animals. The route starts at the Bushy Park Visitor Centre & finishes by the lovely Pheasantry Cafe, are you ready for a stroll with a difference? HOW IT WORKS‚ùì 1. Book your tickets üé´ 2. Download the Questo app - it's free üì≤ 3. Head to the starting pointüìç WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO  The game is an interactive activity where you are guided by a mobile app through the city. With it, you follow directions and solve very fun puzzles, riddles, and cryptic codes. During the game, you will also visit popular and hidden places in the city while learning fun (and we mean it) stories about them. This is a storytelling experience just as much. The people doing these city exploration games gave them an average rating of 4.7/5 around the world. Join the playground too! ------------------ More about Questo üö∂‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Questo is an urban entertainment platform offering thematic real-world exploration games. It is currently available in over 130 cities üåé and has entertained hundreds of thousands of players already. As of today, the app offers more than 300 different experiences created by a growing network of local content creators and event organizers.
Title: Beautiful Bushy Park London: The Missing Game - Outdoor Escape Game
Subtitle: If you‚Äôre looking for a new and exciting way of spending time with your one and only, family or friends, this is your Eureka moment!

Description: Join Kate for a Full Moon Ceremony of sacred Sound and Cacao.  We can lean into the the powerful deep energies of this New Moon, beautiful plant medicine and healing frequencies and let go of trauma or blockages that are holding you back, release and rebalance on a deep cellular level and attune yourself with your higher power and magic. Cacao is used as a Shamanic medicine and through opening the heart, it enables us to hear our true self, dissolve any pent up negative energy, and help us align with who we truly are.  Kate will guide you through a cacao ceremony using this beautiful plant medicine to help release and set intentions into the New Moon energies and then into a transcendent sound journey. Through the healing frequencies of the crystal bowls and Kate‚Äôs other worldly vocals, shamanic drum and celestial chimes, you are able to drop into a lucid space. It is a time for you to open up and receive. Emotions can be released, visions can be experienced, messages can come through, and deep peace, bliss and transcendence can be found. Resetting us and clearing space for the magic in our lives to unfold and weave through the coming weeks and the next lunar cycle. Kate Fleur Young Kate Fleur Young is a musician, artist and certified Sound Healer and Yoga Teacher. She has created a path where these modalities have become an integral part of her understanding of healing and transformation, not only for herself but for others.  Kate is passionate about Ritual and Ceremony in her space holding, guiding us back to a deeper understanding of ourselves, our human experience, the world around us, and making the every day sacred whether that be for groups, events, holding retreats, or working 1:1 with clients.  She works in connection with the natural world and the cyclical way that it intertwines with our lives allowing us to come home to connection and our creativity in a busy city life that can be full of anxiety and stress.  *ÔªøPlease arrive a minimum of 10 minutes prior to the session as doors close and event begins at the start time. No latecomers will be admitted.
Title: NEW MOON CACAO + SONIC MEDICINE CEREMONY w/ KATE AT THE MANDRAKE
Subtitle: Join Kate for a Full Moon Ceremony of sacred Sound and Cacao at The Mandrakes marble penthouse.

Description: From the award-winning creator of ‚ÄòBring Your Baby Guided London Walks‚Äô, ‚ÄòBring Your Baby Pub Quizzes‚Äô are fun, brain-stimulating daytime parent socials, which take place all over London. In GREAT pubs.¬† Team size is 6 maximum to make it fair on everyone.¬† Quizzes take a slower pace than traditional ones. We are parents ourselves, and understand juggling a ‚Äòbaby brain‚Äô with baby distractions!¬† Toddlers are welcome, but are the parent or carer's responsibility. Please bring suitable toys and games to entertain them while you quiz! We take two breaks to feed, change and chat, and questions are always repeated.¬† Settle in with the picture round from 12pm, with a further five quiz rounds (including general knowledge, music, connection and themed) starting at 12.30pm until 2.30pm. Don‚Äôt panic if you‚Äôre a bit late - we repeat questions.¬† A lunch menu including vegan and gluten-free options is available. Baby change is available, including our legendary mobile baby change which means you don't need to leave the quiz to change baby!¬†A number of high chairs are also available.¬† Prizes for 1st, 2nd & 3rd places include items such as Prosecco, luxury chocolate boxes and beauty boxes. The prizes are for you, not the babies!¬† Complimentary sweet treats for each table (sealed in packaging).¬† Important notes: - Children are the responsibility of the parent or guardian, and must be monitored by them at all times.  - We understand that the parent or guardian will want to keep sleeping babies close to their table in baby carriers (including, for example: prams, buggies or car seats). However if babies are awake we reserve the right to ask the parent or guardian to move their baby carrier into a designated area of the venue to meet health and safety requirements (such as clear access to fire exits and clear walkways). - Refunds or requests to move to a future event or date must be requested within 24 hours of the event commencing so that we can try to refill the space in adequate time.  - On occasion we take photos or short video clips at our 'Bring Your Baby Pub Quizzes' or 'Bring Your Baby Guided London Walks'. By attending you are giving your permission for these to be used for Bring Your Baby Ltd promotional purposes. Any individual who we have taken a photograph of and published can request that any photographs are removed and deleted at any time. Even if they have given consent when booking according to our terms and conditions, they can of course withdraw their consent and can contact us at Lucy@bringyourbaby.org (c) Copyright 'Bring Your Baby Ltd'
Title: BRING YOUR BABY PUB QUIZ @ Kew Gardens Hotel, KEW, RICHMOND (TW9)
Subtitle: From the creator of ‚ÄòBring Your Baby Guided London Walks‚Äô, ‚ÄòBring Your Baby Pub Quizzes‚Äô are fun, brain-stimulating daytime parent socials.

Description: Winston Churchill, Women's Suffrage and Wartime Music are combined in this tour with melodious charm! This tour combines all of these subjects into a sing-a-long walk through Westminster! March along, join in...¬†and sing if you wish! There will be songs coordinated to accompany us on our way. Those interested in the life and times of Winston Churchill will be sure to enjoy this walk. We cover ground in Westminster, taking in statues and stories from the fascinating life of Winston Churchill. The walk includes Winston as a boy and his famous parents, his early military career and his love of cigars, his World War I blunder, his love for Clementine, World War II and his Prime Minister years. Women's Suffrage and the roles that women played as war changed our way of life are also covered. "Meet" Emmeline Pankhurst and her famous daughters,¬†hear the song that describes how the war changed the roles of women in society, and join in marching for Votes for Women. The tour takes in famous sightseeing locations including Big Ben & Houses of Parliament, Downing Street, Trafalgar Square and Piccadilly Circus. You'll enjoy this experience and find yourself humming a tune all the way home. COVID-19 Guidelines In order to safely conduct this tour for myself and my clients, I ask that all government recommended guidelines be complied with. I will be wearing a mask and would request that clients also comply to cover mouth and nose. I will use hand sanitiser before and after the tour, and recommend that clients bring their own sanitiser. Additionally, I recommend arriving a few minutes early to go  to the restroom and wash your hands if you travel via the underground. Please wear a mask while on the underground. During the tour, we will maintain a safe distance of 1m apart. In the event that you are not well on the day, please do not attend the tour. If the guide is unwell, you will be informed the morning of the tour and full refunds will be administered. It is essential that we all look after each other and keep safe during this time. Phone number must be provided at time of booking for communication options related to your tour only.
Title: Churchill and WWII Music
Subtitle: A great tour for those who want to know more about this great man!

Description: Yoga classes tend to offer the same style of Yoga, Hatha on one day, Vinyasa the next and perhaps finishing off the week with Yin. So how exactly can you decide on which style suits your individual needs? Whatever part of your Yogic path you are on, with the expert help of Tessa Rohrig, we‚Äôve carefully crafted a 6-week course to improve your practice, introduce you to Yoga styles you may not have tried or for any newbies, give you a well-rounded taste of a few different yoga flavours. This series [2] is a perfect opportunity to invest in your well-being and embark on a unique yoga journey with Tessa Rohrig as part of Bodhi Tree Spa‚Äôs ‚ÄúWellness Within‚Äù event program. Join us in February for an unforgettable experience that will nurture your mind, body, and soul and prepare for the fast-approaching spring. We‚Äôd love to welcome you to our transformative 6-part evening yoga course with the inspirational Tessa, offered as part of Bodhi Tree Spa‚Äôs ‚ÄúWellness Within‚Äù event program. Tessa‚Äôs two-decade yoga journey across the USA, Southeast Asia, and Europe uniquely equips her to guide you on this transformative journey. Variety is the key to unlocking your full potential! Each style offers unique benefits, ensuring a balanced, adaptable practice. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner or seasoned yogi, this series caters to your needs, promoting physical, mental, and emotional well-being. Tessa Rohrig is a dedicated yoga instructor with over two decades of experience, inspired by her yoga journey across the USA, Southeast Asia, and Europe. Tessa‚Äôs passion for yoga and its transformative power has guided her as both an instructor and a practitioner. Her unique insights, combined with the exploration of Eastern meridians, will lead you on this extraordinary holistic journey offered as part of Bodhi Tree Spa‚Äôs ‚ÄúWellness Within‚Äù event program. Each 60-minute session is a carefully crafted experience, featuring yoga, breathwork, meditation, and exploration of Eastern meridians and has been surated with Spring in mind. A time to cleanse, detaox, renew .  The unique aspect of this course is that each session is distinct, building upon the previous one. It‚Äôs a journey of self-discovery, personal growth, and holistic wellness. Anyone who completes the 6-week course will get a little gift from Bodhi Tree Spa!
Title: Discover Yoga | Spring is in the Air | 6-Week Course
Subtitle: Get ready for a  6-week yoga course curated for getting ready for Spring. Renew, spring clean, detox & cleanse your mind, body & soul!

Description: WÔªøe understand that it can be nerve-wracking to join a new group but we are a very friendly group of all ages. Everyone is welcome. We are a peer support group aiming to help people struggling with their physical or mental health. Sometimes life is tough and it can really help to meet other people who understand and don't judge you. The group runs 9.30-11.30am and you can arrive at your convenience within that. We have a huge range of crafts, pampering, games, activities and wellbeing resources that you are welcome to use while in the group. You choose something you'll enjoy, grab yourself a tea or coffee (included) and join the rest of the group. Everyone is a friend you haven't met yet. Please note, we don't offer counselling or medical support but we can signpost to other support services and help you to self refer to other support.
Title: Kindness and Wellbeing Group
Subtitle: We offer a welcoming space for everyone to come and craft with new friends.

Description:
Certificate: Course Completion Certificate Language: English Duration: 1 Day																						   Credits: 8 Course Delivery: Classroom/ Virtual Live / Onsite Course Overview: This Career Planning course is about effective resumes/CVs, writing cover letters, and facing interviews. If you want to get a job in any English-speaking country, this course is for you. Improve your self-presentation and communication skills to get your dream job or earn a promotion. Build connections with others to aid your career development. Course Topics: Introduction   Writing an Irresistible Resume Creating a compelling cover letter Strategies for Interview Success Conclusion Course Feature: After completing this course, you will know how to stand out from the crowd, make a great first impression, and highlight your strengths. Step by step, you will learn: Certification: Once after the training, you receive a course completion certificate from Mangates Who can Attend? Anybody who is interested in learning Career Planning Skills. Note: However, catering to the demands of busy professionals, our virtual training programs are as effective as face-to-face learning. Reach us at info@mangates.com for dates and details of instructor-led live Virtual Sessions.  If you would like to get this course customized and delivered exclusively for your group, we have an On-Site Training Option, you can reach us at info@mangates.com for more details about on-site or corporate training. Offers: Groups of 3 people 10% Discount Groups of 5 people 15% Discount Groups of 10 people 20% Discount Public Speaking Training: According to a 1973 survey by the Sunday Times of London, 41% of people list public speaking as their biggest fear. Forget small spaces, darkness, and spiders, standing up in front of a crowd and talking is far more terrifying for most people. Through this workshop your participants will become more confident and relaxed in front of an audience which will translate into a successful speaking event. Leading Effective Teams Training: This training based on leading teams will help you to develop anyone that leads a team or is involved in a leadership role. It is also useful for those that are about to embark on a position of leadership or need to develop their leadership skills. Train the Trainer Training: Whether you are preparing to be a professional trainer, or you are someone who does a bit of training as a part of their job, you always want to be prepared. Your participants will understand that training is a process where skills, knowledge, and attitudes are applied in a unique way. Presentation Skills Training: In a survey carried out amongst experienced, middle and senior executives, designed to determine the things that they feared most, public speaking came out as number one. Death was eighth on the list! So, most of us would rather die than stand up and present! Practical Sales Skills Training: These practical sales skills training has been developed for salespeople or people who are required to sell as part of their role. This course is applicable for both people relatively new to sales as well as those who have a lot of experience as the content is flexible enough to adapt to suit the audience. Conflict Management Training: Disagreements, differences of opinion and conflicting perspectives on key issues inevitably arise in any context where people are working together.
 Research has shown that workplace conflicts can become highly destructive. Negative emotions may be stirred up, poisoning team morale, creating stress and destroying relationships. Power Query and Power Pivot for Excel Training: Power BI (including Power Query & Power Pivot) are the biggest Excel news items in the last 10 years. They give Excel users the power to draw information out of multiple sources, link it together then perform calculations on it that can then be sliced & diced any way you want. Essential Management Skills Training: Every day, managers solve difficult problems, turn organisations around, and achieve astonishing performance. To be successful, every organisation needs good managers.
 Manager Management  Training: With this course, you will be able to provide the skills, guidance, and empowerment to your team of managers. They will then be better suited in leading and motivating their team and thus produce fantastic results. To be a successful manager means having a wide range of skills. Through this workshop, you will be able to disperse your knowledge and experience throughout your leadership team. Train the Trainer Training: Our Train-The-Trainer workshop will provide your participants the skills to help them deliver engaging and compelling workshops. Skills such as facilitating, needs analyses, and managing tough topics will give your trainees what they require to become a trainer themselves. Sales Presentation Mastery Training: Sales are the absolute most essential component of any business, and selling skills are the most highly valued skills in today‚Äôs business landscape. The world's fastest growing and most successful businesses have one thing in common: they have effective sales people that drive their business forward. Time Management Training: Personal time management skills are essential for professional success in any workplace. Those able to successfully implement time management strategies are able to control their workload rather than spend each day in a frenzy of activity reacting to crisis after crisis - stress declines and personal productivity soars! These highly effective individuals are able to focus on the tasks with the greatest impact to them and their organization. Internet Marketing Fundamentals Training: Marketing has changed dramatically over the last decade. Marketing is all about communicating, and the Internet has completely changed the way people communicate. The Internet is a marketer's dream come true, especially with social media, as you have a low-cost marketing tool that can reach a large audience. Essential Management Skills Training: These Essential Management Skills training suitable for anyone that works in a management or leadership role. They will provide the perfect foundation for new managers to develop and grow, while giving existing managers the chance to review their current skills and build on their performance.

Description: These are coached club sessions  - suitable for beginners up to world champions. We meet in the cafe area around 8.30pm for a dry warm up session and get in the water from 21:00 - 22:0 If you are interested in coming along to try out, please book a Tryout ticket. To attend the session we require everyone to fill in two forms, the links below will take you to the NoTanx Club management platform (bsport) - you will need to create a log-in the first time you click on these links and then you will have access to both forms (this information will be stored securely). Should you wish to become a NoTanx member in the future, this information will be associated with your account and you won't need to go through this stage again. ***YOU MUST COMPLETE THESE FORMS BEFORE ATTENDING A SESSION*** NoTanx Medical Statement NoTanx Liability Release & Assumption of Risk Club members - do not book tickets here, please use the app. Please let us know if you need to borrow fins or a mask. For more information please message us on Info@NoTanx.com or helen.notanx@gmail.com We break Freediving into 10 aspects that can be trained separately, and have 42 exercises that train all 10 aspects. Most sessions are Yin (soft internal) working on soft techniques, awareness & efficiency. Other sessions are Yang sessions (hard external) working on monofin technique and flexibility.

Description: There is a great deal of current research into the development of the teenage brain and we know that many parents are interested in why and how the teenage brain is changing during adolescence but, in particular want to know what they can do to support their children during this time and deal with any tricky behaviour that they might see. We are, therefore, pleased to offer "Talking Teens: from child to adult" a popular, two and a half hour workshop that addresses these questions.  A Supporting Links workshop is not a lecture. It is an interactive learning experience.  You will NOT be required to take part in any role play! The session is for parents and carers of all children from Year 6 upwards at The Beacon and will give you an understanding of why young people behave the way that they do and what you can do about it with practical up to date ways of improving communication, encouraging independence and reducing conflict. This workshop will prepare you for the years to come. Through the use of group discussion, individual/group activities and written materials you will learn about: Parents will leave with the skills to apply this understanding within their families. Previous attendees have said: ‚ÄúExcellent teen brain explanation. Very well delivered and engaging session‚Äù ‚ÄúGood tips on how to cope and manage the teenage years ‚Äì well done! I feel much more prepared now‚Äù "The workshop really made me think about what is going on for my son and how I try to deal with his behaviour. Just a couple of small changes have made a huge difference. Thank you so much." In order to minimise the cost to parents,  the school is supporting this event by hosting and providing refreshments. There are a limited number of places which will be offered on a first come first served basis.  We will be holding a waiting list and will offer places as and when they become available. If you have any questions then please contact Noushin Rahman-Blake, Supporting Links on 01442 300185 or email info@supportinglinks.co.uk.  Supporting Links is an independent company.
Title: Talking Teens. A workshop for parents & carers (634)
Subtitle: Helping you to understand and support your child of 11+ to be the best they can be with as little conflict as possible

Description: At the time of his death in 2017, the architectural critic and historian Gavin Stamp (Private Eye‚Äôs ‚ÄòPiloti‚Äô) had nearly completed his monumental survey of British architecture between the world wars. His wife, the writer and historian Rosemary Hill, has edited the text for publication. Interwar: British Architecture 1919-1939 (Profile) is a refreshing reassessment of the period which looks beyond modernism to give a broader picture of an age of turbulence and contradiction. Hill will be in conversation with Rowan Moore, whose most recent book is Property: The Myth that Built the World (Faber). Join us for Ap√©ro Hour before the event. The Cake Shop will be open from 5.30 p.m. for pre-booked drinks and snacks. Select your Ap√©ro add-on from the ticket drop down.
Title: Rosemary Hill & Rowan Moore: Interwar
Subtitle: Rosemary Hill & Rowan Moore on Gavin Stamp's Interwar

Description: Stephen Vines is a renowned author, journalist, and public speaker, known for his work in various publications including The Observer and The Guardian. Starting as a freelance journalist specializing in Middle East affairs, he later focused on business and industrial matters. Vines has contributed to broadcast media such as the BBC and ABC.  Despite attempts to step back from frontline reporting, he remained active during events like the Hong Kong protests. Vines has received multiple awards for commentary, including from Amnesty International and SOPA. Isabel Hilton is a London based writer and broadcaster. She is founder and editor of chinadialogue, an independent, non-profit organization based in London, Beijing and San Francisco. She has reported from China, South Asia, Latin America, Africa, the Middle East and Europe and has written and presented several documentaries for BBC radio and television. Before founding chinadialogue she was a writer and/or editor for a number of newspapers, including the Sunday Times, the Independent and the Guardian. She has authored and co-authored several books and holds honorary doctorates from Bradford and Stirling Universities. Finn Lau is a pro-democracy activist, one of the most prominent figures at the head of the Hong Kong demonstration. He is known for popularising a protesting strategy coined "Lam Chau" and being the founder of Hong Kong Liberty and Stand with Hong Kong. Isobel Yeung is an award-winning foreign correspondent and documentary filmmaker. In 2019, Yeung went undercover in Xinjiang, China, to investigate the internment camps for Uyghurs in the Muslim majority region, reporting on their mass detention, familial separation, and surveillance at the hands of Chinese authorities. Numerous times during her reporting, Yeung was followed, accosted, and had her camera footage deleted by Chinese police and security forces. In 2023, she fronted a C4 Dispatches 'China in the UK' investigeting Chinese state interference with UK institutions and repression of dissidents on UK soil. Nathan Law is a young Hong Kong activist, currently in exile and based in London. Due to the risk imposed by the draconian National Security Law, Nathan left Hong Kong and continues to speak up for Hong Kong people on the international level.
Title: Hong Kong: Panel Discussion
Subtitle: Beijing's interference, police state and suppression of dissenting voices

Description: Embarking on a musical journey at a young age, Angelica Cayzer Anelli gained recognition as a music scholar. In the last 2 years, she has obtained two diplomas and has secured a spot at the prestigious conservatoire Trinity Laban. She has performed a number of times at St. George‚Äôs Hanover Square and Chopin Society matinees, interpreting a diverse range of repertoire, from Mozart to Rachmaninov and Chopin. Guided by the expertise of concert pianist Marc Corbett-Weaver, Angelica continues to refine her musicality and technique. Her upcoming debut solo recital not only promises a rich musical experience but also highlights her passion for the piano in support of a meaningful cause. Join us at 7.30pm for a complimentary glass of champagne, before taking your seat for this special performance. The first half of the evening will feature works by J.S. Bach, Mozart, and the enchanting sounds of Ravel's 'Jeux d'eau', creating a cascade of tonal colours that will captivate the audience. After an interval, the second half will include Balakirev's 'The Lark,' a selection of Rachmaninov's preludes, and Chopin's mesmerising Ballade No. 2 in F Major.
Title: An evening of Bach, Chopin, Rachmaninov & Ravel by Angelica Cayzer Anelli
Subtitle: Enjoy an evening of Bach, Chopin, Rachmaninov and Ravel in aid of Maggie's West London.

Description: The Great Game Treasure Hunt St Albans is a unique outdoor treasure hunt. We are rated 5/5 on Google and 4.5/5 on TripAdvisor! The hunt will lead you around the city taking in all its famous landmarks and explaining a little bit of its history along the way. You are given a treasure map, compass and clues to find your way along the route. If you are successful you will reveal where to draw the X on your treasure map to show the location of your treasure - a great pub!  It's one of the best activities to do in St Albans or days out in St Albans you can find! :) It can also be done as a Team Building Exercise or Corporate day out! What to expect: An exciting day out. Exploring famous landmarks and secret back streets. Challenge yourself with puzzles, riddles, codes and orienteering work. If you are successful you will reveal where to draw the X on your treasure map to locate the treasure. The treasure is a great pub serving food and drink. We will book a table at the pub so it's ready and waiting when you arrive. What's in the pack: Clues sheet Treasure map Clipboard Compass Prize envelope (contains a history of the pub and an activity pack) Please bring your own pen to help us save on plastic and our carbon footprint :) How to book: Choose your ticket for 1-2 people, 2-4 people or 5-8 people. You only need one ticket per group of this size. After purchase email¬†info@ggtreasurehunts.com¬†to redeem your ticket. Please include a¬†posting address¬†in your email! Please tell us¬†what time you are starting¬†in your email! It takes around 2-3 hours to complete and we will book a table under your name at the treasure pub. Your pack will be posted to you please allow up to 5 working days for it to arrive. Please note your tickets are flexible and can be chosen on any day that suits you. Pub opening times and kitchen times can be found on our website. U18's¬†are allowed in the pubs during the day but in the evenings some venues might not, please check on our website for these times also. Digital packs If you don't have the time to wait for the physical pack to be posted then ask for the digital pack in your email. This is a PDF of the hunt for you to print out or use on a mobile device, provided is a unique code use this to get the discount for your group. If you get a digital pack then we advise you print the hunt out or bring along a notepad to help with the workings out + a compass or compass app.  :) Good luck!
Title: St Albans Fun Puzzle Treasure Hunt! :)
Subtitle: Go on a super fun puzzle treasure hunt in St Albans, where you can crack codes, solve riddles, and discover hidden gems!

Description:
UÔªøPDATE: Warning. Blue Green Algal Bloom.
 
 The water in Black Park lake is temporarily affected by blue green algal blooms. People and domestic animals should avoid contact with the water. Contact can lead to skin rashes, eye irritation, diarrhoea, vomiting, fever and muscular pain.
 
 In the event of contact with the water, please see medical/veterinary advice. 
 
 Thank you for your co-operation.
 Located 100m from the car park, the lake has easy access with several benches and a pathway around it; an accessible fishing bay is located near the Nature Reserve.  Fishing at Black Park Country Park is by Annual Permit or Day Ticket only during car park opening hours.  Both Day Tickets and Annual Permits are available to purchase in advance of your visit, online only. The annual coarse fish closed season applies from the 15th March to the 15th June inclusive.  Please see Fishing Rules and map of fishing areas attached for full details. The annual coarse fish closed season applies 15th March to 15th June inclusive. You must purchase a day ticket or be in possession of an annual pass to fish. You must be in possession of a valid Environment Agency Rod Licence, maximum number of rods 3. Fishing is only permitted during car park opening hours (from 8am to seasonal closing times ‚Äì check Buckinghamshire Country Parks website). No night fishing permitted. Any angler found in breach of Country Parks or Environment Agency rules will be immediately removed from site and reported to the Environment Agency. Local Thames Region Environment Agency byelaws apply. No fish to removed from or released into the lake. All fish must be returned to the water immediately, no keep nets or sacks permitted. No fishing in fenced off nature reserve areas (see map for full details of where you can and cannot fish). Barbless hooks only. Please remove all line and rubbish. Please use sensible quantities of bait, with no pre-baiting permitted. Bait boats should not be used. Children under 16 must be accompanied by an adult. Anglers must move if asked by a representative of the Buckinghamshire Country Parks or a film production. Anglers and associated kit must be located on the lake side of the path (that surrounds the lake). Any broken line or lost rigs must be immediately retrieved. If it is unsafe to retrieve, they must be reported to the Duty Ranger on 07734 734337. Pike fishing season is between October 1st to March 14th. You must be in possession of long forceps and be competent at handling and unhooking pike. A large 36 inch plus net and a large well-padded unhooking mat is required. Strong line to be used (12lb plus) Two treble hooks per trace with semi-barbed hooks permitted. No live baiting. A large 36 inch plus net and a large well-padded unhooking mat is required. Strong line to be used (12lb plus) No fixed leads or unsafe rigs to be used i.e. in case of breakage; all rig components must be able to easily slide over any knots used to join leaders to mainline. Black Park Fishing FAQ's Where can I buy a day ticket / annual permit from? All Fishing Day Tickets and Annual Permits need to be purchased in advance online. Please note that Black Park fishing closes  from 15th March 2023 - 15th June 2024. How much will a Fishing Day Ticket cost me? Day Ticket:		Adult  ¬£7*   /   Concession  ¬£5.50*  / Child (Under 12) ¬£1* *Please note that there is a small online booking fee added at checkout. Does the adult need to buy Day Ticket as well as child if only the child is fishing? No.  If only the child is fishing, then only a child ticket needs to be bought.  However if you have multiple rods then both adult and child will need a ticket. Can I fish anytime of the year? Black Park continues to operate a closed season 15 March-15 June inclusive. Can I night fish? No.  Fishing is only permitted in Black Park Lake during car park opening times (8am-seasonal closing times daily). Are there any rules I need to abide by when I fish? Yes, fishing rules are attached on email to every Day Ticket purchased and in the information above. Please make yourself familiar with these. Where can I fish? The map above shows you where you can / can‚Äôt fish on Black Park Lake.  Please make yourself familiar with this. Who do I contact if I would like to discuss Black Park Fishing further? Buckinghamshire Country Parks Team 01753 511060 / countryparks@buckinghamshire.gov.uk
Title: Fishing DAY TICKET - Black Park (2023/2024)
Subtitle: Black Park Lake is a beautiful lake in the heart of South Buckinghamshire with fantastic fishing opportunities and iconic scenery.

Description: Mudlarking: An evening of stories of finds from the Thames riverbank SpeakersJenny Ridgwell - mudlark, author of Guide to MudlarkingJaime Rory Lucy,  Sean Clarke - expert mudlarks Join us for an evening at St Mary's Church, Putney as we delve into the fascinating world of mudlarking on the Thames riverbank. Discover the hidden treasures and intriguing tales that have been unearthed from the muddy depths. On Tue Mar 12 2024, starting at 19:00:00 GMT+0000 (Greenwich Mean Time), our expert speakers will share their personal experiences and discoveries, bringing to life the rich history of London's river. From ancient artefacts to modern curiosities, this event promises to be an evening filled with captivating stories and insights. Whether you're a history enthusiast, a mudlarking enthusiast, or simply curious about the mysteries hidden beneath the river's surface, this event is not to be missed. Immerse yourself in the wonders of the Thames riverbank and join us for a night of exploration, inspiration, and storytelling. Don't forget to bring your sense of adventure! Includes a free copy of Guide to Mudlarking
Title: Mudlarking stories by expert mudlarks
Subtitle: Join us for an evening of thrilling tales about incredible discoveries along the Thames riverbank in our event Mudlarking stories

Description: Nothing beats a home-cooked meal shared with family! And this is what inspires our Family Style Cookery Classes, a fun, laid-back homestyle cooking experience. Here, you will learn to prepare different dishes and then enjoy them with people who, like you, fuel our mission of supporting refugee and migrant chefs on their journey to integration. It‚Äôs a cookery class with a conscience, like they say! Your class will be led by our wonderful Chef Tamika from Jamaica at Holdspace in Angel, London.  At our Family Style Cookery Classes, you will be grouped with other participants and prepare dishes together as a team. Think of Chef Tamika as the head of the family! She will take care of dividing the class into groups, and each group will be responsible for creating one of the dishes. Of course, you are welcome and encouraged to move around during the class to learn about the other dishes being prepared. Throughout the evening, Chef Tamika will share stories about their food and culture, and explain how to prepare each of the dishes so you come away with some new cooking tricks and inspiration from Jamaica. You will also be emailed the recipes after the class.   Menu, subject to change: This menu contains fish and meat (chicken). Allergens include: celery, mustard, gluten, fish, milk, soya, and eggs. Please let us know if you have any specific dietary requirements so our team is aware  ahead of the class but  kindly note that we will not be substituting  any ingredients to accommodate dietary needs  so please only book into classes that suit  your dietary preferences and needs. Please see our Food and Allergens Policy for more information. A  message from our Chef Tamika: "My name is Tamika Jones.  I am from Kingston, Jamaica.  Food in Jamaica is influenced by all the different nationalities that settled there - Irish, British, French, Asian, Spanish, American and African. Everyone wants to live in Jamaica because it is such a beautiful island! A lot of our ingredients come from other parts of the world.  I developed a passion for cooking, watching and helping my grandmother from the age of 8 years old. She was a great cook and baker. On Sundays, she would gather all of us, her granddaughters, to eat together. Rice and peas are one of our special Sunday meals. Our home was always full of people.  Even though we were poor, my grandmother was always feeding everyone. There were always people coming over to our house for my grandmother‚Äôs food. I remember the day she let me cook was one of the best days of my life. It really boosted my confidence, like I can do anything! Before leaving Jamaica, I used to cook from home and sell the food for a living. My food was very popular and I really enjoyed doing it.  When I moved to the UK, I worked in a Caribbean restaurant for many years. My coleslaw was famous at the restaurant! One day I would love to own my own Jerk centre and franchise it - like Nando‚Äôs.  Now, I live in London and I am looking forward to teaching you how to cook Jamaican food." We‚Äôre excited to have you in the class! Please take note of a few final reminders:
Title: Jamaican Cookery Class with Tamika | LONDON | Pop Up
Subtitle: Chef Tamika will teach you some of her favourite Jamaican dishes followed by a sit down meal. Warm & easy, like being with family!

Description: MEETING Interested in networking with like-minded business women ? Then you need to consider attending this meeting. WIBN is a business network organisation for women business owners and employed professionals, who network each month over a facilitated business lunch. Our members support and encourage each other through collaboration and the sharing of business contacts and opportunities. The meetings are structured and effective, whilst also supportive and friendly! Women love to help other women in a non-competitive environment. Why not join us at our next event, and experience the potential to grow your business through WIBN. You will have the¬†opportunity to give a 60-second pitch about your business. Every month, we have a spotlight session where a member talks about her business in detail.¬†  The following is a 2-minute video explaining a little more about WIBN and what to expect. Take a look! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dqxNyFKq_KY I do hope you can make it. #networking #businessnetworking #womeninbusinessnetwork #londonnetworking #WIBN Samantha Lawton - WIBN Associate - 07976 932631 www.wibn.co.uk #Marylebone .
Title: Women in Business Network - London Networking - Marylebone

Description: Mini Acorns Forest School will take place in our own woodland on Tuesdays between 09:30-11:00. Activities include nature-inspired crafts, den building, rope swings, cooking in the mud kitchen and campfires. Sessions will be facilitated by one of our level three qualified forest school leaders, however children must be accompanied by an adult or carer. Mini Acorns Forest School will follow the forest school ethos which you can learn more about here.
Title: Stay and Play Parent and Toddler Forest School sessions
Subtitle: Our parent and toddler forest school sessions offer the opportunity to have fun outdoors and develop a connection with nature.

Description: This workshop is for anyone who would like to learn how to darn woollens and/or repair damaged clothing by hand. What is covered on the day is tailored to the needs of those participating, but can include traditional darning techniques (weaving & duplicate stitch), patching, sewing on buttons and restitching hems and seams. Previous experience of sewing is not required. We will also cover visible mending and how this can be used to repair textiles in colourful and creative ways. Sashiko templates are available for anyone who would like to try their hand at this traditional Japanese technique of reinforcing and patching worn areas. If you have items in need of repair please bring them along to the workshop. Advice can be provided on how to repair items you do not have time to complete during the session. If you don't have anything that needs repairing at the moment, we can provide you with a swatch to work on. All the materials that you will need to repair your clothing item will be provided in this workshop including threads and patches. You will be able to take home the materials that you need to complete any unfinished repairs at home. The class size is limited to eight and at least three people will need to book for this session to go ahead.
Title: Creative Clothes Repair and Decoration
Subtitle: A workshop for anyone who would like to learn how to repair and decorate clothes by hand.

Description: Playing badminton is an excellent way to stay physically active, maintain a healthy lifestyle and can also help to relieve stress and boost mental health. It is a fun and engaging way to take your mind off daily worries and improve mood and focus. ALL LEVELS WELCOME! The games will be doubles with people of similar ability, shuttles and racquets will be provided. We can arrange coaching sessions if required. Every tuesday, starting January 9th to May 7th (¬£5 per session) Where? Lynch Hill Academy ( near Arbour Park Stadium, Stoke Road , SL2 5 AY) Time? 7:30-8:30 PM Don't forget to stay hydrated, bring your water bottle! Email us at contact@thesloughhub.org for any queries! Spaces are limited! NO CASH PAYMENTS. PLEASE BOOK IN ADVANCE!
Title: Social Badminton
Subtitle: Join us for weekly badminton on Thursdays and keep yourself motivated to maintain your fitness and an active lifestyle. #badminton

Description: Zumba is a lively class combining energetic Latin and international music with dance movements, creating a fun and effective workout that feels more like a dance party than a traditional exercise. Participants follow the instructor's lead, engaging in rhythmic choreography that targets various muscle groups, boosts cardiovascular fitness, and fosters a vibrant and inclusive community atmosphere.The Event is Open to all levels of participants from complete beginners to regular dancers. The aim is to get people active and drive away the winter blues.You can book for 1 session or all six.The charge is ¬£5 per session or ¬£20 for 6.Free places are available for Business on the High Street. Please write to info@sloughbid.co.uk to get a discount code.Residents of the Horlicks Quarter can also join for free. Please write to contact@thesloughhub.org to get a discount code. Participants should wear comfortable workout attire that allows for ease of movement. Rubber-soled shoes with good supportBring a water bottle to stay hydrated throughout the class.. It's suitable for various fitness levels, as participants can modify their routines. There is no need for prior dance experience, as the routines are designed to be accessible to all. Newcomers are to arrive a bit early to inform the instructor of any health considerations or injuries they may have. Additionally, participants should be prepared for a lively and social atmosphere, as Zumba classes will have a community-focused and supportive vibe.
Title: Slough High Street - Zumba Classes
Subtitle: New  Year, New You. Join our Tuesday evening Zumba classes

Description: Will Sebag-Montefiore has achieved an undeniably mild success making satire online - so much so that he no longer has to pay for deoderant. This is his first attempt at putting together his satirical online work in to a cohesive live show full of characters, songs and sketches. Deconstucting the current political climate despite a very surface level undertsanding of it all, this cheaply deoderised man will shine a light on the most important thing about satire: himself. This is Will of the People. - Show starts at 7pm. It could be ten minutes long, it could be the full hour. I have literally no idea. Come, laugh, enjoy and be nice plz x
Title: Will of the People (work in progress)
Subtitle: Will is an online satirist who turns the news in to sketches & songs despite not being very smart. Will any of it work live? Let's find out.

Description: In the midst of life's burdens, when the weight of the world feels like its leading us into constriction, there lies a sanctuary of release and renewal. This is an invitation to dance from the soul, to express gratitide for the blessing of life, even in the face of challenges. Let the energy of love and harmony flow through you, connecting with others in the warmth of shared experiences. What to expect: whirling meditation guided by Anna Ruya Community dance and expression from the heart Come whirl and be moved In the sacred act of whirling discover a profound sense of expression and connection Anna Ruya's method  invite's you to shed the weight, dance in gratitude and find renewal in the embrace of love and harmony.
Title: A Meditation Dance Experience
Subtitle: Join us to learn the basics of the whirling dervish dance.

Refund_Policy: Contact the organiser to request a refund.
Description: Anomalous Social Club (ASC) is an initiative to encourage connectivity and discourse, through care, culture and conversation. In honour of Women's History Month, we‚Äôre creating space to find solace through community and healing. This instalment of ASC CARE will be lead by Lucy Macieira of The Goddess Healing Cycle. The evening will include: Date: 12th March Time: 18:30-21:30 Location: Anomalous Space, 38 Pentonville Road, London, UK Please arrive promptly and wear comfortable clothing suitable for gentle movement. Bring your own yoga mat, but if you don't have one, don't fret! We have a limited number to hand out. Light refreshments such as tea and coffee will be available throughout, as well as each guest receiving an iconic Goddess Healing Cycle goodie bag! Lucy Macieira is an empath and is currently on the shamanic medicine wheel, trained in several healing methods. She is initiated in the rites of the Munay-ki, and has Reiki Level 2 certification. Lucy started these spaces in 2022, after leaving a corporate job & suffering burn out, she created these spaces to work with women who were going through, or have been through similar experiences. These events were designed by Lucy to offer women safe spaces to process and heal, as well as receive different inductions into several healing modalities. TERMS & CONDITIONS By purchasing a ticket and attending this event, you consent to the following: ~ Please note, this event is welcoming of those interested in learning new self-help skills to support their physical, mental and emotional wellbeing. This event is not a replacement for talking therapies, pharmaceutical interventions or any other forms of treatment which are recommended to individuals currently under the care of mental health services or other professionals. This event may act as a compliment to other therapeutic interventions for individuals experiencing mental health difficulties. `~ I understand that this event involves physical movement, breathing exercises and meditation, that includes specific psychological and physiological change. In the unlikely event of injury, Anomalous and associated practitioners are not liable and the participant assumes full responsibility for participation and practice, with commitment to self-monitoring throughout. ~ Event attendees will automatically be added to Anomalous and facilitators mailing lists; to opt-out, please request via email or unsubscribe via our mail out link ~ We document our events for social media in a discreet and unobtrusive way. If you would prefer not to be included please just let us know. ~ Refund requests will be reviewed on a one-to-one basis.
Title: Women's Healing Circle
Subtitle: Join us at ASC to re-energise your mind, body and soul with our wellness and relaxation practices.

Refund_Policy: Contact the organiser to request a refund.
Description: Join the highly anticipated launch of the Buckinghamshire Property Network. We bring together a large group of passionate property individuals and businesses to network, support and share knowledge. Whether you're a developer, estate agent, financier, investor, broker, interior designer, sourcer, trade or anyone and any business in between - you are very welcome. This event has no speakers or formality and all are encouraged to mingle and engage with each other. If there's anyone in particular you'd like to meet just let us know. On arrival, we will welcome you to the evening and provide you with a name badge then it's over to you to grab a drink and enjoy the evening. We look forward to seeing you there and please do let us know if you have any questions - we're always happy to help and hear from you. Ticket Types - We have 2 types of tickets available for you as this is a Not-For-Profit event and part of the wider United Kingdom Property Network. All our events can be attended completely free of charge, however from September 2023 we have provided the option of a paid sponsorship ticket. This allows you to donate a small amount (¬£2) if you so wish to help cover our costs.
Title: United Kingdom Property Network Buckinghamshire
Subtitle: Join a friendly group of likeminded individuals interested in property for the launch of the Buckinghamshire Property Network!

Description:
Certificate: Course Completion Certificate Language: English Duration: 1 Day																						   Credits: 8 Course Delivery: Classroom/ Virtual Live / Onsite Course  Overview: This course focuses on effective negotiation techniques to be successful in different situations and with people holding different levels of power. The course evaluates how negotiations impact the organizations and ourselves. Reflect on the different outcomes that can be achieved through negotiation and understand which outcomes are acceptable for the intended objectives. Finally, participants reflect on the influencing process and how one can achieve things without having authority or power.  Each module has been carefully selected based on the intake and skills gaps of the specific audience. After a brief introduction, participants are given 1 to 2 minutes to introduce themselves, practicing their presentation and communication skills (if the intake has included the requested video, this introduction will only be 1 minute).  Learning Objectives: Prerequisites: None  Course Materials: Students will receive a course manual with presentation slides and reference materials. Examination: There is no examination for this course Technical Requirements: For eBooks: Internet for downloading the eBook Laptop, tablet, Smartphone, eReader (No Kindle) Adobe DRM-supported software (e.g. Digital Editions, Bluefire Reader) eBook download and activation instructions Agenda: Before We Begin Negotiation Canvas BATNA and ZOPA Evaluating Success Influence and persuasion  Introduction to Communication and Presentation skills Conclusions Note: However, catering to the demands of busy professionals, our virtual training programs are as effective as face-to-face learning. Reach us at info@mangates.com for dates and details of instructor-led live Virtual Sessions.  If you would like to get this course customized and delivered exclusively for your group, we have an On-Site Training Option, you can reach us at info@mangates.com for more details about on-site or corporate training. Offers: Groups of 3 people 10% Discount Groups of 5 people 15% Discount Groups of 10 people 20% Discount Public Speaking Training: According to a 1973 survey by the Sunday Times of London, 41% of people list public speaking as their biggest fear. Forget small spaces, darkness, and spiders, standing up in front of a crowd and talking is far more terrifying for most people. Through this workshop your participants will become more confident and relaxed in front of an audience which will translate into a successful speaking event. Leading Effective Teams Training: This training based on leading teams will help you to develop anyone that leads a team or is involved in a leadership role. It is also useful for those that are about to embark on a position of leadership or need to develop their leadership skills. Train the Trainer Training: Whether you are preparing to be a professional trainer, or you are someone who does a bit of training as a part of their job, you always want to be prepared. Your participants will understand that training is a process where skills, knowledge, and attitudes are applied in a unique way. Presentation Skills Training: In a survey carried out amongst experienced, middle and senior executives, designed to determine the things that they feared most, public speaking came out as number one. Death was eighth on the list! So, most of us would rather die than stand up and present! Practical Sales Skills Training: These practical sales skills training has been developed for salespeople or people who are required to sell as part of their role. This course is applicable for both people relatively new to sales as well as those who have a lot of experience as the content is flexible enough to adapt to suit the audience. Conflict Management Training: Disagreements, differences of opinion and conflicting perspectives on key issues inevitably arise in any context where people are working together.
 Research has shown that workplace conflicts can become highly destructive. Negative emotions may be stirred up, poisoning team morale, creating stress and destroying relationships. Power Query and Power Pivot for Excel Training: Power BI (including Power Query & Power Pivot) are the biggest Excel news items in the last 10 years. They give Excel users the power to draw information out of multiple sources, link it together then perform calculations on it that can then be sliced & diced any way you want. Essential Management Skills Training: Every day, managers solve difficult problems, turn organisations around, and achieve astonishing performance. To be successful, every organisation needs good managers.
 Manager Management  Training: With this course, you will be able to provide the skills, guidance, and empowerment to your team of managers. They will then be better suited in leading and motivating their team and thus produce fantastic results. To be a successful manager means having a wide range of skills. Through this workshop, you will be able to disperse your knowledge and experience throughout your leadership team. Train the Trainer Training: Our Train-The-Trainer workshop will provide your participants the skills to help them deliver engaging and compelling workshops. Skills such as facilitating, needs analyses, and managing tough topics will give your trainees what they require to become a trainer themselves. Sales Presentation Mastery Training: Sales are the absolute most essential component of any business, and selling skills are the most highly valued skills in today‚Äôs business landscape. The world's fastest growing and most successful businesses have one thing in common: they have effective sales people that drive their business forward. Time Management Training: Personal time management skills are essential for professional success in any workplace. Those able to successfully implement time management strategies are able to control their workload rather than spend each day in a frenzy of activity reacting to crisis after crisis - stress declines and personal productivity soars! These highly effective individuals are able to focus on the tasks with the greatest impact to them and their organization. Internet Marketing Fundamentals Training: Marketing has changed dramatically over the last decade. Marketing is all about communicating, and the Internet has completely changed the way people communicate. The Internet is a marketer's dream come true, especially with social media, as you have a low-cost marketing tool that can reach a large audience. Essential Management Skills Training: These Essential Management Skills training suitable for anyone that works in a management or leadership role. They will provide the perfect foundation for new managers to develop and grow, while giving existing managers the chance to review their current skills and build on their performance.
Title: Negotiation Skills - Professional 1 Day Training in Slough
Subtitle: Our classroom  and corporate training provides you the opportunity to interact with instructors and benefit from face-to-face instruction.

As long as you have experience (15 hours or more over past 12 months / certification (not necessarily ALLMI accredited ) you can sit the 1 day refresher. Module 1: Course Introduction Module 2: Legislation Module 3: Introduction to Equipment Module 4: Pre and Post Operational Checks Module 5: Storage & Maintenance Module 6: Planning the Lift Module 7: Use of Lifting Accessories Module 8: Signaller Duties and Signals Module 9: Practical Application of Slinging Module 10: Practical Application of Signalling Module 11: Preparation for Assessment Module 12: Assessment Module 13: Administration & Feedback.

Description: Certificate: Course Completion Certificate  Language: English Duration: 2 Days Credits: 16 Course Delivery: Classroom/ Virtual Live/ On-Site Course Overview: Negotiating is a part of everyday life. We negotiate in our work, with our friends, and even our family members. In this two day class, participants will learn what negotiation is and how to get the most from their personal negotiations. Participants will discover their personality style and how to negotiate effectively with other personality styles. Participants will also explore four strategies for negotiating, and how to apply the four step process for successfully negotiating with other parties. Target Audience: Business professionals and team members of all levels who are looking to enhance their negotiation and communication skills. Description: Clive Mather is a former CEO of Shell Canada and has experience chairing multiple organisations and charities in the UK and the world. This will be a fun and interactive evening to understand how we can all develop our leadership and fulfil our potential. Pizza and refreshments will also be provided so don't worry about missing dinner time! Evening starts at 7pm and will finish at 9pm. Venue: University of Surrey Stag Hill Campus - 39 MS 02 - get in touch if you aren't sure where this is! **A FREE EVENT** As long as you turn up on the night, you'll receive a refund of your ¬£5 ticket fee.  More About Clive: Clive chairs churches, charities and companies in the UK and abroad. He has been doing that for decades to address climate change with new technology, to promote international development, to build peace and to invest retirement funds responsibly. He had a long career with Shell including as Chairman in the UK and President & CEO in Canada. He has worked and lived in many countries around the world but is now settled in Guildford with his wife Ann and their border collie. They have 3 children and 7 grandchildren. What is the Life Leadership Course? The Life Leadership Course is an ILM accredited 6-session course run over 6 weeks by Friends International. It covers fundamental ideas about leadership with interactive and practical sessions on navigating culture, team relationships, conflict, personal resilience and more. If you are interested in the next course you can find out more here in this link. Who are Friends International? Friends International is a Christian charity who serves international students in practical, social, spiritual and professional ways through a wide variety of programmes. The Life Leadership Programme is born out of our vision to invest in young adults and is rooted in our Christian values that serve as powerful building blocks for excellence in leadership regardless of your religion, culture or background. Find out more through our website www.friendsinternationalguildford.org.uk.
Title: Life Leadership Sessions - An evening with Clive Mather
Subtitle: Explore how to develop your leadership skills and reach your potential with former CEO of Shell Canada, Clive Mather.

Description: I aim to create the nurturing, warm atmosphere of a campfire where we share stories of our days, of our lives, before returning home. Where we laugh about small things, about brave things and trying something new. Where we come together to make sense of life, to eke out creative time for ourselves in amongst busy commitments of work and family, or with other limitations. I create this atmosphere on a bedrock of wellbeing principles while also sharing creative writing techniques to help you express what is waiting to be said and develop confidence in your own unique voice. What will we actually do? We will write together in response to prompts and exercises I bring to the group. These could be objects, pictures, or poems. Sometimes we will try to write a form of poetry or learn more about stories and how they are made or enjoy inventing characters. Sometimes we will do freewriting and write memories that come up. And sometimes we will play games together such as versions of consequences or collaborative poetry or use more creative methods such as found poetry, mapping or drawing. I will gently guide you step by step and give you plenty of encouragement. You will always be able to choose what to write about. How many people are in the group? The groups are small, with a maximum of 10 people, but often fewer than this.  Do I have to read out my writing? I encourage sharing by either reading out all of what you've written, a line or two, or by saying something about the process. One of the reasons people love coming to workshops is to hear the stories and words from others as they are all so different. It also helps you develop confidence in your unique voice. But you can opt out at any time.
Title: Creative Writing Workshops for beginners | Tuesday eves | East Grinstead
Subtitle: Warm, engaging atmosphere. Gently encouraging. Varied imaginative prompts and exercises. 'A gentle vibe that yields surprising results.'

Whether it's the speech you deliver in the boardroom, the level of attention you give your spouse when they are talking to you, or the look you give the cat, it all means something.  The Communication Strategies workshop will help participants understand the different methods of communication and how to make the most of each of them. Forget small spaces, darkness, and spiders, standing up in front of a crowd and talking is far more terrifying for most people. Through this workshop your participants will become more confident and relaxed in front of an audience which will translate into a successful speaking event. Leading Effective Teams Training: This training based on leading teams will help you to develop anyone that leads a team or is involved in a leadership role. It is also useful for those that are about to embark on a position of leadership or need to develop their leadership skills. Train the Trainer Training: Whether you are preparing to be a professional trainer, or you are someone who does a bit of training as a part of their job, you always want to be prepared. Your participants will understand that training is a process where skills, knowledge, and attitudes are applied in a unique way. Presentation Skills Training: In a survey carried out amongst experienced, middle and senior executives, designed to determine the things that they feared most, public speaking came out as number one. Death was eighth on the list! So, most of us would rather die than stand up and present! Practical Sales Skills Training: These practical sales skills training has been developed for salespeople or people who are required to sell as part of their role. This course is applicable for both people relatively new to sales as well as those who have a lot of experience as the content is flexible enough to adapt to suit the audience. Conflict Management Training: Disagreements, differences of opinion and conflicting perspectives on key issues inevitably arise in any context where people are working together.
 Research has shown that workplace conflicts can become highly destructive. Negative emotions may be stirred up, poisoning team morale, creating stress and destroying relationships. Power Query and Power Pivot for Excel Training: Power BI (including Power Query & Power Pivot) are the biggest Excel news items in the last 10 years. They give Excel users the power to draw information out of multiple sources, link it together then perform calculations on it that can then be sliced & diced any way you want. Essential Management Skills Training: Every day, managers solve difficult problems, turn organisations around, and achieve astonishing performance. To be successful, every organisation needs good managers.
 Manager Management  Training: With this course, you will be able to provide the skills, guidance, and empowerment to your team of managers. They will then be better suited in leading and motivating their team and thus produce fantastic results. To be a successful manager means having a wide range of skills. Through this workshop, you will be able to disperse your knowledge and experience throughout your leadership team. Train the Trainer Training: Our Train-The-Trainer workshop will provide your participants the skills to help them deliver engaging and compelling workshops. Skills such as facilitating, needs analyses, and managing tough topics will give your trainees what they require to become a trainer themselves. Sales Presentation Mastery Training: Sales are the absolute most essential component of any business, and selling skills are the most highly valued skills in today‚Äôs business landscape. The world's fastest growing and most successful businesses have one thing in common: they have effective sales people that drive their business forward. Time Management Training: Personal time management skills are essential for professional success in any workplace. Those able to successfully implement time management strategies are able to control their workload rather than spend each day in a frenzy of activity reacting to crisis after crisis - stress declines and personal productivity soars! These highly effective individuals are able to focus on the tasks with the greatest impact to them and their organization. Description: Queer Sober Social Drop In | 18 - 26 Year Olds Join us for an exciting evening of connection, support, and fun at the Queer Sober Social Drop In event! This in-person gathering is specifically designed for individuals aged 18 to 26, who identify as LGBTQIA+ and are seeking a sober social environment with a focus on increasing friendships & general wellbeing. This event aims to provide a safe and inclusive space for young queer individuals to meet, mingle, and build lasting connections. Whether you're new to the community or have been a part of it for a while, this drop-in event welcomes everyone aged between 18 to 26 years old. Expect a relaxed atmosphere where you can be yourself and engage in various activities, such as board games, karaoke, or simply chatting with like-minded individuals. This is an opportunity to bond, share experiences, and find support within a community that understands and celebrates your unique journey. Just a heads up: we may ask to see some ID if you're new to the space to help us protect the members who already come!  With particular thanks to players of the postcode lottery who make these events possible through grants made by the Postcode society trust.
Title: Queer Sober Social Drop In | 18 - 26 Year Olds
Subtitle: Our wellbeing focused sober drop in for LGBTQIA+ young adults aged 18 to 26 years old.

Description: Marlow SSAS Property Meet Join us for the Marlow SSAS Property Meet, a fantastic in-person event where property people gather to network, share knowledge, and explore the exciting opportunties created by SSAS pensions. Taking place at 7pm at The King's Head, Church Road, Little Marlow, SL7 3RZ SSAS is not for everyone .. but for those people who are interest and want to learn more about how to use SSAS funds to fund property developments, this is the group for you. We are a friendly, independent support group and NOT affiliated with any SSAS provider. Our aim is to use real case studies of projects to show the highs (and lows !) of using your SSAS to fund property developments and properties to hold. We believe that sharing knowledge of real projects allows us to learn from each others mistakes, gain new ideas and celebrate our successes ! This meet is a must attend event for beginners, experienced Trustees and anyone interested in finding out more about SSAS funding. Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to learn, grow, and make valuable connections. See you there! Tickets are LIMITED to ONLY 25 places. So Click on the 'Orange' button to book your place before the tickets SELL OUT ! Please NOTE: We are an independent support group and NOT affiliated with any SSAS providers. We do not give financial advice and you are responsible for doing your OWN due diligence !

OH, HERE'S ANOTHER GREAT THING ABOUT THE EVENT! During each of your mini dates, we'll give you a unique compatibility question that you can both answer. These questions have been carefully crafted to help you gauge chemistry, test compatibility and get an idea about your date's character. In fact, because of these questions, people have said they feel more comfortable coming to our events, are able to learn more about their date and lead to more successful relationships than traditional speed dating events. (Of course you can choose to just chat with your date without the questions if you'd prefer to). WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING ABOUT OUR EVENTS: "As a busy professional, I just don't have time to get out and meet people as much as I'd like so this event was like a Godsend for me. It was a refreshingly fantastic experience!" - Jennifer S. "What a fabulous concept. I met some great people and I started dating one of the guys I met at the event." - Hannah M. "The compatibility questions are the perfect way to tell if you have chemistry with the the other dater." - Emma D., NYC "I loved the questions because it takes the pressure off having to come up with something new to talk about with each person. It's makes a great ice breaker." - Gavin B., NY An example of some of our unique compatibility questions: * If you had a time machine - where would you take it to? Would you stay there? * Do you usually follow your heart or your head? * Would you rather live for one year on an island by yourself or for one year in a small apartment with 7 strangers? * Would you grow a mohawk for a year if it meant that $20,000 would go to a good charity? * What is one thing you‚Äôve always wanted to cross off your bucket list, but haven‚Äôt yet? FAQ: HOW DO I ACCESS THE EVENT? We will email you the link to the Zoom event on the day of the event. HOW MANY PEOPLE WILL I MEET? You will have video dates with between 6 and 15 singles (The average is usually about 10 dates. Amounts vary from event to event) HOW LONG ARE THE VIDEO DATES? Each mini date lasts about 5 minutes (We lengthen the date time to 6 minutes each when we have less people and shorten the date time to 4 minutes when we have more people) WHAT DO I NEED TO ATTEND? All you need is your computer or your smart phone or tablet. HOW STRICT IS THE LISTED AGE RANGE? If you're within a couple of years older or younger than the listed age range, you're welcome to attend. IS THERE A REFUND POLICY? If you need to cancel, please email us and we can transfer you to a future event. However we do not offer transfers if you cancel on the day of the event or don't show up. ******************************************************** WANT TO TRY SOMETHING ELSE THAT'S FUN? WE ALSO ORGANIZE FUN ONLINE TRIVIA AND GAME NIGHTS. MOST OF THE CROWD THAT COMES TO THEM ARE SINGLES FROM ALL OVER SO IT'S ALSO A GREAT WAY TO EXPAND YOUR SOCIAL CIRCLE AND MEET NEW PEOPLE AS WELL. CHECK THEM OUT AT THE LINKS BELOW: ONLINE  SOCIAL GAME NIGHTS (FRIDAY NIGHTS): https://www.eventbrite.com/e/online-game-night-a-fun-social-party-from-home-tickets-103166561964 ONLINE TRIVIA NIGHTS (WEDNESDAY & FRIDAY NIGHTS): https://www.eventbrite.com/e/twisted-trivia-fun-online-trivia-night-tickets-107630244960 **************************************************** ADVERTISEMENT: What colognes do women like most on men? Description:
If you've ever felt there was something holding you back in life, ruining your plans and stopping you from being who you want to be you were right.
 The fact is there is a single source of all your problems, stress, unhappiness and self-doubt. 
 It's called the Reactive Mind, the hidden part of your mind that stores all your negative experiences and then uses them against you. 
 Dianetics gets rid of the Reactive Mind, it's the only thing that does.
 Come to this free one hour lecture on Dianetics and how the mind works.
