Description: We're thrilled to invite you to our dynamic and invigorating fitness classes at Florence Dock! Whether you're a seasoned fitness enthusiast or just starting your wellness journey, our classes are designed to cater to all fitness levels and goals. ‚ö†Ô∏è **Important Information:** - **RSVP:** Kindly confirm your attendance. Due to limited spots, RSVP is strictly required to secure your place. - **Punctuality:** To maintain the quality of the class, latecomers beyond 5 minutes will not be able to join. Please arrive promptly to avoid disappointment. - **Cancellation Policy:** We encourage residents to cancel their tickets at least 24 hours before the class. This helps us manage class capacity and ensures that everyone has the opportunity to participate without any disruptions. -Single-ticket purchase policy: Each customer limited to one ticket per transaction. Circuit training is a type of exercise routine where you move through a series of different exercises or stations in a specific order, often with minimal rest between exercises. Each exercise station might focus on different muscle groups or aspects of fitness, such as cardiovascular endurance, strength, or flexibility. These workouts could involve various exercises using bodyweight, free weights, machines, cardio equipment, and more, all organized in a circuit format to provide a well-rounded and efficient workout. Stay fit, stay motivated, and let's crush those fitness goals together! Please note that to attend an event you must be a resident of Folk at Florence Dock at the time of the event. Please note that we may take pictures at the events that will be used for marketing purposes, and that by attending you give your consent to be photographed and featured. Please let us know on the day if you don't want to feature in any photos.

Description: HOW IT WORKS Step 1: TAKE THE TEST The Oxford Capacity Analysis (OCA) identifies the 10 vital personality traits that influence your entire future. It is a factual, scientific analysis taken from your answers. It is your opinion of you. It takes about an hour to complete. Step 2: GET YOUR RESULTS After you complete the test, your personality analysis is generated and displayed. This takes less than a minute. It shows your strengths and weaknesses‚Äîwhich personality traits to take advantage of and which to get help with. Step 3: CONSULTATION While the analysis graph shows distinct personality traits, it is the interrelationship of these traits that provide the greater picture of your personality. We therefore provide a complimentary consultation to give you a detailed evaluation of your personality analysis. One of our trained consultants delivers this to you. In this one-on-one interview, you gain a better understanding of your personality strengths and perceived weaknesses, and establish the recommended path to your fast and lasting success.
Title: Personality Test & Consultation
Subtitle: Find out your strengths, weaknesses and how clearly you see your goals!

Refund_Policy: NA
Description: Talking about things that really matter We all have questions about life but rarely make time to grapple with them. We‚Äôve created a context to explore our deepest desires and unanswered questions in a relaxed and informal environment. Each week, we‚Äôll have a short talk and plenty of discussion in groups. Christianity for sceptics Aren‚Äôt we better off without religion? Most people assume so. But, have we been too quick to write off God? Each week we‚Äôll ask what Christianity has to say to our irreligious age and consider how it connects with our deepest longings. A space to explore Our goal is to create a non-judgmental and open environment to share our questions and opinions. No one will force their beliefs on you. No question is off-limits. All perspectives are welcome. Seven Big questions Meaning: Isn't there more to life than this? Satisfaction: How can I be happy? Truth: Who can I trust? Morality: How can I be good? Hope: Is there a future for humanity? Peace: How do we overcome anxiety? Faith: How can I believe? Who is the Salt Course for? You might be curious, sceptical or interested in exploring the Christian faith. Some are simply interested in having a good discussion about the stuff that matters. All backgrounds and beliefs are welcome. What happens in an evening? When you arrive, you‚Äôll be allocated to a table, which is a group of 6‚Äì10 people who‚Äôll be with you for the course. We‚Äôll begin with a (free!) dinner, courtesy of the good people at Costa Coffee. After that, we‚Äôll have a short talk and a wide-ranging discussion on our tables, both about that week‚Äôs question. Who are we? The Salt Course is a free course put on by Grace London, a young church based in Waterloo. We‚Äôre a group of young professionals and students from a variety of backgrounds and nations. Our main speaker, Jeremy Moses, grew up in a secular/Jewish family and became a Christian at university. He studied Philosophy, Politics and Economics at Oxford, has worked in corporate strategy and now helps to lead Grace London. When & Where? When: Seven consecutive Tuesday evenings 7.30pm‚Äì9.15pm (Doors open at 7.15pm) Spring 24: 13th February, 20th February, 27th February, 5th March, 12th March, 19th March & 26th March Where: Costa Coffee, The Cut, SE1 8LP (2 mins from Southwark / 5 mins from Waterloo) Sign-up for Spring '24 Most people come for all seven sessions, but you are welcome to come along and just try it out! If you can't make this course but are interested in future courses please email info@salt.london, or visit the Salt Course website.
Title: Salt Course: Exploring Life's Big Questions
Subtitle: The Salt Course is a space to explore life‚Äôs big questions, from a Christian perspective.

Description: How to transform your charity by leveraging volunteer financial skills. Join the co-founders of Charterpath, Alex Marsh and Alice Clementi for a short presentation and interactive discussion on how to access volunteer financial skills and use them to best advantage in your charity. Non-profits are facing immense financial challenges with an increased demand for services, higher costs and even higher hurdles to access funding. It is unsurprising that there is a huge demand for financial expertise and that volunteers with financial skills continue to be the most sought-after in the non-profit sector. The session will include: How to recruit diverse volunteers with financial skills to support your charity; Types of tasks volunteers could undertake (from bookkeeping through to Treasurer / ad-hoc to recurring); How to make the role manageable (e.g. job shares, succession planning, upskilling non financial trustees); and How to get the most out of your volunteers with financial expertise Come along to find out more and get any volunteer opportunities for finance professionals listed on the Charterpath site for free! We look forward to seeing you there. About Charterpath Alice Clementi and Alex Marsh co-founded Charterpath as a community interest company in 2020, with a mission to increase the proportion of professionals with financial skills volunteering from 10% to 50%. Charterpath has already built a diverse and highly engaged community of over 2,000 professionals with financial skills, having successfully connected over 150 non-profits with volunteers, ranging from The Trussell Trust, to the Together Coalition founded by the Archbishop of Canterbury, the Scouts and Manchester Deaf Centre.
Title: Transform your charity by leveraging volunteer financial skills
Subtitle: Find out how you can make better use of volunteer financial skills to help your organisation grow.

Description: This game takes players through some of Colchester's most important Roman landmarks. You play the part of a visiting diplomat, helping the local governor solve a plot for his own murder. The challenges are designed to be easy, so children and adults can both play along. If you want to learn a bit more about Roman Colchester, this is the perfect way to do it. NOTE: Entry to the Roman Circus Visitor Centre is not needed to complete the quest. Entry to attraction is only optional and is not included in your ticket fee. The Visitor Centre or Colchester Archaeological Trust is not affiliated with Questo. The route you‚Äôre going to follow in the city is sprinkled with unique places, fun clues and challenges, and incredible stories.The experience will play out like you‚Äôre the main characters of a movie, only that you‚Äôre experiencing everything in first person! Description: Hi Beautiful! I would love to invite you on a Chakra Journey to find more balance and learn how to charge up your chakras, and how to care after them. We will meet for 8 weeks on Tuesday evenings starting from the 5th of March for 8 sessions from 7:30 pm to about 9 pm. Each session will be dedicated to one Chakra with the final Chakra Balancing on week 8. You can book all 8 sessions or come to those you are drawn to. DATES: MARCH 05/03/24 - ROOT CHAKRA 12/03/24 - SACRAL CHAKRA 19/03/24 - SOLAR PLEXUS CHAKRA 26/03/24 - HEART CHAKRA APRIL 02/04/24 - THROAT CHAKRA 09/04/24 - THIRD EYE CHAKRA 16/04/24 - CROWN CHAKRA 23/04/24 - CHAKRA BALANCING WHAT ARE CHAKRAS: Chakras are energy centres in your body that influence your physical, emotional, and spiritual well-being. We will focus on the seven main chakras, each of which is linked to various aspects of your life, such as stability, creativity, confidence, love, communication, intuition, and spiritual connection. When your chakras are balanced, you feel healthy and harmonious, but when they are blocked or imbalanced, you may experience emotional difficulties or discomfort. In those sessions, we will: AIM OF CHAKRA HEALING JOURNEY: Those sessions are created for you to help you simply understand your chakras, and to give you powerful and easy tools that you can use in your life to increase your wellbeing.  You will also be bathed for each session in energy healing and this journey will help you shift and reset your energy. I am planning to keep it interactive and have some fun as well as incorporate some wonderful ancient healing knowledge. EXCHANGE: 8 sessions - one session is free when you commit to the whole course. Regular Price: ¬£105 Lower Wage: ¬£70  **8 sessions - one session is free when you commit to the whole course. No cancellations on this payment as it is a commitment to yourself, if you are not sure you can make all 8 we suggest going for the Pay as You Go option.** Pay as you go: One session Regular Price: ¬£15 One session Lower Wage: ¬£10 ONLY CASH PAYMENTS ACCEPTED ON THE DAY IN THE RECEPTION BEFORE THE EVENT. If you want to commit to all 8 that is paid all upfront on the first day 5th of March. Please bring enough cash with you, would be wonderful if you could do it without change to make it easier. LOCATION: We will meet in the top hall of Balham Spiritualist Church, Hamilton Court - next to the Polish Club. Restaurant. The building is white with a blue sign, on the left when you enter a big parking space just off Balham High Road.  Easy access from Tooting Bec Underground and Balham Underground and Train Station, as well as great bus service as well. 211A Balham High Road SW17 7BQ London WHAT TO BRING: We will be sitting on the chair for most comfort of everyone. This is not only a learning workshop - this is also your healing journey with chakras, you might feel some emotions coming up, energy unblocking and experience some tears and feel some light states like love and laughter as well as some uncomfortable like anger of sadness. When we rebalance our energy - all that needs to shift is shown and we have a chance to let it go and allow healing in those spaces. If you not sure if that workshop is for you - and would like to have a chat before please text me on 07752162727 and I can answer your questions. ABOUT ANNA BOJARYN Intuitive Energy Healer - Usui and Angelic Reiki Master, Teacher, Creative and in all of that regular human. :-) I have been on the Healer path and my spiritual journey since 2011.  I work with people for 1-2-1 sessions as well as host regular Sound Baths and other events in South West London. I love working with Chakras and teaching these powerful tools that you get to learn if you choose to join to people. I am finding that balancing those centres as daily or other regulars chosen by your practice can bring so much balance and different perspectives and feelings into your life.  For more information about myself visit tunewithin.co.uk I am looking forward to meeting you and holding this magical healing space for you. Hugs x Anna
Title: Chakra  Healing Journey
Subtitle: Join us to explore your Chakras - each week we will get to connect to one Chakra with balancing session at the end.

The event will kick off with a gentle warm-up before everyone sets off on their run. There‚Äôs no set pace, or distance. Just 30-minutes on your feet, looping around Clapham common‚Äîwhatever that looks like to you. Crew Captains will also be on hand to make sure you feel supported from start to finish. Expect music, lights, and plenty of party energy. After the session, stick around for more connection, post-run treats, and refreshments courtesy of Tenzing and Smart protein . Plus, an exclusive giveaway from lululemon you won't want to miss. Founded by Jake Williamson, Better The Next Day is a run crew all about chasing that post-run rush. What makes BTND different? Jake created the club to provide a safe space for anyone who wants to get moving‚Äîregardless of who they are, who they love, or how fast they run. Description: War Child presents Secret 7‚Äù War Child is bringing back the much-loved Secret 7‚Äù to provide vital support to children affected by conflict. Secret 7‚Äù takes 7 tracks from 7 musicians and presses each one 100 times onto 7‚Äù vinyl. We then invite creatives from around the world to submit artwork for the vinyl sleeves. 700 unique sleeves are exhibited at NOW Gallery, in March 2024, before being made available for sale via an online auction. The visual artist and track are a mystery until the record is sold. All proceeds will benefit War Child. Open to the public between 2nd to 17th March, the exhibition will transform NOW Gallery into a display of 700 individual sleeve designs submitted by creatives from around the world. This year‚Äôs artists include Tacita Dean, Sir Paul Smith, Rankin, Cho Hui-Chin, Jamie Hewlett, Ragnar Kjartansson, and many more. Register to Bid - Download the Peggy app to be kept updated on when the auction is open. Secret 7‚Äù Tracks for 2024 AURORA ‚Äì ‚ÄòA DIFFERENT KIND OF HUMAN‚ÄôCELESTE ‚Äì ‚ÄòSTOP THIS FLAME‚ÄôHOZIER ‚Äì ‚ÄòSWAN UPON LEDA‚ÄôSIOUXSIE & THE BANSHEES ‚Äì ‚ÄòLULLABY‚ÄôPAUL MCCARTNEY ‚Äì ‚ÄòPIPES OF PEACE‚ÄôTHE CHEMICAL BROTHERS FEAT. BECK ‚Äì ‚ÄòSKIPPING LIKE A STONE‚ÄôTHE SPECIALS ‚Äì ‚ÄòWE SELL HOPE‚Äô NOW Gallery and Greenwich Peninsula Senior Cultural Projects Manager, Kaia Charles said, ‚ÄúWe are looking forward to supporting War Child through the creative synergy of art and music. NOW Gallery is thrilled that Secret 7‚Äù is returning to Greenwich Peninsula in 2024 ‚Äì which marks the gallery‚Äôs 10th year anniversary.‚Äù ABOUT WAR CHILD War Child UK is the only specialist charity for children affected by conflict. War Child creates safe spaces for children to play, learn and access psychological support. Its aim is to reach children as early as possible when conflict breaks out and stay to support them through their recovery ‚Äì keeping them safe, helping them learn and cope with their experiences, and equipping them with skills for the future. War Child understands children‚Äôs needs, respects their rights, and puts them at the centre of the solution and campaigns for changes to policies and practices to support children in conflict, working with children and young people themselves to demand their rights. It also specialises in responding rapidly to emergency crisis situations as-they-happen, to offer immediate and critical aid to keep children safe and help them through their trauma. Together with its partners War Child UK delivers vital, life-saving work in six countries across Africa, Asia, Europe and the Middle East. In 2022 War Child supported 256,000 children and adults, and money raised from Secret 7‚Äù will help bolster that figure. www.warchild.org.uk | Registered charity number: 1071659
Title: Secret 7"
Subtitle: NOW Gallery presents Secret 7``" in collaboration with War Child

Description: Thirty minutes touring the Strand Aldwych sensor network and "living lab" including: There will also be a demonstration of the low-cost, open source FreeStation technology that we have used to monitor London's pollution environment the impacts of the pedestrianisation project, since 2020. The Strand-Aldwych FreeStation network comprises 22 monitoring stations in an area less than one-hectare, making it one of the densest networks of pollution sensors in the world. Those attending will be invited into Second Nature installation which is, in part, informed by live data from the local monitors. You may wish to spend another 15-30 mins there. The exhibition uses volumetric light to create evolving structures through the internal environment of St Mary Le Strand Church. Accompanied by an immersive spatialised speaker system, the ephemeral use of 3D space creates a unique moment for reflection and contemplation. Meet on lawn on the Strand behind St Mary le Strand church
Title: Walking Tours of the Strand Aldwych Living Lab Sensor Network
Subtitle: Join walking tours of the Strand Aldwych Living Lab Sensor Network on March 12th and 13th at 2 pm.

Refund_Policy: NA
Description: A collaboration with leading researchers at King's College London, Second Nature draws directly from the many environmental sensor stations that surround the Strand Aldwych area. The installation is driven by the real-time data generated by these sensors, mirroring invisible entanglements with the surrounding climate, including temperature, air quality, humidity, signal pollution and wind. By taking information that is invisible to the human eye and presenting it in a way that seamlessly overlays with the public realm, audiences are invited to explore a dynamic perception of space, and to critically engage with issues of climate change. The work uses volumetric light to create evolving structures through the internal environment of St Mary Le Strand Church. Accompanied by an immersive spatialised speaker system, the ephemeral use of 3D space creates a unique moment for reflection and contemplation. Rebecca Smith, an artist practicing under the name Urban Projections, has been drawing lines between the natural world, art and technology for over 20 years. Smith's practice centers around the natural environment and our place within it, aiming to reaffirm our connection to nature and each other. Often through the creation of large-scale immersive experiences, Rebecca has developed innovative methods for cross genre experimentation. This installation uses haze and flashing lights. Sound Design by CJ Mirra Production by Sterling Events Group This is a time based piece and will restart every 30mins from 10:00am - 10:00pm (excluding private events) We regret that at present there is currently no step-free access to St Mary le Strand church. This is a very important part of their ongoing restoration and development plan, but currently access to the installation is via the 9 steps of the portico at the west end of the church.
Title: Second Nature by Urban Projections
Subtitle: Volumetric Lighting and Immersive Audio

Description: We've all got things lurking in our wardrobe that could do with some TLC. Missing buttons, broken zips, drooping hems, holes, rips and tears... can they be fixed? Perhaps you have clothes that are too big, too small, too long, too short... can they be altered? Maybe you love the fabric but hate the neckline. Or you're bored with an outfit and want to give it a new lease of life because it fits so well. Let's celebrate London Repair Week by loving our clothes for longer. Save money. Save the planet. Extending the life of a garment by an extra 9 months reduces its environmental impact by 20-30%. Bring along your clean items of clothing and get free advice from our talented team. Subject to staff availability, we could help you undertake some simple repairs on the spot in return for a donation. Green Croydon Circular Economy is a registered charity, no. 1205983. Or you could sign up to one of the Textile Repair Cafe's future workshops or a 1:1 session to learn how to carry out your own repairs, a life skill that saves you money and brings a great sense of achievement. Please note that at the Croydon Textile Repair Cafe, we do not undertake repairs, alterations or customisation for you ‚Äì we teach you these skills!
Title: Repair Clinic - #RepairWeekLDN - Love Your Clothes for Longer!
Subtitle: Celebrate London Repair Week with us! Drop in to get bespoke advice on clothing repairs, alterations or customisation

Description: Experience Ainu culture as it exists today in this exploration of the contemporary lives of this indigenous people of northern Japan. Historically, members of the Ainu community were not able to fully express their distinct culture, however a movement to celebrate and sustain the Ainu language, textiles, crafts and traditions continues to gather pace, in particular among younger members of the Ainu community. Ainu Stories is a collaboration with the people of Biratori, an area located in the Saru River basin in southern Hokkaido. Through intimate video interviews and displays of contemporary Ainu works, the exhibition explores four central themes of contemporary Ainu culture: the critically endangered language; society and the preservation of the environment; Ainu textiles, song and dance; and woodcarving and tourism. The exhibition also reveals surprising historical links between the UK and Biratori, telling the stories of British travellers who forged lasting relationships with the Ainu. Ainu Stories is complemented by a rich events programme, covering dance, language, cuisine, policy and craft, and featuring guests from Biratori throughout the exhibition period.
Title: Ainu Stories: Contemporary Lives by the Saru River  (11 - 17 March)
Subtitle: Exploring the contemporary lives of this indigenous people of northern Japan

Description: Critical bleeding is still the leading cause of potentially preventable deaths in major trauma patients. Despite huge improvements in overall outcomes over the past 10 years, mortality from torso haemorrhage remains very high, and over 50% in some series. This is a national (UK & Ireland) meeting to bring together all MTCs, Air ambulances and anyone interested to discuss future management, pathways and prrotocols for bleeding management. (Worldwide attendees online are very welcome) The past year has seen two major clinical trials completed across the national trauma system ‚Äì UK-REBOA and CRYOSTAT2. What does data from these trials tell us about our current pathways and practices for major haemorrhage. What should happen now? What are the implications of these studies? How should we change our practice? And can we look to the future to improve our decisions, practices and outcomes? The aim of the event is to use results from the trials and other contemporaneous data to facilitate a national discussion regarding how they should be incorporated into practice in the UK. We will cover the bleeding pathway from prehospital care through to operative or interventional haemorrhage control. The event will be fully interactive, and we would really like to bring out the views and experiences of front-line clinicians and transfusion practitioners. Day 1 - ‚ÄúWhat Now?‚Äù will focus on results and additional data from the trials, to discuss the place of REBOA and cryoprecipitate in future pathways, and also how we can improve our practices for non-compressible haemorrhage, critical bleeding, resuscitation and coagulopathy management in general. Day 2 - ‚ÄúWhat next?‚Äù focuses on challenges in decision-making, and introduces the COMBAT-AID programmes work to bring AI decision support to these patients. Draft programme is available on the registration pagee. The event is funded by the NIHR HTA and the US DoD COMBAT AID programmes. , and will be intentionally interactive ‚Äì we would really like to hear everyone's views, thoughts and ideas. In-person attendance is limited to just over 150 attendees, and we have reserved spaces for representatives from UK & Ireland MTCs and air ambulance services. Some 40 or so additional places are available. If you would like to join us in person then please indicate whether you would like to be present in person for one or both days. We will inform you by Tuesday 27th February if we have secured space for you.The meeting will also be livestreamed so you can also register for online access.We look forward to seeing you, in person or online, and look forward to two days of intense discussion that will translate into new approaches and guidance for our patients. We look forward to seeing you, in person or online, and look forward to two days of intense discussion that will translate into new approaches and guidance for our patients. Professors Karim Brohi, Jan Jansen, Nigel Tai and Simon Stanworth (for the organizing committee) __________________________________________________________________________________________________________ MARCH 12th. DAY 1: TRAUMA HAEMORRHAGE MANAGEMENT: WHAT NOW? After UK-REBOA and CRYOSTAT-2, what now for Bleeding Control and Major Haemorrhage Protocols? 09:45: INTRODUCTION: WHY ARE WE HERE? Karim Brohi, Jan Jansen 10am SESSION 1: REBOA & UK-REBOA Presentation: UK-REBOA results (Jan Jansen) (10 mins) Panel & Audience Discussion: What was it like delivering REBOA in the trial? What were the key issues in delivery? Did it feel like it led to delays in definitive haemorrhage control? Was there a training issue? Should REBOA continue to be an option in UK MTCs? Or not? And if so, for which patients? Do we need more research? If so, what are the questions? (20 mins) (Moderator: Jan Jansen) Presentation: Prehospital REBOA (Robbie Lendrum) (5 mins) Panel & Audience Discussion: Where does the UK-REBOA trial leave prehospital REBOA? Is prehospital REBOA different from ED REBOA? Should REBOA continue to be used in the prehospital setting? Are there specific indications for REBOA outside the MTC? Do we need more research? (10 mins) (Moderator: Jan Jansen) Presentation: Military REBOA (Max Marsden, Nigel Tai) (5 mins) Panel & Audience Discussion: Where does the UK-REBOA trial leave military REBOA? Continued use? Indications? Role 1, role 2, or role 3? Training? (10 mins) (Moderator: Jan Jansen) 11:00 Coffee 11:30 SESSION 2: WHAT NOW FOR NON-COMPRESSIBLE HAEMORRHAGE? Presentations: Timelines for Haemorrhage Control Alternative strategies for NCTH Panel & Audience Discussion. For bleeding patients: are our timelines acceptable? Can they be improved? (prehospital and inhospital)? Where are the delays? Where are the opportunities? Do we need more research? What options remain for the management of NCTH? 12:30 Lunch 1:30pm SESSION 3: Cryoprecipitate, Fibrinogen & CRYOSTAT-2. Presentations: CRYOSTAT-2 Results (Nikki Curry). Fibrinogen levels (Ross Davenport) Panel and Audience Discussion. How do we incorporate Cryoprecipitate into major haemorrhage protocols given these results? Should any patients get empiric cryoprecipitate? How should treatment be guided? Is there evidence for fibrinogen concentrate? 2:30pm SESSION 4: WHAT NOW FOR COAGULOPATHY MANAGEMENT? Presentations: Timelines in CRYOSTAT-2 (Simon Stanworth) & iTACTIC (Karim Brohi) Panel and Audience Discussion: What are the perceived barriers to delivery of coagulation therapies? Should point of care testing be universal? Would some issues be mitigated by whole blood? Would moving to factor concentrates make a difference? What should happen pre-hospital? 3:30pm SESSION 5: ENGAGING PATIENTS & THE PUBLIC Presentations: A public engagement package for MTCs and Air Ambulances (James Piercy) Panel and Audience Discussion: Developing a package for local patient & public engagement. 3:45pm SESSION 6: Summary of Discussions, Key Take-Homes. 4:15pm Close Main Session 4:30pm Guideline & Stakeholder Round Table Discussion: Disseminating new evidence: How will the results of the UK-REBOA and CRYOSTAT-2 be incorporated into guidelines? How will they be disseminated to stakeholders? __________________________________________________________________________________________________________ MARCH 13th. DAY 2: MAJOR TRAUMA HAEMORRHAGE: WHAT‚ÄôS NEXT? BETTER PREDICTION, BETTER DIAGNOSIS, BETTER DECISIONS 09:15: INTRODUCTION (Nigel Tai). 09:30: SESSION 1. DECISION-MAKING IN TRAUMA HAEMORRHAGE Presentations Human-Machine Pairing (Suzie Kellet) Pre-hospital decision-making in major haemorrhage (Max Marsden, Jared Wohlgemut) Panel and Audience Discussion 11:00 Coffee 11:30 SESSION 2. AI DECISION SUPPORT IN TRAUMA HAEMORRHAGE - COMBAT AID Presentations Introduction (Zane Perkins) AI in Decision Support (Evangelia Kyrimi) COMBAT AID Models (Zane Perkins, Rebecca Stoner, Erhan Pisirir, Jared Wohlgemut) Audience Q&A 13:00 Lunch 14:00: SESSION 3: FROM CONCEPT TO IMPLEMENTATION Presentations: Machine Learning in Emergency Care From Development to Impact (Tobias Gauss) From Research to Start-up (James Moon) AI opportunities - a view from Industry (Zoll) - TBC Audience Q&A 15:20: SESSION 4: A UK RANDOMISED CONTROLLED TRIAL Presentations: Nigel Tai, Zane Perkins Audience Discussion 15:40: SUMMARY OF MEETING Nigel Tai, Jan Jansen, Karim Brohi 16:00: Close
Title: UK Major Trauma Haemorrhage: What Now? What's Next?
Subtitle: Join us on the 12th & 13th March for this national meeting to discuss the future of UK trauma haemorrhage practice, pathways and protocols.

Description: Pupils from Year 8 to Year 10 will be performing A Monster Calls in the Boyd Campbell Hall. The stage version of the bestselling classic novel. Conor has the same dream every night, ever since his mother first fell ill. But tonight is different. Tonight, when he wakes, there's a monster at his window. It's elemental, a force of nature, and it wants something from Conor. It wants the truth. Working from an original idea by Siobhan Dowd, Patrick Ness crafted an acclaimed novel of love, loss and hope. Now visionary director Sally Cookson brings this powerful story to the stage in a moving and imaginative adaptation.Suitability: A Monster Calls is a fantasy drama targeting teenagers and adults. It is an intensely emotional story of loss and grief, featuring an angry and confused 12-year-old boy whose mother has a terminal illness. This play contains some intense and emotional themes.
Title: A Monster Calls
Subtitle: Pupils from Year 8 to Year 10 will be performing A Monster Calls in the Boyd Campbell Hall.

Description: Join us for the Oxford Blockchain Conference - an exciting in-person event at the Oxford Town Hall and Wadham College (University of Oxford)! Get ready to dive into the world of blockchain technology with industry experts and enthusiasts. Explore the latest trends, innovations, and real-world applications of blockchain. Network with like-minded individuals with exclusive networking opportunities and gain valuable insights. Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to expand your knowledge and connect with the blockchain community. Mark your calendars and be part of the Oxford Blockchain Conference 2024! --- Overview: Venue & Dates: --- Description:The Oxford Blockchain Society proudly presents the Oxford Blockchain Conference 2024, a sequel to the highly successful inaugural event of 2023. This web3 conference, spanning two days, kicks off with an exclusive 'Developer‚Äôs Day', followed by the main 'Conference Day'. Our goal is to create a convergence point for founders, students, researchers, and investors, fostering education and dialogue around exciting use cases in blockchain. With a capacity to host 800 attendees on day 2, the conference is an unparalleled opportunity to network with industry pioneers and engage in enlightening discussions. Esteemed speakers from various spheres of the blockchain world will share their expertise, fostering an environment of learning and collaborative growth. Sponsors and speakers:Confirmed sponsors include EduDAO, Tagus Capital, Near Campus, LUKSO, VaultCraft, Solana and many more. Full speaker and sponsor announcements coming soon! Activities and rooms:The conference will feature a main exhibition area for networking, alongside a primary conference room and two thematic rooms: Additionally, there will be chill-out areas for relaxed networking and downtime. Audience:The conference will reach a diverse audience, including students, researchers, software developers, blockchain professionals, startup founders, investors and much more. We're collaborating with tech-related societies from Oxford and other UK universities, major blockchain communities in the UK, partner event organisers, educational institutions focused on tech and blockchain, and our VC partners. Join us for this landmark event to delve into the dynamic and evolving world of blockchain. Register now and be a part of the future! Get your tickets now! Free for students. The conference forms the Oxford Blockchain Week together with HomeDAO who are hosting EthOxford.io right before the conference (March 8th-11th).
Title: Oxford Blockchain Conference 2024
Subtitle: Join us for one of the most exciting in-person web3 events - Oxford Blockchain Conference 2024! Discussions, networking, swag and free food!

Description: This is your opportunity to learn more about Parkinson's and ask questions of the experts. We aim to cover topics such as: We are sending texts to patients of our four local surgeries who we think might be interested. We ask you to register in advance, but please pass on this notice to anyone who you think might be especially interested in learning more about Parkinson's. This event is organised by patient volunteers (Patient Group members) from the four local surgeries in Hatfield that make up the Hatfield Patient Care Network (PCN). Working together, we support the local NHS and its patients. This is the sixth in a series of talks and meetings. Future event plans include subjects such as arthritis and asthma, and we are open to suggestions. About the organisers We are always looking for new Patient Group members to help communicate information between patients and surgeries. If you would like to get involved please fill in the form on your surgery website or email us at info@hatfieldhealthmatters.org.uk
Title: Hatfield Health Matters  - Parkinson's Disease
Subtitle: Come and meet experts, talk to local support groups and other local community members affected by Parkinson's Disease

Description: Certificate: Course Completion Certificate																															  																																									     Language: English								  		  Duration: 1 Day Credits: 8 Course Delivery: Classroom / Virtual Live / On-Site Course Overview: Account Management is an important role within any organization. Account Managers are responsible for nurturing customer relationships and increasing sales with their organization's key customers. The Account Manager will usually act as a first point of contact for clients; responding to complaints, purchases, project requests and any general queries. Their approach should help maintain client relationships in order to ensure that they continue to use the company for business. This Account Management training materials are suitable for anyone that works in an account management role or relevant sales function and will assist the participants in improving their working practices, developing customer relationships and in turn increasing business performance and sales success. Course Contents: Build a strong account management team that are able to effectively manage customer relationships and drive sales The role of account manager is both important and demanding. The account manager acts as the ‚Äòface‚Äô of the business and should professionally represent the business by creating a strategy for success and delivering a high level of customer service. Account managers need to be effective communicators, needing to both engage with the client and also develop internal relationships to ensure promises are delivered upon. Another key responsibility of the account manager is to identify business opportunities and help drive business results for their company. Why is taking this Account Management training a good idea? Well, just imagine if you were better able to: Ultimately, this training will help employees to focus on what is required to succeed in the role of account manager, building a strategy with clear actions and helping the organisation to business success. Account Management can be a very challenging role depending on the number of clients, the range of industries the clients represent, and the nature and attitude of the client. The main focus of the role is to provide continual client service to clients, this may include quarterly or annual business reviews, additions to the account in terms of extra services supplied plus face-to-face and online meetings, on a regular basis. The Account Manager will also be responsible for delivering high levels of client service to ensure that clients do not leave and will need to create a strategy around this. This strategy will depend on the type of client in terms of size of the business commitment, Key Performance Indicators plus contractual agreements which may dictate the framework for the relationship. Building a personal relationship as well as a business one is key to becoming an effective Account Manager. After all, ‚ÄúIt is easier to fire a business associate or employee than it is to fire a friend‚Äù. Course Topics: Case Study 1 ‚Äì A Multi-National Company ‚Äì Exploring the themes covered so far and introducing new learning points. Portfolio Analysis ‚Äì Assessing different accounts and defining key account attractiveness based on specific criteria. This helps identify potential customer growth rate, value and profit potential. Includes a review of existing accounts. Setting Performance Metrics ‚Äì Looking at lifetime value metrics for clients and measuring account management achievements. Understanding different performance metrics such as; client retention, revenue growth, relationship growth, profit margin, client satisfaction and how these can be set. Measuring Performance ‚Äì Completing a survey to establish how well current business metrics are being met and what gaps there may be. Understanding the challenge to measuring business metrics and the solutions we can put in place to deal with them. Case Study 2 ‚Äì A Local Organisation ‚Äì Exploring the themes covered so far and introducing new learning points. Key Account Plans ‚Äì Using these important tools to help build and maintain successful accounts. These help; identify strategic clients and accounts, track revenue against target, define strategy and targets, identify risks and implement corrective action where required. This section includes pan templates and a chance to practice understanding. Summary Activity ‚Äì Bringing it all together and establishing knowledge retention. Learning Logs and Action Planning ‚Äì Setting actions for further development.This course is highly interactive and contains exercises and activities to help keep you engaged and to ensure learning is embedded. Course Feature: At the end of this Account Management training you will be able to: Who can Attend? Anybody who is interested in learning Account Management Skills. Certification: Once after the training you receive a course completion certificate from Academy for Pros. Note: However, catering to the demands of busy professionals, our virtual training programs are as effective as face-to-face learning. Their approach should help maintain client relationships in order to ensure that they continue to use the company for business. This Account Management training materials are suitable for anyone that works in an account management role or relevant sales function and will assist the participants in improving their working practices, developing customer relationships and in turn increasing business performance and sales success. The account manager acts as the ‚Äòface‚Äô of the business and should professionally represent the business by creating a strategy for success and delivering a high level of customer service. Account managers need to be effective communicators, needing to both engage with the client and also develop internal relationships to ensure promises are delivered upon. Another key responsibility of the account manager is to identify business opportunities and help drive business results for their company. Why is taking this Account Management training a good idea? Forget small spaces, darkness, and spiders, standing up in front of a crowd and talking is far more terrifying for most people. Through this workshop your participants will become more confident and relaxed in front of an audience which will translate into a successful speaking event. Leading Effective Teams Training: This training based on leading teams will help you to develop anyone that leads a team or is involved in a leadership role. It is also useful for those that are about to embark on a position of leadership or need to develop their leadership skills. Train the Trainer Training: Whether you are preparing to be a professional trainer, or you are someone who does a bit of training as a part of their job, you always want to be prepared. Your participants will understand that training is a process where skills, knowledge, and attitudes are applied in a unique way. Presentation Skills Training: In a survey carried out amongst experienced, middle and senior executives, designed to determine the things that they feared most, public speaking came out as number one. Death was eighth on the list! So, most of us would rather die than stand up and present! Practical Sales Skills Training: These practical sales skills training has been developed for salespeople or people who are required to sell as part of their role. This course is applicable for both people relatively new to sales as well as those who have a lot of experience as the content is flexible enough to adapt to suit the audience. Conflict Management Training: Disagreements, differences of opinion and conflicting perspectives on key issues inevitably arise in any context where people are working together. Research has shown that workplace conflicts can become highly destructive. Negative emotions may be stirred up, poisoning team morale, creating stress and destroying relationships. Power Query and Power Pivot for Excel Training: Power BI (including Power Query & Power Pivot) are the biggest Excel news items in the last 10 years. They give Excel users the power to draw information out of multiple sources, link it together then perform calculations on it that can then be sliced & diced any way you want. To be successful, every organisation needs good managers. Manager Management  Training: With this course, you will be able to provide the skills, guidance, and empowerment to your team of managers. They will then be better suited in leading and motivating their team and thus produce fantastic results. To be a successful manager means having a wide range of skills. Through this workshop, you will be able to disperse your knowledge and experience throughout your leadership team. The world's fastest growing and most successful businesses have one thing in common: they have effective sales people that drive their business forward. Time Management Training: Personal time management skills are essential for professional success in any workplace. Those able to successfully implement time management strategies are able to control their workload rather than spend each day in a frenzy of activity reacting to crisis after crisis - stress declines and personal productivity soars! These highly effective individuals are able to focus on the tasks with the greatest impact to them and their organization. Description: It is springtime in Colchester. The season of rebirth. Flowers begin to bloom and life restarts after the hibernation of winter. Look around. The signs of spring are all around you, even in Colchester city centre. You are going on a scavenger hunt for spring time. You are going to be looking for nature and the signs of spring all around Colchester. You are going to be looking for plants and animals. You might be surprised how many are all around you. The route you‚Äôre going to follow in the city is sprinkled with unique places, fun clues and challenges, and incredible stories. The experience will play out like you‚Äôre the main characters of a movie, only that you‚Äôre experiencing everything in first person! Fun dialogue, intrigue, and unexpected interactions are guaranteed. HOW IT WORKS‚ùì 1. Book your tickets üé´ 2. Download the Questo app - it's free üì≤ 3. Head to the starting pointüìç WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO The game is an interactive activity where you are guided by a mobile app through the city. With it, you follow directions and solve very fun puzzles, riddles, and cryptic codes. During the game, you will also visit popular and hidden places in the city while learning fun (and we mean it) stories about them. This is a storytelling experience just as much. The people doing these city exploration games gave them an average rating of 4.7/5 around the world. Join the playground too! ------------------ More about Questo üö∂‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Questo is an urban entertainment platform offering thematic real-world exploration games. It is currently available in over 150 cities üåé and has entertained hundreds of thousands of players already. As of today, the app offers more than 400 different experiences created by a growing network of local content creators and event organizers.
Title: Easter Scavenger Hunt Colchester: Outdoor Escape Game
Subtitle: Follow clues, solve puzzles, discover new places and learn incredible stories during this city adventure.

Description: Certificate: Course Completion Certificate Language: English Duration: 1 Day																						   Credits: 8 Course Delivery: Classroom/ Virtual Live / Onsite Course Overview: We all know an angry face when we see one. Anger is such a universal and powerful emotion that can make you physically and emotionally ill, sap your energy, and poison your relationships or it can motivate you to make needed changes and add vitality to your life. This training program aims to help you adopt a more constructive attitude towards your anger and to more effectively manage anger in others as well. Practical activities and tools will empower those who act out their anger in negative ways to gain better control of their anger and their lives and use it as a tool to motivate and empower them to affirm their integrity or boundaries. The program will encourage participants to look deep inside to explore the roots of their anger and present alternatives to the old ways of thinking and dealing with anger. Target Audience: Anybody who is interested in learning Anger Management Skills. Description: British Science Week TalksWe are hosting a British Science Week lecture series this year, with our second talk being provided by the Computer Science department at Royal Holloway, University of London and supported by the Computing Society. This talk is open to everyone at Royal Holloway, University of London and is accessible in content to anyone studying any subject - from arts and humanities, to the physical sciences, everyone is welcome! Talk Title:The Limits of Computer Science!About the Talk:We cannot have what we want, and the world is a better world because of it. Speaker:Dr Francisco Ferreira RuizAbout the Speaker:Currently a Lecturer in Department of Computer Science. Before Royal Holloway, he worked as a Research Associate at Imperial College London a job that he started soon after finishing his PhD at McGill University in Canada. He enjoys thinking about the correctness of computer programs through approaches based on programming languages and logic.
Title: British Science Week, The Computer Science Talk
Subtitle: Join us for our second talk of the 2024 British Science Week series with a Computer Science talk on Tuesday, 12th of March!

Description: Hello campers! ü•≥üéàüéâ Our next meetup will be at Wimbletech, an affordable co-working and private office space and network for locals and communities in 10 London locations. We're very grateful to them for hosting us! We're also thankful to our new event sponsor, Othership, a platform to work the Other way with flexible workspaces, weekly events, member benefits & a welcoming community. Please note that by signing up for this event on Eventbrite you agree to share your name and email address with Othership. Join us from 6pm in Wimbledon to learn more about freeCodeCamp, continue your coding study and meet new and familiar faces. Tell us what you're studying or working on and hopefully we can help each other! Light refreshments will be provided. Afterwards, we'll continue networking at one of the many bars near by. Just like the freeCodeCamp platform, attendance to this meetup is always free. The room has a capacity of around 20 people. Generally about half of people who sign up drop out, so there will be an attendee limit to 40. Please be aware that this may mean if you arrive much later than 6:00 pm we could be full so do cancel your ticket if you cannot make it. If you can't make it, stay connected with our Slack group here: https://tinyurl.com/y6ptcwdg Venue Accessibility There are a set of stairs to get to the space. Unfortunately, the lift to the space is only in use until 6pm from the Library entrance, and so will be out of use on the day. How to find us The venue is Wimbletech (behind the Wimbledon library) and is a 1 minute walk from Wimbledon station (20 mins on mainline train from Waterloo Station, District, Thameslink). Please take the entrance on Compton Road (Wimbletech Zone 2) and not the library entrance. COVID-19 Safety Measures Event will be indoors. Under current England COVID-19 guidelines, we're expecting everyone to self-test and avoid attendance if they've tested positive for COVID-19. The venue will have hand sanitizers. About Wimbletech If you‚Äôre looking for an alternative to working home alone, from the coffee shop or even the ‚Äòcommute‚Äò, Wimbletech have Fixed, Flexi + private office spaces for individuals and teams starting from as little as ¬£3/day. About Othership Work the Other way. This is the flo‚Ä¢working‚Ñ¢Ô∏è revolution - for flexible workspaces, weekly events, member benefits & a welcoming community across London and UK, check out Othership and try for free. For more info about this meetup and event, read the FAQ here: https://github.com/freeCodeCampLondon/meetup-faq Bring your laptop if you have one. All coding levels are welcome.
Title: freeCodeCamp London Meetup
Subtitle: Official freeCodeCamp meetup in London. Come and learn to code, work through the freeCodeCamp curriculum and meet other developers!

Description: About Borough - Southwark Southwark is a bustling borough in London, home to well-known businesses like PwC, EY, and the Financial Times. The Greater London Authority is also based in the area. With major retail concentrations, #Southwark is a hotspot for economic development. There are valuable opportunities there for professionals like you. #Borough, located in South London, offers a prime location for networking due to its central position, diverse business community, cultural attractions like Borough Market and the Globe Theatre, excellent transport links, and a vibrant atmosphere that fosters community spirit. #NetworkingEvents and #MeetUps are abundant in the area, providing opportunities to connect with professionals from various industries and backgrounds. Come along to expand your professional networks and explore business opportunities. Networking at Uncommon Join us at BNI Metropolis at Borough, Southwark. It is a weekly networking event and is the perfect opportunity to meet other #businessowners and like-minded people in the area. We only allow one founder per industry, so you do not need to worry about your competition when introducing your services and products. Come and experience what is like to be part of the group. We have created a very collaborative environment and referrals are passed to each other regularly giving people a bigger chance to win business. We host the networking event at Uncommon Borough CoWorking Space every Tuesday morning. It is ¬£25.00 per person to be paid at the door. Feel free to invite your connections to come along. You are all welcome! Description:
If you've ever felt there was something holding you back in life, ruining your plans and stopping you from being who you want to be you were right.
 The fact is there is a single source of all your problems, stress, unhappiness and self-doubt. 
 It's called the Reactive Mind, the hidden part of your mind that stores all your negative experiences and then uses them against you. 
 Dianetics gets rid of the Reactive Mind, it's the only thing that does.
 Come to this free one hour lecture on Dianetics and how the mind works.

Description: Baby & Toddler Group Join us for a fun-filled gathering, open to all! Our Baby & Toddler Group is the perfect opportunity for parents and little ones to socialise and make new friends. Description: LOLipops is a friendly and fun night run by lovers of comedy - bringing you the best free entertainment in London. We are an established comedy night that have been running for over 5 years!Come on down to Southwark for an awesome hour of stand-up and sketch comedy with an eclectic mix of the finest acts of the UK comedy scene! A veritable comedy selection box containing newer acts and professional acts trying new material. We often get TV comedians dropping in to try new material so you never know who you might see. In just the last year we've had some amazing TV acts including Viggo Venn, Clinton Baptiste, Yoshi Obayashi, Holly Burn, Joe Jacobs, Kevin Eldon, Angelos Epithemiou, Simon Munnery, Marlon Davis, Will Franken, David Whitney, Alan Francis, Fiona Allen, and Catherine Bohart! Who knows who we will have popping in to try out stuff when you come! We have 2 shows - an early show (6.30 - 7.30) and a late show (8 - 9). Shows feature different comedians and different jokes! So come along and see the stars of tomorrow and the stars of today trialing the jokes of tomorrow! HOW TO GET HERE! By Tube Southwark is our nearest tube station, served by the Jubilee line. From the station, exit south on Blackfriars Rd/A201 towards The Cut, turn left onto Union St/B300, then turn left onto Great Suffolk St and walk 400 yards - you‚Äôll spot the pub on your left. By Train Blackfriars is our closest mainline station (five minutes‚Äô walk away), while Waterloo and London Bridge stations are also within easy reach (10 minutes).
Title: LOLipops Comedy at the White Hart Southwark - Late Show
Subtitle: A brilliant hour of comedy featuring a great mix of professionals trying out new stuff and newer comedy acts.

Description: Looking for a stress-busting, fun vocal workout? Come join our weekly choir rehearsals every Tuesday evening! We are a friendly, non-auditioning and inclusive community choir based in Balham. Whether you‚Äôre a shower singer, have sung with choirs in the past or are an experienced singer, people of all singing abilities are welcome to join us! You don‚Äôt need to be able to read sheet music. Led by professional vocal coach and entertainer MJ Paranzino, we sing everything from Mozart to ABBA, gospel to swing, musicals to new contemporary songs and more! We also have a range of exciting performance opportunities each year including singing at major music venues and festivals! Description: Our Comunity Choir rehearses every Tuesday evening with a conductor and pianaist. We welcome everyone - we have a wide age range. and (being central London) members from lots of countries. We provide the music. We welcome all, whatever your level. We believe that singing together is good for our mental health and a great social activity. We sing all sorts - songs from Musicals, pop arrangements, classical ( Madrigals , church music ) , folk arrangements....and of course Chrstmas songs and carols in the winter term. We sing in unison and in harmony and offer people short solos!  We usually have a concert every term and add other events - five carol events in 2023! We are a very social choir and have a couple of short socials after rehearsing every term, and a social after every concert.

Description: One important factor in improving your efficiency is to work on your self-development. When you take the time to understand your strengths, weaknesses, and areas for improvement, you can develop strategies to overcome obstacles and increase your productivity. For example, if you struggle with procrastination, you can learn time management techniques or use tools to help you stay focused and on track. In order to increase your efficiency in business, it's also important to set clear goals and priorities. This means identifying the most important tasks and projects that will help you achieve your objectives, and focusing your energy on those activities. You can use tools such as to-do lists, calendars, and project management software to help you stay organized and on track. Finally, remember that improving your efficiency is an ongoing process. It requires ongoing self-reflection, experimentation, and adaptation as you learn what works best for you. By continually working to increase your efficiency, you can become a more productive and successful person in both your personal and professional life.
Title: Gain skills in self development and business - Free Workshop
Subtitle: Learn how to Improve your self-awareness and emotional intelligence which can also help you in business. Free Workshop

Description:
The library possesses approximately 4,000 volumes covering a wide range of general educational, historical and cultural topics relating to Japan, some in English and others in Japanese. Government publications, mainly from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, are also available.
 
 In addition, visitors can view the following publications: Asahi Shimbun Japanese-language newspaper (monthly bound volumes from 1986), The Japan Times English-language newspaper (monthly bound volumes from 1980), and certain other Japan-related periodicals.
 
 You can search our library catalogues using the National Institute of Informatics (CiNii) website.
 
 You can also search the main Japan-related libraries in the UK here.
Organizer: Embassy of Japan in the UK
Title: JICC Library
Subtitle: The main function of the JICC library is to promote Japanese culture to the general public in the UK

Description: Improving both your weaknesses and strengths in your mindset can help you achieve personal growth, success, and happiness. Focusing on your strengths can enhance your self-confidence and motivation, leading to higher performance and greater accomplishments. Meanwhile, acknowledging and addressing your weaknesses can help you overcome obstacles and challenges that may hold you back. It's essential to develop a growth mindset, which involves the belief that you can improve and grow through effort and dedication. This mindset allows you to embrace challenges, learn from failures, and continuously develop your abilities and skills. To improve your weaknesses and strengths, start by identifying them through self-reflection, feedback from others, or assessments. Then, set specific and achievable goals that align with your values and vision. Practice consistent effort, seek out learning opportunities, and hold yourself accountable for your progress. Remember to celebrate your successes and learn from your mistakes to cultivate a positive and resilient mindset.
Title: Improve your Weaknesses and Strengths In Your Mindset - Free Event
Subtitle: Take this personality test to see what needs improving in your life. You will be shocked how accurate it is!

Description: Built as a wooden retreat at the far end of his garden in Stockholm in 1747 and serving as a focal point for his writing and otherworldly conversations, Swedenborg's lusthus (or summerhouse) has come to stand as an emblematic presence of his visionary legacy for over 250 years. Described as early as 1766 as ‚Äòa kind of temple, to which [Swedenborg] often retired for contemplation‚Äô with ‚Äòdim religious light‚Äô it has since been used as a shed for storage, a hideout for a gang of thieves, a house of repose, the site of musical performances and poetry incantations, and also as a filmic backdrop. Today it sits in Skansen, the Open-Air Museum in Stockholm, and is the only known building still standing commissioned by the author himself. Drawing on rare items from the Swedenborg Collection and showcasing newly commissioned photographs by Bridget Smith and Anonymous Bosch plus other installed works by John Christie, Mark Riley, Ben Wickey and others, this exhibition explores the unique conditions of this enigmatic eighteenth-century building and the broader question of the relationship between place, dwelling and visionary states. The exhibition is curated by the Society‚Äôs Museum Director Stephen McNeilly and coincides with the launch of a new book of the same name. For more information on the new book please click here. ARNE BI√ñRNSTAD (1924-2012) was a writer and former museum curator of the cultural history department at the Skansen Foundation in Stockholm. In 1974 he received an award from the St Erik Association‚Äîan organization aiming to promote knowledge of the history of Stockholm and preserve the city‚Äôs culture and aesthetics. ANONYMOUS BOSCH is a photographer, cinematographer and filmmaker. He is known for his work on Sea Fever (2012), By Our Selves (2015) Aisling She√≤rais Mhicdh√≤mhnaill (George Macdonald‚Äôs Dreams) (2015) and The Whalebone Box (2019). JOHN CHRISTIE is a visual artist, broadcast filmmaker, and maker of artists‚Äô books. He has produced more than 20 limited editions for Circle Press and Objectif, and is a founding member of the award-winning East Anglian publisher Full Circle Editions. Alongside John Berger, he co-authored the award-winning book I Send You This Cadmium Red. MARK RILEY is an artist, writer, and senior Lecturer in Photography at the University of Roehampton. He has exhibited installation projects at the Manchester Metropolitan University, The APT Gallery and the Oxford House Gallery. He has also written widely on Heidegger, Tarkovsky and place. BRIDGET SMITH is a London-based artist represented by Frith Street Gallery. She has exhibited her work internationally, featuring in public collections in Austria, Spain, Mexico, the USA and the UK (including the V&A and the Scottish National Gallery of Modern Art). BEN WICKEY is an artist, writer, and animator from Cape Ann, Massachusetts. His illustrations can be found in such books as Ki Longfellow‚Äôs The Illustrated Vivian Stanshall and Alan Moore and Steve Moore‚Äôs The Moon and Serpent Bumper Book of Magic. STEPHEN MCNEILLY is an editor, writer, artist, curator and museum director of Swedenborg House, and one of the leading scholars on Swedenborg in the UK. He has curated numerous exhibitions and events, the most recent being Concerning an Idea about Place (2023) and is the editor of numerous books including Swedenborg‚Äôs Lusthus.
Title: Exhibition: Swedenborg's Lusthus
Subtitle: Part reliquary, part sanctum and part tourist attraction, Swedenborg‚Äôs lusthus has long been an object of pilgrimage and curiosity.

Description:
If you've ever felt there was something holding you back in life, ruining your plans and stopping you from being who you want to be you were right.
 The fact is there is a single source of all your problems, stress, unhappiness and self-doubt.

 Come to this free one hour lecture on Dianetics and how the mind works.

Description: Negative thoughts, self-doubt, and insecurities are all interconnected experiences that can impact our mental and emotional well-being. Negative thoughts are a form of thinking that focuses on the perceived downsides or potential problems in a situation or circumstance. Self-doubt involves a lack of confidence or trust in one's abilities, decisions, or actions. Insecurities refer to feelings of self-doubt, uncertainty, and anxiety about one's self-image, abilities, or relationships with others. These experiences can be triggered by various factors such as past experiences, societal pressures, and personal beliefs. They can lead to a negative cycle of thinking and behavior, which can affect our self-esteem, relationships, and overall quality of life. It's essential to recognize and address negative thoughts, self-doubt, and insecurities to overcome them and foster a more positive and fulfilling mindset.
Title: Negative Thoughts? Self Doubt? Insecurities?  - What To Do About Them!
Subtitle: Come along to this free event and learn more about your mind and Negative Thoughts, Self Doubt and Insecurities!

Description: This session is open ONLY to families living in London Borough of Redbridge with children  from walking to 4 years (under 8 years if the child has special educational needs and disabilities).   ENTRY INFORMATION. Please report to reception 5 minutes before and no later than 10 minutes after the start time as your place will be given to another family if they are waiting to attend. PLEASE NOTE. Whilst in the Children's Centre, your child remains your full responsibility at all times.  PHONE POLICY. No phone calls are to be taken inside playroom. If you need to take a call, please remove yourself along with your child and go outside the playroom.  PHOTO TAKING POLICY. You can take photos of your own child/ren during the session on the condition that YOU make sure NO other child/ren is/are included in the photo you are taking. This is to make sure other children‚Äôs privacy is respected and they are safeguarded. VIDEO RECORDING POLICY. Video recording is not permitted. FOOD AND DRINK POLICY. No food or drinks are allowed in the sessions. However, you can bring water with you. There is also a private Baby Feeding space where you can enjoy a quieter infant feeding experience, but you are also welcome to breastfeed in any of the public areas.

Subtitle: Fun interactive rhyme time session.  For children from walking to 4 years old.
